reviewText: I've had my heart broken several times in my life. Once, on Christmas Day 1989, I eagerly ran downstairs and gasped at the sight of what was clearly a crudely but lovingly wrapped skateboard. A skateboard that I had wanted ever since I had seen Marty McFly cruise through the streets of Hill Valley as a stowaway behind an unsuspecting SUV driver. A skateboard with a custom deck, with artwork that would cause my fellow skaters to shout rad". A skateboard whose wheels would send me gliding across the streets as I headed for the nearest half-pipe. A skateboard of majestical proportion.\n\nI grabbed it
date: and with shaking hands and a heart beating against my chest

reviewText:
MORALS AND IDEALS

As most of you know, this game was basically announced as an AAA game with next gen graphics, and ended up a (at the time) bug-ridden B-list game with last gen graphics. Many people were understandably upset about this, especially those who pre-ordered. If you don't wish to do business with a company that found itself in a lawsuit claiming false advertising, more power to you for your ideals.

THE GAME

I played this in Jan 2015 after some massive patches, and after the game was on sale for $5. At this point, I experienced the game as practically bug-free, except for the astonishing fact that the game still won't let you go: When I quit the game, it is immediately restarted (wrong exit code or something?). Restarting Steam too helps, but it's a bit ridiculous. On the upside: no game-breaking or fun-killing bugs while I played.

STORY MODE

The game is pretty straight forward in that there are no optional side-missions, and the level design is such that in campaign mode, it is extremely rare that there is more than one way to get from A to B. Gameplay-wise, it's a squad shooter in that your avatar is hardly ever alone, yet you cannot give orders to non-player squadmates. The campaign is open to 1-4 players, but incomprehensibly, players can't configure their avatar; they're assigned a premade one even though only one of them appears in cut scenes or has any dialog. The loadout however is still configurable.

VERSUS

Two teams of 1-5 players each can face off in various aliens vs marines modes; for this, you can configure the look and loadout of your avatar (including male/female - there's also a Movie Characters DLC with 4 chars none of which is female. Maybe Ripley was too expensive to license, but where's my Vasquez??).

CHALLENGES

Apart from Steam Achievements (some of which are for the sole story DLC, Stasis Interrupted), ACM features challenges. Proceeding in the story or meeting challenges results in more customization options (some purely cosmetic, others ways to make the various guns more powerful, though squads with players on different levels seem unproblematic).

These suffer from having a required order -- you won't get credit for a challenge that isn't up yet. Also, there are challenges that require other players outside the Versus" challenge category

reviewText:
When this came out it was terrible. Absolutely terrible.   If you were a fan of the Movie, you could get alot out of it just for the nerd-out factor of being on-set, but other than that the gameplay was like a bad COD rip-off, the aliens were NOT scary or hard, and the WY Mercs were frustratingly good at soaking up bullets. The graphics were occasionaly pause-and-look-worthy but most of it was a letdown.

I have now been modding the game for 2 months and I am up to version 4 of my mod at this time.
I've fixed alot of the graphical issues with how the game was configured, removed Console related restrictions, and set things to match todays computers (this is an Unreal game). I've also spent time with some of the cooler set-pieces to make them even cooler.
I have reworked the Xenomorph AI to be fast, smart, sneaky and deadly, the Merc AI to be less robot like and more vulnerable and the Ally AI better at combat and positioning.
Weapons have all been reworked to feel like real world weapons and more varied and powerful.
How you move, and how the first person view functions has been changed to give a better sense of motion and urgency, the HUD no longer shifts around the screen moving your cross-hair, and you can turn the whole HUD off.

You get the Smart-Gun about 5 times now. That alone makes the game heaps better!

If you are a fan of Aliens and see this on sale, buy it, install my mod and enjoy a fantastic Aliens experience

reviewText:
If you meet the following criteria, you will possibly enjoy this game:

1) You paid $5 or less for this.
2) You only bought it for the single player campaign.
3) You can overlook that the game did not meet its launch expectations.
4) You are a fan of the Aliens franchise.
5) As a fan of the franchise you can overlook many of the implausible settings the game uses.

If you can pass all that, then you have a chance at enjoyment.

*Spoilers*

The game is basically sticking you in the role of a Colonial Marine and having you retread the sights of LV-426.  You'll walk the halls of the U.S.S Sulaco, you will land at Hadley's Hope, you will explore Operations and in the end you will even visit the Engineer ship where the franchise began.

Each area is pretty much a giant easter egg filled with tiny easter eggs.  You'll stumble over the spent sentry guns from the Aliens director's cut, one still containing 10 rounds.  You'll find the room where Burke, Carter J. met his cowardly end.  The medical bay where Ripley and Newt were attacked by face-huggers is here as well, with overturned beds and bullet-shattered glass.  While crawling through the sewers you can even find the head of Newt's doll that we last saw floating sadly on the water.

That said, a lot of plausibility of those easter eggs was sacrificed in the name of coolness.  Sure, it's cool to pick up Hicks' shotgun but why is No Fate" carved into it?  Sure I get it
date: same actor but why would Dwayne Hicks scratch that on his darling for close encounters?\n\nAs far as the gameplay itself goes
recommended: it is clunky but passable.  You will either overlook it because you like Aliens that much or you will turn the game off after 5 minutes.  Or perhaps you will do both - I myself played for 5 minutes before putting it down for a year.  When I played it again I beat it all the way through just out of curiosity.  Found myself slightly entertained though
hoursPlayed: I admit
voteText: more by the settings and the little things than the actual story.\n\nOn that note

votesTotal: shown over and over again via easter eggs.  If you fit the bill than I recommend this title to you!"

reviewText:
Are you a fan of the Alien franchise? Are you one of the many gamers that eagerly awaited the release of this game since it's announcement in 2004? If yes to the above, prepare to be severely disappointed.
Aliens: Colonial Marines is a first person shooter that acts as a sequel to the 1986 sci-fi classic, Aliens. The game follows a USCM Marine named Winter, along with his utterly boring and unmemorable companions. The plot has Winter and the Marines of the USS Sephora returning to LV426 to investigate the disappearance of Ripley and her companions from the original film.
The story of this game is a senseless mess, and at times, makes no sense whatsoever. A character that was explained dead in the film makes an appearance in this game ( his magical reappearance isn't explained at all by the way) and ridiculous events will occur to keep the game moving at Michael Bay pace. None of the characters are remotely likeable or memorable, and they certainly frustrated me to the point of turning the game off. All of these problems could have been fixed if more attention had been paid to the writing process of this game. Or the whole game for that matter.
The gameplay doesn't fare much better than the writing of this game. Most of the guns feel like airsoft equivalents, and the shooting in question feels tedious and lacks tension. The enemy AI is woefully poor, and most of the time you'll face off against human enemies rather than the xenomorphs themselves. The level design is boring and linear, and all the indoor locations feel like the same grey corridor you went through just a few moments ago. The outside levels impress you at first, until you realise they are just as linear and restricting as the indoor ones.
This game's only saving grace is its multiplayer mode. There are a variety of game modes, many of which are creative and innovative for the FPS genre; but although these are alot of fun, they're let down somewhat by the overall poor gameplay mechanics. It's a shame this doesn't provide the quality that'd easily help it compete with the likes of Natural Selection 2.
As an Aliens fan, I am very disappointed. Save your money eveyone, there's an awesome Alien game coming out in 2014 called Alien: Isolation. Save your money. 4 / 10.

reviewText:
This one really hurts.

As a lifelong fan of the Alien franchise, I've had to put up with some terrible uses of the license. The first film I watched was Alien 3. I willingly paid money for the Playstation version of Alien: Resurrection. I've gone through the janky platformer/shoot-em-up versions of Aliens on the earliest consoles. I even suffered through Prometheus.

Yet, for all that, there was one game I was absolutely convinced would be quality - Aliens: Colonial Marines. On the surface, it seemed like such a sure-win proposition - Gearbox Software helming an FPS that pays tribute to all the militaristic aspects of the Alien universe, wrapped up in the kind of quality they're known for. You can't miss with that, right?

What a shame, then, that the final product is such a mishmash of ideas. I know about the accounts of development - the multiple developers all having a hand in it, the half-baked storyline that was rewritten continuously through production, the lies and disingenuous marketing - but for all that, is there any good to be found in the game?

Colonial Marines puts you into the (combat) boots of Cpl. Christopher Winter, an everyman protagonist who is part of the crew of the Sephora, a combat warship that is dispatched to intercept the USS Sulaco after receiving a distress call from Cpl. Dwayne Hicks, one of the survivors of Aliens. Sent into the Sulaco to rendezvous with other members of the Sephora Marines, Winter not only discovers another xenomorph infestation, but also the influence of Weyland-Yutani, who are working to breed a queen for their own needs.

Honestly, that's all the plot you need to know, because the following ten levels are an intermittent battle against the xenomorphs coupled with Call of Duty-lite shooting galleries against W-Y mercs in settings from the film. There was a lot of potential here - fighting through the bowels of the Sulaco (in locations that were built from production notes and sketches), going back to the now bombed-out Hadley's Hope colony - but it's all wasted via terrible AI, weak story hooks, weak graphics, etc.

This truly looks like a game that could have been made in the late 90's - and it shows. All the worst vices of FPS games from that era are on full display here: armor pickups that inexplicably restore it, even if you pick up seven chestpieces in a row; a weird hybrid between only being able to carry a limited amount of weapons" and "every weapon is on you at the same time anyway"; enemies that make a beeline towards you and act like morons in melee combat; enemies that have health pickups explode like a pinata out of their body when they die
recommended: etc.\n\nThe characters aren't any better. Bella is already a dead (wo)man walking when you first see her
hoursPlayed: and you don't have any reason to give a s*** about her plight. O'Neil veers between being alternately whiny and arrogant

votesTotal:
there's...

Corporal Hicks himself

***SPOILERS END***

That's not to say it's all bad

reviewText:
This is difficult for me to say, but it has to be said. I've loved the alien franchise since i was 4 years old (26 now) so for me to say no on this hits home quite hard on this one. I shall explain why through pros, cons. and overall at the end.

Before i start, let me say this. I Recommend this game but only for the die hard alien franchise fans and people that love playing the role of a colonial marine and also only if you are prepared to see the worst 'official' canon to a franchise in history (Seriously, the storyline is that bad).

Now, onto the Pros and Cons.

PROS:
1. It's in the alien universe. Between colonies being based on moons, exploration into space, and the fact that the alien is such a terrifying creature by nature it's fun to have a go at killing them. And your a Colonial Marine with a Pulse Rifle and array of weaponry. Cool!

2. Revisiting places form the 2nd film is cool (Even though the blast would of cleared everywhere that the game is set.)

3. The music and sounds are true to the film and do slightly absorb you into the atmosphere (Where there is any).

4. The multiplayer (If you can find a game) is actually quite entertaining and fun. It's slightly more biased to the alien side in my opinion, however it is fun. It is truly the saving grace of this game.

5. Stasis Interupted and Bug Hunt are actually quite good pieces of DLC. Although many argue Bug Hunt should of been part of the actual game and not DLC it's actually worth the price (Fans + New Game = Money money money)

6. The Co-op Campaign is actually decent fun with friends/randoms.

7. If your a massive aliens fan, you bare the game out (Pulse Rifles baby! lol). You go on the Sulaco, LV-42, the Derelict e.t.c. which is pretty neat.

CONS:
1. The storyline (from the viewpoint of a hardcore alien franchise view) is pitiful and pathetically executed at best. It's disgusting to think that gearbox could do what they did to the franchise.

2. The gameplay is basic - it's a 'too linear' shooter which has nothing original or new to offer the aliens series or gamers in general.

3.  The mulltiplayer died after 2 weeks of release. This was the games saving grace (As mentioned in pros) The only surviving Multiplayer is lingering among steam groups and they are only hosted here and there at best.

4. Nothing like it's demo trailer. This has been said over and over again website to website forum to forum - but really when it was released and your expecting this kick-♥♥♥ segment and it turns into poo...come on gearbox.

5. Graphically it looks good...if it was released in 2007. This really isn't a pro or con, but come on SEGA/gearbox, the hell!

6. It's such a cop out to the franchise. The alien is surposed to be this creature of terrifying appearance and presence, yet you do not feel scared by it at all. I get it, it's a shooter, but...the alien...and also the different types of alien are so bland (Drone Spitter Lurker) - i mean come on, AYFKM (Are You F**ing Kidding Me) SEGA/Gearbox.

7.Given it's development history, it's no surprise that the game was in shambles. Between going from one company to another company to another company not all the blame can be put on gearbox, just 90% of it.

8. To this day, i still say that the lack of dedicated servers are what lead to the true demise for the multiplayer. People copped the lack of authentic weaponry for the marines, the lack of not feeling like the same alien no matter the class, but some dedicated servers guys!! They could of at least done this for us.

9. Sweet lord, the AI is absolute rubbish. I mean it's Daikatana meets COD AI. It's just.....ugh. The AI in the 1999 AVP was better than this.

10. If your like me, and paid full price on release day for this game, you felt jipped.

OVERALL:
If you like/love the aliens franchise, you'll bare this game. It's worth $10, The DLC is great, the multiplayer is fun, but there are so many drawbakcs that it will halter the good time you have on it.

P.S. - F*** you Gearbox. Eat a D*** Sandwich Randy Pitchford.

reviewText:
Flawed & unfinished
+ Franchise-loyal locations & set designs, virtually all are well-designed
+ Several areas of the game boast a solid & tense atmosphere
+ Great soundtrack & sound deisgn; most of the sound effects come direct from the films
+ Weapon personalization is extensive; game is successful in making for a satisfying experience when unlocking & implementing features
+ Collectibles are scattered throughout the environment; audio logs & legendary weapons (tips of the hat from the film) are the only ones that feel worth the effort, however

- Aliens are like rigid automotons, with seemingly barren AI
- Poor story & writing; several character actions are devoid of reasoning, & the 'plot twist' was shallow at best
- Terrible characters & personalities, even for an FPS
- Allies' behavior in combat is universally atrocious
- Xenomorphs are little better than a side-note, with most of the game's enemies being humans
- Limited replayability
- Multiplayer appears to be effectively dead
- Myriad bugs & glitches, seemingly never addressed

reviewText:
Failiens: Colonial O`Neil

It is a really sad and emotional story of a man and comrade, who wants to be accepted by
his squad, by his environment and by his enemy. In his struggle to fight against fearsome
opponents like an open door through which he can`t step, emotions that he doesn´t want
to show. Even his best companion, the smartgun inside of his hands, finally betrays him,
as well, and decides to not hit anything.

I had to cry a lot at the ending of the game. The game was full of emotions, sacrifice
And hard decisions like shall I go left or right to reach the room in front of me.
And there are exciting missions where you have the choice that your actions really matter.
Will you walk fast or slow down the hallway? Will you reload your weapon by hand or will the
Automatic reload function do so? Man, this game is an absolute thrill!

Of course the 9 DLCs are totally worth it as well! Must have for horde mode and some other
recycled missions

11 out of 10

reviewText:
Aliens: Colonial Marines is awful.

This review is written after playing 'hard'... yeah it wasn't that hard.

As a big fan of Alien(s), Colonial Marines sounded like it could've been awesome. But in the end what we got was another generic modern FPS. Aim-down-sights? Check. Fighting against generic humans? Check. ♥♥♥♥♥♥ regening-health? Somewhat check. Boring story? Check.

The gameplay is repetitive, boring, generic, and painful. Like shooting at bland enemies with weapons, that sound like ♥♥♥♥, in a bland level that offers so little in terms of design that in order to incentivize exploration the developers had to place pointless collectibles like dogtags, audio logs, and 'legendary weapons'?! (HA! Gorman's pistol and Frost's flamethrower are considered legendary weapons... like most people would even know who Frost is XD. Not to forget Gorman is far from anyones favourite Aliens character.) If you like any of this stupid ♥♥♥♥, you'll love CM. But I don't!

The AI in this game is garbage. Xenos just sprint in a straight line at you. Sound fun? Sound challenging? It isn't. Xenos'll even sometimes just stand in the middle of a room, staring at you, doing nothing. Great... not like the human enemies are much more challenging.

Yes, you heard me right. You trade shots behind bland cover with bland, generic, human soldiers. At least half of the game is spent fighting these guys. Instead of... well... you know... THE XENOMORPHS.

This game is way too easy. Did I die? Sure. But was it hard? No. Like I said before, the AI is stupid. Since the Aliens just run at you there is no challenge, just click on the bad guys a few time.

You may be asking: What do you mean by '♥♥♥♥♥♥ regening-health? Somewhat check'?"
Well... You have 3 health bars
date: and each health bar can regen
recommended: but it can't regen above it-self. So let's say you are at half-health (in the second bar)
hoursPlayed: you will regen the second bar full
voteText: but you won't regen the third bar. You can pick up medkits to regen lost bars. This is the same system from the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ AvP3. And yes
helpfulPercent:
it sucks ♥♥♥.

So how is the story?!
♥♥♥♥.

So Colonial Marines takes place after Alien 3; and once again Weyland-Yutani are stupid (SHOCKING?! RIGHT?! It isn't like at this point in the series this must be like the fourth time they've failed at using the xenos... if we count Alien: Isolation of course). But I'll start from the beginning. So Hicks (voiced by Michael Biehn

reviewText:
Well OK, I just did - I played this whole thing from the start to finish and here is my verdict. If you´re not an ULTRA BADASS Alien Fan don´t waste time and the money for torturing yourself. I have to admit that in the beginning the game was fun. Really it was but the game has some technical issues.

I don´t wanna talk about the graphical issues we all know about. Sometimes the level design is scarier than the Xenos themnself. The Weyland mercs are just a pain in the ♥♥♥!!! I don´t mind fighting against Xenos all the time, even if they look always the same that is what Aliens the movie was about. There were no mercs that look like a cheap copy of Half-Life2 Combines... Some levels are so long and boring just the achievements kept me moving on. Yeah the game features achievements lots of them some are quite easy to achieve" some are insanely hard to get.

The sound is quite good and sometimes the sounds down in the sewers are quite frightning. The Aliens in the sewers by the way are just a bad joke. They walk with a limp - that´s weird. I like how they crawl along the ceiling and the floor but you better not turn your flashlight on down in the sewers - this part of the game is just a joke and not funny at all.

The voice acting from the main characters is quite cool - Bishop sounds best IMHO. Steam shows me a play time of about 18 hours I haven´t checked the time before I started my playthrough but I think it must have been about 6 to 7 hours I needed.

In the end I have to say that I will not reccommend the game due to the many flaws I encountered during the playthrough.

Thanks for reading!  If you like this review please join my retro games group on steam:

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/retrogames8090"

reviewText:
Out of curiosity to see how bad this really is, I got it for $5, played it, & have now lost a lot of respect for Gearbox. It is easily one of the worst games I have ever played. I see why it got bad reviews and it deserves every one. This is a unacceptable tragedy. If it were given another name and marketed as a low priced generic shooter, it would still be sickening. My advice, forget about this even if it goes f2p and play the Aliens vs Predator game from 2010 which is decent, around a 6.5/10. This game was $50 or more when it was released back in Feb 2014, and now as of August 2014, only six months later, it is only $15 and you can find it constantly on sale for only $5. That is how horrible this game is. It is the prom night dumpster baby of Aliens games.

Holy ♥♥♥♥ this game is something else. It would be a decent game with some fun shooter elements if it weren't one of the buggiest, most poorly coded, generic games of all time. Example of its incredibly poor design: fighting through a level in the dlc Stasis Interrupted, which despite some people saying that it is much better than the regular game, sucks equally as much as the normal game does, with no health packs, then when the next level loads, there are 4 health packs at the beginning which is completely pointless because it gives you full health at the start of a level and you don't even need them because you have to walk a ways to even see any enemies. What they did to this game is laughable and becomes more of a joke the longer you play. I have alt+tabbed out of the game to amend this review probably about thirty times, each time adding more and more bad things about the game, never once to add anything positive. It just gets worse and worse the more you play. One of the biggest flaws and one of the dumbest coding problems I have ever seen in any game in my life, and actually this is the only game I have ever seen do this since I started PC gaming back in 1997, is that when you close the game, it instantly relaunches all by itself... lol. The only way to close it is to alt+tab out, run task manager with ctrl+alt+del, and force close steam then force close aliens........ what a dumb sick joke. In-game is glitchy too. Achievements reset for no reason. I was near the end of a mission and had 3/5 melee kills for a achievement to get 5 in one mission, which is hard as fk since melee sucks bad and you can't get close to anything without dying quickly because only a couple of bullets or bites from a alien kills you, and I died and when it reloaded me at a previous checkpoint the achievement progress reset... So I got 3 melee kills again from the checkpoint, died, and they reset again...

I am skipping every cutscene because not only do the character models have god awful movement like puppets and their mouths look like puppet mouths, and the voice acting is some of the worst of all time and the script is one of the worst of all time, the game is just so generally awful I just want to hurry up and finish. That and the cutscenes also perform horribly, very stuttery and jerky.

Friendly AI in single player is broken. Sometimes they follow me to an objective, sometimes they don't. I know it is broken because many times I will be going to an objective alone and when I die and restart at the checkpoint, the marines will then come with me, basically letting me know that they should have came the first time but didn't because it is broken. Enemy AI is almost non-existent. They charge at you blindly or stand still and fire.

The game engine is very generic. It feels EXACTLY like the Blood 2 game engine which is very old and horrible. It is also only about 6 hours long (thank God) which is a 100% ripoff when it first came out, and even still at $5 since the game sucks balls and you will not find even one online game going at any time, ever. You need to go to video options first thing and turn the field of view option all the way up because anything less is way too low. The pulse rifle is gargantuan and takes up the entire bottom-right 1/4 of the screen, and then some, even on the highest field of view. That's right, changing the field of view does not change the weapon size lol. The pulse rifle takes up more of the screen than most giant rocket launchers do on some war games. You unlock all of the primary weapons quickly and they all suck nuts save for the pulse rifle and tactical shotgun. I bought the sawed-off double barreled shotgun extra for 99 cents and it is one of the worst weapons I have ever seen. It sounds like a BB gun when you fire it and while you are reloading it you get killed. You might unlock a few more later like maybe the flamethrower but who cares because the game sucks anyway. You die randomly and you die alot just because of how powerless you are to how extremely generic combat is and them flooding you with aliens. And the enemy AI is non-existent: they run straight at you with no thought or care in the world. The most laughable part of the game is when you die. The death animation on your guy is the worst I have ever seen. When you die it turns black and white, goes into third person, and shows you dying and the animation looks, every time, like a kid pulling the strings on a puppet flopping him around awkwardly. The Alien just gets in your face and gently swings his arm at you all prissy like myeh!" then you die. Sometimes there isn't even a death animation; the screen just goes black and white and you are laying on the ground dead. And even when you have full armor and health
date: you can still die in a couple of hits from a alien. Dying in the game really only comes from trial and error. I have only ever died because of one single reason: being flooded with so many enemies to the point of not being able to reload fast enough to keep up then they get in close and I'm dead. On the second or third try though I get through it
recommended: but it is still the only reason you will die in this game. Zero skill is involved. You do NOT want to die because it will usually set you back pretty far and having to redo something in such a bad game is a cruel joke by the developers. It is a trend with all bad games: poor checkpointing. The checkpoint system is half broken as well: on mission 10 when you have to survive the attack of the queen
hoursPlayed: I died once and it put me back to the checkpoint
voteText: I died a second time and when it loaded it glitched me to the next checkpoint past the queen without having to beat her... I consider it a blessing. The way enemies gib is awful and looks very primitive and amateurish. The way they gib looks EXACTLY like Blood 2 and that is a game from 1998 and it blew hard. The sound and music are instantly forgettable. If you were listening to someone play and not watching

reviewText:
Mediocre in every possible way.

I heard lots of bad things about this, before i bought it on sale.
Did i regret buying it? no.
Is it really that bad? no.
But sloppy execution, bugs, glitches and bad writing are breaking it's neck.

I mean...how hard can it be to do a decent story with Marines vs Aliens in it?
Well, this story doesn't contribute much to the franchise...actually...nothing really at all.

The Story is not really worth mentioning.
You will visit some locations from the second movie (which brings back some nostalgia) and the atmosphere was captured pretty well (throughout the whole game).
The levels sometimes feel, like they were taken out from the movie (not graphical wise unfortunatey).

Graphics are decent, no masterpiece, but good enough.
The lightning is pretty well done in my opinion and does a lot to create a threatening atmosphere.

The gamplay is...well okay".
If you fight against xenomorphs
date:

Fighting against soldiers from Wayland Yutani? Boring as hell...feels like any other shooter than an alien shooter.
And seriously? Red-dot sight on the pulse rifle? Who had this stupid idea?
Same goes with being promoted within the game to higher ranks as a Marine...

All that totally breaks immersion

reviewText: Genre - Sci-Fi FPS\nWell this is a game by Gearbox who bought us Borderlands. So to say I had high hopes would be an understatement. I love the Aliens films and had yet to find a good Aliens game unless there are also Predators involved that is. Unfortunately this game stayed true to form. The story mode is okay and you can play co-op but it is a game on rails (unlike Borderlands). There are upgrades you can earn for multiplayer deathmatch but most of the Aliens vs Marines games I played always ended up being one sided affairs with people just holding key points Zzzzzzzzzzz. Also the story doesn't really make sense (correct me if I'm wrong) when linked to the films. I think with a bit more thought and input from fans of the Aliens franchise this could have been vastly improved. This is a below average game for above average material.

reviewText:
The Aliens movie franchise stems back all the way to 1979. It spawned a 1986 sequel Aliens that gets regarded as one of the best sci-fi horror action movies of all time. Aliens: Colonial Marines is a first person action horror shooter that follows five new marines on Acheron (LV-426) after the Aliens movie. You'll take the roll of Winters fighting off both Xenomorph aliens and soldiers from Weyland Yutani ('the Company') as he goes from the spaceship Sulaco to the planetoid's surface, through Hadley's Hope and into the furthest reaches of the alien hive.

The sound design, music and voice acting are high points to the experience. Music that feel straight from the Aliens film if not late 70s space travel movies. You'll visit scenes straight out of the Aliens movie even if a lot of it was blew up before your arrival. The effects, lighting, fog, sounds and atmosphere blend together to put you in a place that fits the Aliens franchise. The blue planetoid, the white sterile walls of 'the Company,' exhaust in the narrow corridors aboard the space ship and even the fog layer over greenish black resin made by the aliens. Luckily the 'video feed filter' can get turned off so you can see the game without having a grainy fuzz like in the movie. In cut scenes the game doesn't have the video feed filter, so why should you?

Chained with you throughout the game are your allies. Sometimes none, sometimes one, and other times five of them. They'll do their best to kill enemies, but they're inefficient. Enemies will sometimes walk right by them and head straight for you. The best part about your allies is using them to distract enemy soldiers, so you can flank them. The game makes good use of flanking with cat and mouse maps. But not with the Xenomorphs, they're usually in hallways or out in the open with them running straight at you. Thankfully, your allies cannot die, since they're part of the story. When the enemies are dead, they'll always be ready to show you the way waiting at whatever door you're supposed to be at next. You can clip right through them, so they're never in the way.

You have three bars of health in the game. Each bar regenerates unless you've lost the bar completely. Then you need med kits that give you full health. Over that you have armor that doesn't regenerate. You just need to find more armor lying around or from dead soldiers. Heavy soldiers drop full armors, so its easy enough to find it and lose it. Its a good system.

You'll face off against a variety of different aliens. For the most part they'll climb on walls and ceilings. Then drop down and run at you or lunge a great distance. They can be deadly up close, but a shotgun blast takes them out. The rifles don't feel effective at all. There are acid spitters that stay away while spitting from a far. The lurkers are the intelligent ones. They'll use stealth to attack you. Climb through vents, disappear into the darkness and they take more damage. Then there are the Weyland Yutani soldiers. They can do everything you can do. Flank, hide, reload, shoot and throw a rare grenade your way. They drop random health, ammo and armor.

The bosses are big and need you to outsmart them than just taking more damage. You'll fight one in a power loader, you'll outrun one torching all the doors behind you. The bull alien will chase you in circles, letting your allies shoot him in the back. Finally the queen is the most meh battle of them all. So meh I literally could clip through her and speed run the final battle of the game, doing all that was needed of me.

For better or worse, the weapons are straight out of the Aliens movie. There is a variety of shotguns, pulse rifles, assault rifles, pistols, flame throwers and even the smart gun that tracks enemies to shoot. Throwable things like grenades are easily forgotten, because they need to be armed like a weapon and can't be quick thrown. To make throwables more forgettable is the fact that most weapons have alt fires. Assault rifles have incinerators, pulse rifles have grenade launchers and even those that don't can be upgraded later. There are a lot of upgrades for each weapon such as scopes, skins, alt fires, clips and so on. They unlock as you rank up from completing 'challenges.' These challenges are things like kill 20 enemies with any rifle. Get 5 melee kills in a single 'mission.' Headshot 5 enemies with the service pistol. They do switch things up, because otherwise I'd use a shotgun through the entire game. Damage > accuracy.

By the end of the game you'll have an entire arsenal, complete with weapons found from characters in the movie. Each weapon has its own ammo so if you run empty on one shotgun, the pump handle might still have some shells. Since you have so many weapons, the game makes use of a weapon wheel. Every weapon has its own stats: Damage, accuracy, rate of fire and so on. Shotguns have more damage, but less accuracy. Pulse rifles have less damage, but high rate of fire. The problem is the rate of fire is weak, you can't just hold it. The gunfire will stop, forcing you to play in controlled bursts. The assault rifle will only shoot two bullets at once. Weapons can get upgraded mostly to increase accuracy, clip size and reload.

The thing to most take into account is the accuracy stat. You need to aim to shoot with any accuracy. Not just that, because of the accuracy stat, you can shoot things head on and they have a chance of going straight through. To prove that, the game has DLC with a firing range. Aim straight on, fire and sometimes things just go through. It doesn't happen often, but when it does, it might kill you. Speaking of killing you. There is acid blood, but its never enough to kill you, even standing in it on the highest difficulty. What will really kill you is aliens clipping through you. Becoming you so your gun is outside of them. When you fire it will miss, because the alien has clipped through you. Since they can run faster than you. It caused frequent deaths.

Its not all guns though. There are a few brief moments where you need to use stealth. First unarmed you'll have to quietly sneak past a new form of blind aliens that explode. Then you'll have to sneak past lights and sentries that will spot and shoot at you.

Other glitches have been fixed with some patch a year into the game, but even when they were patched I still noticed glitches that had been fixed were still a problem. Nothing game breaking, just noticeable. Things like an alien coming off a wall and getting stuck in the floor. Getting hit by an alien while shooting only to have the gun still shooting. Texture popin was still here and there, mostly when reloading a level from a death. I guess its a way to speed up load times.

The controls are simple for the most part. Aim, shoot, alt-fire, move, look, jump, squat and run. Use the D-pad for flashlight, grenade ready, weapon ready, pistol ready. There's a whole other button to switch between two weapons even if you can hold a dozen or so. Sometimes it didn't feel intuitive, but the game lets you bind keys and controls. While there is melee, it felt useless. Most things on soldier difficulty will easily kill you at close range. You also have a motion tracker, but it only feels useful when I was trying to find the location of the next checkpoint. Sure it tells you where enemy movement is, but when you can't use it and shoot it felt like a handicap. Plus, you hear a sound when you're in range of a new hostile.

There is multiplayer, but there's nothing going on at this point without being scheduled. Overall, it was a good experience, even if its not the best first person shooter. While people call it the worst game of all time, it could have been much worse. The end left me with a sour taste. At the end of Star Wars, they blew up the Death Star and that was that. They didn't start the next movie and end it.

reviewText:
What can be said about this game already.  It is a huge disaster.  And Randy's continued denial that he lied and this game is a joke just keeps the fuel going.

So why did I grab it (on sale of course)?  Because I had to see for it myself.  So here's a list of what you'll get in this game:

1: Broken Alien AI
2: Broken Alien AI clipped into the walls or floors
3: Broken Marine AI
4: Broken Marine AI clipped into the walls or floors
5: Broken Marine AI that stops in doorways
6: Aliens that Spawn right behind your back
7: O'Neil
8: Textures with words/numbers that upside down and/or backwards
9: FanFiction.net quality story
10: Terrible animations
11: Useless Motion Tracker
12: COD Clone
13: O'Neil
14: Broken / Missing Textures
15: O Get the hell out of the way!" Neil

So buy this with your friends if you want a game to derp and laugh at.  I still blame this game for the poor sales of Alien Isolation."

reviewText:
A long awaited game in which you shouldn't expect too much.
The graphics engine is really outdated. The Aliens are really buggy (no pun intended) most of the time. And you spend most of your gameplay killing humans or androids. The story is twisted and really bad and should not even be remotely related to the original.

~About the Season pass~

Still containing tons of bugs, graphical flaws, and also destroying the storyline even further. The aliens and humans are glithy to no end and the game still looks horrible.
Conclusion: Is it worth the money? Absolutely NO! But if you want to laugh at something so horribly excecuted and written. Play it on “Ultimate Badass” diffuculty with a friend and you will have many laughs! Even tho it's like playing on easy.

reviewText:
I can't help but feel sad about Alien fans, who paid the full retail price to play this title. I paid $5 and I feel like that was a waste of money, as I didn't even have the desire to finish it. Delete Local Content.... Done. Now I feel better.

EDIT: I needed to add some more opinion as people may think I am jumping at conclusions here.

The game is a complete mess. Most of the time you don't know where to go or what to do, but the game does indicate friendly positions and you are fooled by following them. Sometimes there are game-breaking bugs, npc's stop responding, things stop happening.

Seriously, if you are looking for an Alien game, just play Isolation. This looks like fun, but believe me, you will be frustrated in the end.

reviewText:
After reading the extremely negative reviews here on Steam, I was not really expecting anything when I picked it up in January 2015 for less than 3.5 € (external retailer).



I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised. As a matter of fact, I even completed the game in short bursts, which is saying a lot if I look at the current state of my game library.



So
date:
how is the game" - you ask sceptically?



First
recommended: forgot all about what the other reviewers here wrote: this game has been patched up so much that nearly all bugs are gone. Team-mates will not block doors
hoursPlayed: aliens will not walk through you
voteText: you will not become stuck
helpfulPercent: there are no crashes
votesHelpful: ... The guy who wrote you only get to operate to power loader exo-suit for 2 seconds obviously got not far into the game
votesTotal: as the suit returns for a boss battle halfway. Seriously
votesFunny:
some reviews here - even recent ones! - look like they are talking about a completely different game.



What remains is an OK first-person shooter set in the Alien universe. Its best aspects are:

Fairly good depiction of the colonial marines and the aliens. Marines operate in teams and that is exactly what you will be doing here.

Sounds are excellent
commentsCount: especially the weapon and door SFX that sound like they were taken straight from the movies.\n\nLots of fan-service: you will visit the movie-sets
column16: find tons of easter eggs referring to the movies
column17: music from the movies
column18: ... Picking up the Smartgun had me giggling like a schoolgirl every time.\n\nGameplay is fluently and entertaining
column19:
even though very simplistic.

It is interesting to see how the game links "Aliens" with "Alien 3" and beyond.


Then again
column20: the game is by no means perfect:\n\nIt is annoying that almost all aliens zerg straight to you
column21:
often completely ignoring your team-mates.

Graphics were outdated even on day of release.

While some sets are epic
column22: there are also lots of levels that are forgettable and just plain boring. I mean
column23:
how many times do we have to walk between near-identical ruined buildings or through caves?

The story is fairly rubbish and at some points hard to follow. The "Weyland Yutani is evil" card is being played far too much and becomes boring very fast.

Difficulty is unbalanced: even the easiest difficulty still includes very high difficulty spikes.


One common complaint is that at some point
column24: the alien enemies are replaced by human enemies. That is simply not true: it is correct that about halfway
column25: human enemies are added to the game
column26: but you will be battling aliens until the very end. The aliens also remain the biggest threat at all times
column27:
while the humans are mostly pushovers for anyone with even a tiny bit of FPS experience.



As to the DLC
column28: most of it is garbage. I only care about the singleplayer part and found that all I needed was the base game + Statis Interrupted. The latter DLC starts of with a nice "Alien" vibe (seriously
column29: it is a wonder that the makers of Alien: Isolation were not sued ...)
column30: before going back to the "Aliens" setting. Its FPS part is even more back-to-basic than the base game. If you prefer slightly more modern FPS gameplay and don't really care about the link between Aliens
column32:
you can just as well skip Statis Interrupted.



All in all
column33: I recommend the game to everyone who is even slightly fan of the Alien-universe AND who likes straightforward first-person shooters. No
column34: it is not a horror game. And yes
column35: it is an almost old-school FPS with health packs
column37: secret hunting and not much else. But if that is what you are looking for
column38:
you will not be disappointed for 5$/€.



However
column39: if you want the ultimate Aliens-experience
column40: I still recommend Aliens vs. Predator 2 over Aliens Colonial Marines any day of the week.\n"

reviewText:
This game is a mix of first person shooter and survival horror. Sadly I can't really recommend this game. I had low expectations for this game so I just wanted to go through the story. But even on the easiest level the game is quite tough and very frustrating. A single alien or grenade or head shot can kill you instantly. Although the game supports a controller, you simply can't react quickly enough to survive between checkpoints. I had to play with mouse and keyboard to get through the chapters.

I had to replay some scenes again and again learning where the aliens or humans are going to jump out at you. It is like a survival horror game (limited health, ammo and armour) but with tons of enemies that need to be killed to progress. It is mostly a very linear corridor shooter with scripted monster closets. There are 11 missions, but they look and feel very similar.

To me it feels like there is not enough ammo for you to kill all the enemies. So I tend to hang back and watch the AI characters play the game, which is pretty boring. Even on easy the AI characters get killed again and again and again, but luckily they always get up again. My other problem with the game is that it rarely actually feels like the aliens universe. The only good things are the motion tracker, pulse rifle and ending cut scene. They have even invented new types of aliens which just feel very, very wrong. The graphics are OK but are very generic future sci-fi. This is totally at odds with the aliens films which have a very retro sci-fi appearance.

I forced myself to finish the game, but basically I did not enjoy it at all. I kept hoping the next chapter would be better, but is never really was. I did try and play multiplayer but I never managed to get a match even though I tried lots of different settings. The DLC is a little bit better and more interesting.

reviewText:
I've waited for this game since it was first anounced back in I believe 2006, i've seen all the movies, both the theatre versions as the directors cuts like a hundred times and played almost every alien game; Alien Trilogy, the old AVP, AVP 2 and the new AVP and I've played some Alien Ressurection but i couldn't complete it because of some bug.

So did i like the game? Kinda. It has some good aspects to it. I really liked the map design of the maps that takes place on LV-426, the maps that take place on the sulaco have some great parts but aren't really that statisfying, they've added a cool new alien called the Spitter, the other new aliens are sh!t (i'm kinda hard to statisfy when it comes to new alien designs) and the weapons are cool, the all of the traditional weapons are there including some new ones that actually aren't that bad, and the weapons used in the movie Aliens can be found as collectibles and I love them all except for Hudsons Pulse Rifle witch is a burst rifle for some reason but the weapon itself looks great. and the Pulse rifle finally sounds like a Pulse rifle, it might not sound like a big deal but to me it actually is. the graphics aren't that great but I don't really mind, I play games not graphics.

Besides all the things i just mentioned there isn't much to write home about. the AI can be really ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, especialy the AI of the weyland yutani mercenairies, and thats another thing, there are way too many weyland yutani mercenairies. I know fighting other people isn't new to an Alien game, Alien Trilogy and Alien Ressurection had some human enemies in it and AVP 2 also had a level where you had to fight humans, but why so many. there are a few boss battles witch are really, really bad, the ending is terrible. and there's the story, witch has been approved by Fox (probably by some f*cker who couldn't see past the dollar signs in his eye), it's just terrible.

So what about coöp and multiplayer,
i've heared a lot of people say games are much better when you can play them with your friends, but I liked A:CM more when I played on my own, multiplayer actually was really great, i really enjoyed playing multiplayer but unfortunately it took less than a month before the multiplayer was dead.

unfortunatly the game wasn't quite what i expected, I kinda enjoyed playing through the campain once but once that is over there isn't really any fun in it, and the multiplayer was great but now it's dead, therefor I give Aliens: Colonial marines a 4,5/10

reviewText:
I played this game after finishing Alien: Isolation... there is a gap the size of a planet between the quality of these two games.

...but Aliens: Colonial Marines is not a bad game. I surley can understand why Xenomorph-Enthusiasts and people who bought into the Hype hate it. The pictures from the Storepage are more or less fake, the Alien-AI is except from some rare scripted behaviour poor and the Story is nothing to write home about. It feels like a game published from a low or medium-tier developer or something scrappy, unattractive standing for ten years in your shelf.

But if you can ignore all this and get it for a dicount(75%) than it´s worth the ten hours the campaign may take. It´s a fun mediocre shooter, best played in coop. You may forget everything about it afterwards but just running down a linear path, shooting at dumb Xenos and waves of corporate badguys is something of a guilty pleasure. Also it will give you some untold Alien-Storyline!

In short.. don´t expect too much.. 65/100

reviewText:
Gonna go the opposite of a lot of reviews here and give a thumbs up to ACM.  That being said I did purchase this during holiday sale off Amazon for $1.99 and several months have passed since relase date.  Gearbox has patched the game up to eliminate and improve some issues.  I can understand people that pre ordered and spent $60 on this game, I would def be ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and upset as it is nowhere near worth that money, but for 2 bucks it surely is.

Being a fan of the Alien franchise and growing up in the late 70's/early 80's I can appreciate the tone of this game and the sense of art style seems to be a throwback to that era.  Graphics are terrible by todays standards and what we should be getting, however I thought the Alien models looked really well done and were true to Alien lore.  The sound was failry bad to, mostly the dreadful voice work, the ambient sound and alien hisses were good though.  Gameplay is really straight forward to the tune of run n gun, with a checkpoint save system.

I have certainly played a lot more trash garbage games than ACM and in my opinion should not be labeled as such, just a game that was falsely advertised and was way below potential on a galactic level - BUT if you can pick it up cheap its worth a run through, which I thought was fun and ok.

reviewText:
Oh man.... This game.

To be fair..... I DID buy this on sale knowing it had recieved terrible reviews. I decided to give it a go anyways because I guess I had to see for myself exactly how bad it truely was. So this is my literal 25 something minutes of playing this absolute ♥♥♥♥ game.

Start the game and have a feel for the controls for the first time. I was getting use to the iron sights and started customizing the controls to better fit my liking. I discover a marine all snotted up on the wall, telling me to cut him down.  The cutscene plays of my character using his torch to cut this guy down. I hear the alien making noises during the cutscene and the alien just crawls up next to my character FNAF style and grabs my hand, then hisses.  The alien then glitches out on the wall spinning around in a circle allowing me to shoot and kill him really easily.... Lets just say that wasn't a very good first impression. Something I was supposed to expect in future battles im guessing.....

So we reach a landing bay area where there is a big dropship sitting in the center. Theres two Aliens on top of some cargo containers next to the drop ship. There were also TWO marines, 1 with a smart gun and the other with a pulse rifle behind some cargo crates shooting at them. The person I had cut down decides the best corse of action is to throw a grenade at the ship...... Seriously? For two aliens you think to throw a grenade when you could have just shot them. The grenade blew up the whole drop ship..... It was such a stupid plot idea that Sega should be sued for writing such a terrible plot line.

After I save the day with about 45 seconds of none stop aliens runing towards us while some idiot marine tries to unlock some door behind me. We finally set back off back to where we started this ♥♥♥♥ mess of a game. While traveling down this weird long space hallway..... The marine that I had cut down earlier starts having his predictable spaz attack before the chest burst. And im sitting here thinking. OK....The alien is going to pop out and run off towards the Marine's ship or something. NOPE!
The Dude Alu akbarz himself with a grenade. Completly destroying the bridge and killing like 2 other marines with me..... You and some other loser survies the blast. Say some corny ♥♥♥♥ to each other, and I quit the ♥♥♥♥ing game out of RAGE.

The end? No! You see.... After I quit the game, it had started itself right back up again! Steam kept telling me that it was running AVP" and would launched the game every time I would try to quit. Took me 4 times just to be fast enough to click "delete local content"

reviewText:
I actually first owned this game on the Xbox 360, it was a huge disappointment and possibly the worst edition. It was downright buggy and just comlete false advertisment of what the developers promised in E3 that year. Screw you Gearbox.

Original demo gameplay which should of been the gameplay but wasn't.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2fHv4wQJfSY

I bought the PC version on a whim, only because I had extra cash to burn. I played the PC version about a year later after the release of launch date. They did patch the game and with slightly better graphics. Still not as good as the suppose demo of the game but at least it was better than on launch.

The graphics are passable but at times the game texture looks like a late stage PS2 or original Xbox game. Even with the improvements, the game still looks a bit choppy. The controls are actually very solid, mind you I played with mouse/keyboard. The enemy AI was improved from launched but still needs work.

The gameplay on this game is just average and you don't really feel any tension like you should when playing a game like this. What I really didn't like about this game was half of the stages you are fighting Wayland mercs instead of aliens. Even Aliens vs Predator (2010) did a better job of this when you played the marine. Multiplayer co-op is at least fun but I would crank it up to the highest difficulty to get the most out of it. The game is rather short and the storyline is forgettable. As for online multiplayer matches, it's pretty much dead unless you find a Steam group or have a good amount of friends to play with.

I would not buy this game unless you really really like Aliens or have friends to play with. If you are undecided, I would wait until it goes on sale for $5.

Overall I would have to rate this game a 5/10, even with the improvements and patches.

reviewText:
This piece of sh*t almost broke my PC.
I wanted to give it a good review, the game is bad, but the concept is pretty interesting, but, when I wanted to launch the game, like I did countless times before, the setup kicked-in again, giving me the error that .NET cannot be installed, since I have a newer version, then... BAM... forced restart, no time to save open programs, nothing... upon booting into Windows, blue background, no icons displayed, no task-bar, nothing, same message, BAM... restart... Safe Mode... can't uninstall or disable .NET setup... back to normal, I could start Task Manager, launch explorer.exe and kill .NET setup, find its directory on C:\, completely remove it, restart and... phew, now the infinite error - restarts don't occur anymore.
Seriously, this piece of sh*t game is not worth destroying your PC for it... also, whenever I exited the game, it always got launched automatically again... you'd have to be a ninja to quickly cancel the launch operation through Steam whenever you exited this piece of sh*t game.
Totally not worth the bother, a piece of sh*t, don't even get it if they pay you all the money in the world for it!

reviewText: There seems to be a lot of negative reviews for this game, but I for one, enjoy(ed) it; for both the nostalgia of the alien franchise and the continuation of story from my favorite alien movie: aliens (the 2nd of the quadrilogy). I do want to mention however, that I bought this game on sale for $1.99 and after many of the patches that fixed the early glitches, which made playing through the story mode pleasant. The graphics are OK, but could be better. The gameplay can be sometimes unforgiving, but once you get the hang of it (don't let the aliens sneak up on you), you'll increase your odds of staying alive. Soundtrack: awesome. Story: great. A lot of people complained about the story in this game as well, but I think they forget that this is based off a simple action movie. If you want more story, play a game that ties into aliens 3 (definitely more drama and story driven) than the action driven Aliens 2. All in all, for $1.99, I have no regrets and I'm glad I purchased and played the game that brought back many good alien killing memories.

reviewText:
This game gets alot of flak, but honestly, I think it is what I call 'Duke Nukem Forever Syndrome' in action. The game took so long to release, was so hyped every step of the way and every change in developer, and was so rabidly sought after from the moment it was announced to be in the works that it was doomed to bad press the instant the overhype and anticipation were not 100% sated. People expected a masterpiece of modern gaming based in the Aliens universe, what they got instead was a decent example of more old-school shooter style gaming based in the Aliens Universe. Not the greatest, but good none-the-less and fun. Sadly seems too many people overlook that in favor of complaining that its not the Alpha-male of a game they expected.

The story, while full of the passing plot hole here and there if your a devoted enough Aliens fan to even notice them, is par for the course when it comes to Alien franchise games. The conrols work, the xenos are relentless when they appear, Weyland-Yutani corp are ♥♥♥♥♥ and so are their mercs, and the multiplayer is fun as hell and lets you play as both Aliens and Marines with upgradable weapons and evolutions and unlockable costume bits for cosmetic appeal.

Gameplay is the older shooter style when your marines, no cover-shooter mechanics here just straight up crouch and shoot logic where anything you can fit fully behind is your cover if it stops bullets or buys you a few seconds to reload while swarms of xenos decend onto you. Yeah I said stop bullets, good ol Wey-Yu has sent mercs to secure the place and elimate you pesky and nosey UMC Marines and while alot of people complain about that I point out the following: EVERY ALIEN GAME AT SOME POINT HAS HUMANS KILLING OTHER HUMANS. Why? See above: Weyland-Yutani Corp is a ♥♥♥♥ and Mr. Yutani himself is the biggest ♥♥♥♥ of all. Don't Beleive me? google the dude and look up his track record in the various games, movies, comics, and books. He is a horrible person...well...android who body jumps from andriod to andriod whenever he dies anyway because he is such a troll with such a need to contiue to troll that he uploaded his brain before dying into a computer and downloads himself into androids to make himself immortal to troll the rest of mankind for eternity.

That there is the best in-universe reason to kill humans in this game there is. And its a good reason. Because ♥♥♥♥ Wey-Yu.

Unfortunatly the multiplayer, which imo is AMAZING to play, is kinda dead. No one plays it so you can never find a match, but maybe someday it will come back. Even without it the singleplayer is fun and can get your heart pounding in spots, and for the first time in any aliens game the smartgun is not only 100% visually accurate with 100% accurate sound effects, but you get the propper smartgun eyepiece that tracks and highlights moving targets in range for you and auto-targets them based on whichever is closest to the crosshairs...just like the movie. That alone is a Plus even if you only use the thing once because until you run out of ammo and have to dump it you feel like a bad ♥♥♥. You feel like your right in the movie when they break that bad boy out and its cutting down xenos by the dozens.

Another great feature for single player is the motion tracker. It picks up ALL motion in its range not just living things, again just like in the films, and nothing will startle you more when its been far too quiet for far too long when that thing starts to ping because it picked up some phantom signal from a bit of shifting debris or a swinging cable. And nothing makes your heart thump and set you into panic mode like suddenly having the thing go into overdrive, making you pull it up to see what the hell is going on, then see just a massive blob of dots moving closer on the tracker but nothing in the hallway. Because you know its real that time, thats xenos not some random false reading, theres alot of them, they are close, and most teriffying is that you cant see them. So you start to backpeddle and pray they come out of the vents in small  numbers instead of all at once and that its not right in your face.

And thats why I love this game, its everything an aliens game should be and nothing more. Its suspensful, atmospheric, heartpounding, and surprisingly immersive if you can get over some of the flatter voice acting bits in otherwise tense moments. You feel like a UMC Marine caught in a life or death surival situation with only a few people to help you out at best, only yourself more often then not, and your in over your head. But your a marine you have your duty to finish the mission AND get your ♥♥♥ and the asses of as many fellow marines as you can back home when your done.

No one said life in the UMCM was a glorious one, and its a bughunt down there. But damn is it an exciting and Fun life.

reviewText:
Since release a lot of things got updated.
Textures are better, Alien AI got improved.
The Story didn`t change of course, but when you play it coop, you can have a very good time.
Escpecially the level, where you have to sneak through the sewerage ;) This is a very intense cooperative experience.

And the DLC: Stasis Interrupted is the real gap-filler for the movies Alien 2 and 3. Here the levels have a good design and the story is good enough for a recommendation. The background sound is great, and let`s you feel like in the first Alien movie.
After all these upgrades and with the DLC in special, this game is nowadays underrated in my opinion.

reviewText:
I'm going to barely recommend it just for the multiplayer component, tho it should've been free to play at this point. Get the game for the price of a burger off an alternative source, just to see what it was all about.

Pros:
-Bug Hunt clearly takes the cake
-PVP can actually be fun and worth your time
-Some decent vistas
-Original cast members (what a waste tho)

Cons:
-Too many to mention

The campaign is not fun (and barely so with friends), the story DLC is boring and equally bad. It's unfortunate, but that's what it is. Good thing Alien Isolation sort of relieved a lot of our pain...

There is little left for me or anyone to say about this notoriously bad product. We all know Gearbox outsourced money and staff to their Borderlands project instead of delivering on their deal with Sega, we all know they half-a$$ed it and left us with a steaming pile of overly scripted, bug and glitch ridden, badly written and animated, poorly paced and messily stitched-together game. It's sad, because we were wanting something great, and it certainly had potential.

reviewText:
I bought this through the Humble Bundle store for $3.75, meaning that only 90% of what I paid for it went down the drain instead of 100%

I bought it to play through it FOR SCIENCE! after having played it at launch with a friend. This recent playthrough is ten hours of my life I'll never get back, and yes, ten sounds like a lot, but it was really only so much because I kept dying from bugs and glitches, like xenomorphs clawing me through indestructible obstacles and suicidal mercenaries that charge me with explosives. Two years after release, its gone from a mostly broken and buggy, poorly designed game with terrible AI to a fairly broken and buggy, poorly designed game with terrible AI. Not quite as terrible as at launch, but a turd doesn't become any less of a turd just because you put a cherry on top of it, it just ends up being a waste of a cherry. All the hours spent patching this game and creating its DLC would've been better spent by Gearbox (or TimeGate, or whoever else really made the game) towards a project that could actually be saved.

If you're thinking of getting it to screw around with friends in multiplayer with, don't. While it can be some fun that way, its a graveyard online and if you want a multiplayer Aliens fix you'd probably just be better off playing Killing Floor with the Aliens mod or some of the previous AvP games which actually have some occassional activity.

If you're thinking of giving it to somebody as a joke gift, don't. It'd be cheaper and reap the same results to just mail a picture of you giving somebody the middle finger to the recepient, completely free if you email them.

reviewText:
Understand that I am only recommending this game under the following circumstances:

1.  You HAVE to be a fan of the Aliens franchise to enjoy this game.
2.  You HAVE to have played this years after its release to get the updates that actually make it playable.
3.  You HAVE to buy it on sale to make it worth your while.

I could never have recommended this game when it launched.  I dropped $60 on it for Xbox 360 and took it back to Gamestop less than a week later.  However, the PC version is slightly (ever so slightly) less offensive.

The game itself takes place after the events that took place in the second film.  It has its ususal Xenomorph jump scares and the evil Wayland-Yutani corporation screwing everyone over for a profit.  It's an average to below average FPS that fans of the franchise will really enjoy.  If you don't like Aliens, then don't even bother, but if you are like me, then pick it up for some good nostalgic fun.

reviewText:
A game that could have been so much more... Aliens: Colonial Marines had the right ingredients to do something great, an official license to use all the original material from the films and a studio developing it with a rich history in making action packed games.

The results however are horrible. The initial and much talked about gameplay preview that was first shown turned out to be a glorified pre-rendered cinematic and the end result what we have now looks nothing like what was promised. The graphics are average at best and the game is ridden with bugs and glitches even after many patches.

The story is crap and does nothing good with the original material. The gameplay seems uninspired and linear, the enemy AI is ridiculously bad and the so called co-op is downright laughable. I think the only thing that turned out okay was the sound and the music but even that can't help the complete lack of atmosphere and originality in this game.

I honestly can't recommend this for any price. If you want to play a much better game that actually does something worthwhile with the original movie license, check out Alien: Isolation instead and just forget that this was ever made.

reviewText: First off I sort of understand the vitriol aimed at the game, it SHOULD have been MUCH better. It's got flaws (but what game hasn't), it had a dodgy develpment (so do many games), a dodgy story and it was rushed out the door (also like many games). Luckily I didn't buy it full price and got it for PC not the shoddy console version (many of the games issues are probably because they couldn't get it running on console so had to drop volumetric fog and most lighting effects). On that basis I DO recommend the game, but NOT to mega FPS fans, there's better FPSs out there. But, if you're a huge Aliens fan and would enjoy walking around the Sulaco's hanger..see Bishops legs and the airlock that the queen was flushed out of (albeit a tad small) you'll enjoy the game for that reason. The gameplay mechanics are wooden and simple point and shoot with a few variations, I enjoyed the smart gun section (but would have liked the option to keep it, for balance the game could have doubled or tripled the enemy count), I enjoyed exploring the Derelict, walking around the Gunner" from Alien was pretty damn cool! The sounds are all there
date: motion tracker..Pulse rifle etc. When you have the motion tracker you can't shoot so there's a bit of tension there. Ultimately as a gamer I'd give it 5/10
recommended: but as an Alien/Aliens fan I give it 2 more points for a respectible 7/10. The game is an example of most of the flaws of the gaming industry and some pretty shoddy decisions and practises (but similar stuff is going on in other industries ALL the time anyway). Oh and one tip...do NOT turn the gamma/brightness up
hoursPlayed: keep the game DARK and the lighting and atmosphere is much improved....Eurogamer did a comparison of the game v the demo and part of the problem was the brightness on the finshed game in their vid was WAY too high."

reviewText: Aliens: Colonial Marines (A:CM) was built to be a direct sequel to James Cameron's motion picture, Aliens. Despite bad reviews, I enjoyed A:CM, but I am admittedly an Alien fanatic dating from the original film. The game brings back Michael Biehn and Lance Henriksen to reprise their roles in the universe making it feel like an authentic Alien experience. However, A:CM feels like it should be a story-driven singleplayer game, but features multiplayer, player rankings and challenges that fit in as an afterthought. It should be noted that A:CM features a broke Steam Cloud that may result in saved game corruption as your ranking is not stored on Gearbox's servers.

reviewText: 8 out of 10: Worth buying on sale, but needs to be played co-op, and needs the Stasis Interrupted DLC in order to make sense of the story\n\nThe bad rap this game got upon launch was well deserved, and I can understand why so many people are down on it.  I wouldn't let that stop you from buying it, though.  The big patch released by Gearbox really did help the graphics and AI issues a lot, and made the game much more playable.  I only played a bit of the campaign in SP, but found it pretty lackluster; overall it wasn't scary or even tense, and had nothing on the previous Aliens games.  But the game really started to shine in the co-op multiplayer.  It was actually a lot of fun working through the campaign with a couple friends, as well as the Bug Hunt DLC.  As for the story - a lot of people had problems with it, me included.  It really made no sense and had several glaring plot holes that actually made me mad at a couple points.  However, the Stasis Interrupted DLC actually did an admirable job of bringing the plot together and explaining the holes, and I ended up being pretty pleased with the story overall.  I don't know whether all that was originally planned, or whether there was some mad scrambling at Gearbox to try and explain things, but it's too bad you had to play through the whole game, then play the DLC just to have the story make any kind of sense.  All in all, it's worth playing if you have 2 or 3 friends and are willing to shell out for the DLC.

reviewText:
The Short: If you like the movie (Aliens specifically), you will like (not love) Aliens: Colonial Marines (ACM).  Fairly generic shooter with a great movie tie-in, what can go wrong? Well, lots! A little buggy Ai, spawns and collision geometry can spoil some of the suspense that it does manage to drum up, but enjoyable enough for a few hours, for a few bucks (not retail price though!). Audio is a great help to the overall mood of the game and consistent to fans of the movie.

The Long:
I paid $10 for the whole meal deal, DLC's and all. Also, I am writing at time when all the extensive patches and fixes have been implemented. If you paid full price without the patches, my sympathies and your wrath probably is justified, that's a guess.

With that in mind, the 2014 edition is enjoyable to play like a marine in the Aliens world. Weapons are what terran space marines expect, short the melee weapons. The gun fire is satisfying and shooting mechanic is spot on, would love to have more smart gun though :) Weapons upgrades are more like sidegrades for the most part, and is really more about personal preference and style of tactics of the player. I play more like infantry, so it's pulse rifles, battle rifles and shotguns..wait, that's all there really is in the game! Flamer is a special pick up weapon, as is the smart gun ;_;

The Aliens themselves are well crafted and can catch you by surprise if you don't use your radar and terrain carefully. Alien animations are a bit jerky at times when they are transitioning to more complex transitions or moves, especially when they get into your melee region and the game is trying to decide which melee scenario to piece in (up close execution or 1 of the varied push backs) I played this on the hardest setting from the get go and found some parts challenging, but it was pretty easy for the most part.  The boss fights are a real let down, too easy or just brain dead, example: the lifter, punched with the left claw only....Big Alien Al down for the count as I punched it to the corner where it died in frightening death animation glitchies.
Honestly, if the Aliens were faster and more deadly with the same numbers, the game would be almost unplayable because the Zeno's would be all over the place and will kill you in an instant even if you got a shot off due to the acid blood and lurking face huggers. Try the Killing Floor Aliens mod and you will understand what I mean, HoE will destroy or put on edge the most well honed of teams in the more confined maps.

The environments are well put together and believeable to exist in the Colonial Marine world, some places could use a bit more polish, but it's all well presented for the most part. The level designs are pretty generic with some set pieces for bosses. Don't know what you are looking for if some find this game ugly or inconsistent with Aliens.

If you are a fan, I recommend this game at a discount price. There are still some bugs that are unforgiveable given the patches and fixes in place (Aliens spawning infront of me, ok, i shoot it...then another spawns in the same spot...bad!), but they don't brake the overall game and atmosphere. ACM gives us a bit more back story to the events after Alien3 and what will happen in future stories, and that is maybe the best thing that can be said about this game.

reviewText: I love this game.  The graphics are pleasing even if they are a little dated.  Co-op story mode is always a good thing.  The sounds seemed to be pulled straight from the movies (love that pulse rifle burp).  The radio chatter drew me into the game and made the linear story easy to digest.  The difficulty is punishing yet felt fair to me.  When I made too many mistakes I paid the price and had to go back to the drawing board, but this made completion of a section much more satisfying.  All in all, the game has aged well (in my eyes) and was a real joy.

reviewText:
It's not hard to see where this game has failed, I sincerily wanted it to be good. I'm a huge Alien(s) fan and I hoped to God that this game would be good, but gearbox really messed it up ( or did they ? ). After all, we will never know why this game turned out so horribly, maybe we will. I recommend this game only for >10 bucks/euros or lower. No more. Also, aside from the Bug Hunt DLC, don't buy any other ones, it's pointless since the matchmaking system is dead.
Pros:
>Amazing audio/sound track
>Iconic locations from the movies (ex: Hadley's Hope, Sullaco)
>Hicks is in it ( for me it feels awesome to battle xenos alongside people from the Aliens 1986 movie)
Cons:
>Awfull AI
>Horrible story + ending ( don't even get me started on the final boss battle)
>Overpowered marines + too much gear/ammo at once
>Co-op/Multiplayer is pretty much dead (you only have to have a lot of friends to play this)
>STUPID ALIENS (XENOS)
>outdated graphics (for 2013 standards, AvP 2010 looks better IMO )
If you find yourself in a steam sale and this is for under >10, get it. If not, avoid it at all costs. Alien: Isolation is going to come out soon, that game looks promising (hopefully).
