reviewText:
This game is so bad it gave me 4 different STDs previously unknown to science.

Even ignoring the fact that the game failed to live up to any of its hype, or that they pulled a huge bait and switch with the demos and the actual game, the game itself is complete junk.

1. The gunplay is clunky at best. It's very slow paced with little variety in the enemies you fight any any given time. The auto save function is also badly implemented and you regularly find yourself forced to go through several dice roll live/die encounters only to get cheap shotted at the last one and having to start the entire series over again.

2. Your deaths feel cheap - Rarely will you have a good" or "fun" fight. Either you clean up the Aliens with very little challenge or they will over run you and you die in 1-2 hits. While this melee quick death mechanic is understandable you typically find it happening because the Aliens will glitch and ignore your pushback attack
date: or because a friendly NPC doesn't pull his own weight - leaving you to ration out your precious bullets while they stand in an empty corner waiting for something interesting to happen. Which brings us to -\n\n3. The AI is awful. You a regularly forced to rely on AI controlled partners who forget what their job is. Whether it's opening a door
recommended: covering you while you open a door
hoursPlayed:
or sometimes even simply moving out of the way is often well outside of thier ability. The Aliens are equally glitchy. As previously mentioned they will sometimes  ignore your melee attack (often the only thing that will stop a quick death) or leap off of walls and just kind of forget what they were doing. The game is loaded with jump scares where a Xenomorph will leap out of a hatch and then loiter casually while they wait for you to kill them. They have a difficult time going through open doorways and it seems that the only challenge they pose is the occasional cheap death

4. The game is ugly - Not a lot to say about this. The textures in this game are unforgivably bad. The Aliens have few animations which makes they look kind of silly when they're doing anything but wall running. It looks like they try to hide some of this behind a very distracting film grain but even that does little to keep the game from looking 10 years older than it really is.

5. The Story is terrible - Just... just terrible. While there are many nostalgic things to see and easter eggs to find you're better off just rewatching the movies because it's not worth the time to slog through the game to find them. The dialogue is ham fisted
voteText: even for action movie meatheads and much of the "Story" seems like a series of very poorly scripted events that make little to no sense  *Spoilers* Why would a trained Marine throw a grenade at a missile which is sitting near your only way out? Why would multiple umbilicals between the ships break for seemingly no reason? All of this is almost forgivable if the end of the game wasen't completely given away within the first 10 minutes if you have even the most basic knowledge of the Alien series\n\nTL;DR  No

reviewText:
SO! This might be the most controversial game of the last 10 years! No joke!
Moving right on! Developed by Gearbox, TimeGate and Nerve, A:CM's story is a true sequel to 1986's Aliens, produced by James Cameron (amazing film) and also Alien 3 (which was kinda sh*tty) and the story meets my expectations and actually exceeds them, although I need to be fair and say that the ending is a bit disappointing AND there was this major plot point that never really got explained in the game (How the hell did the Sulaco get out of Fury 161?). It could use a bit more work, but as a sequel to the movies, it works pretty well and it's quite enjoyable throughout the whole campaign, out of all the 4 Movies + this game...Colonial Marines might have the best story out of all 5, really!

(let's face it, Alien(s) never had a good story to begin with... so... it's like a rotten apple in the middle of a pile of dog ♥♥♥♥...)

Gameplay: It's great! The sound of the Pulse Rifle just bursting away and the acid spewing from the Xenos is always great and the guns feel amazing! Just like I wanted them too! Some new guns were also introduced, something very risky and hard to pull off, but they nailed it, they feel like they have been there since the original movie! You will fight hordes of Xenos and PMC's throughout the game (the PMC's appear and are explained like in the 2nd level, and while I expected only to be fighting Xenos, the PMC's make sense in the story, surprinsingly!)

- Acid doesn't damage you, though... WHAT THE ♥♥♥♥?!

As for gameplay, I must also address the Xenomorph gameplay (they are only playable in the Multiplayer modes though). They feel much better compared to the Aliens from AVP2010, which felt very wonky and hard to control.The view is now 3rd person! F-I-N-A-L-L-Y!
Every fatality you pull off and every swipe with the claws feel amazingly nice and it's alot of fun! Too bad the Multiplayer is *almost* dead (you can still find some matches occasionally).

Graphics: Bad, the graphics are a massive disappointment, they look very different from the 2011 Demo and the Xenos (unlike in the Demo) like disappear after they die, something that didn't happen during the demo gameplay. The game, sadly, also has a few bugs/glitches. I beat the game twice (Soldier (which is normal) and Hardened, doing a 3rd now on Recruit (easy) to collect all the dog tags that are left (Missed like 3) and planning on doing a 4th playthrough on Ultimate Badass mode (it's the f*cked up mode, basically)) and I've witnessed 1 game breaking bug, where a door would just not open! Restarted the game and everything was fixed. Bugs, I found few but some...The most annoying was the Raven Boss battle, which involved the use of a PowerLoader. The Raven Boss battle has the Raven get stuck in some corners (which is the best part, just spam him with attacks xD) and some times teleport to the other corner of the arena. It's by far the worst part of the game, because of how extremely clunky it is!

Sound Quality: Amazingly Stellar, the guns sound the same as in the movie Aliens (they used the sound files from the movie so, there's that), the voice acting is solid (for the most part), I found it engaging and the characters sounded decently emotional when they should (too bad the facial animations are sh*t so when they are happy and sad, they look the same, something from like 2006, but this is part of graphics, not the sound, so anyways...), the lip syncing is a hit and miss, sometimes it's great, amazing actually, and sometimes it's just plain bad, so there's that as well...
I think I've pretty much covered everything (except what is the controvesy around this game, I'll post it in the comments for those who don't already know it...)

To finish it off, Aliens: Colonial Marines is... *shocker* not a bad game! But it's not great either and this game could pull off a GOTY award, it really really could! But to my sadness (as a kind of Hardcore fan of the Aliens franchise), it's far from a GOTy contender.

6.5/10, flawed on pretty much every aspect of it, it reeks potential, which btw, sadly isn't met. However! The fact that this game is REALLY FUN is undenyable imo. Thus the score...

Flame away, ♥♥♥♥♥es! I enjoyed A:CM even though Pitchford lied his ♥♥♥ off about it. Unexcusable, true; but that doesnt mean it ain't fun. Like a janky space version of Left 4 Dead...kinda.

(REVIEW EDITED TO FIX TYPOS)

reviewText:
If your a fan of the series you'll enjoy the single player and multiplayer, but the game is a heavy disappointment. If it's not bought during a sale you are getting ripped off. AVP was a much better game over all, but this game's only saving grace is both the easter eggs and the nostalgia of the characters, not to mention the return of a very well recived character.

5.5/10 It's playable, and patches helped but the game remains very underwhelming and seems more like Call of duty meets the alien world. The screenshots you see are not as good as in game. The aliens are very boxy movement adn the graphics are no where near E3 trailer.

PS, silencers are usesless do not use them, you will reduce you damage and aliens will detect you no matter what.

reviewText:
Terrible game. Literally the only saving grace is Bug hunt mode which is a seperate DLC where you defend against Waves of Aliens in co-op. It's awesome and i highly recommend you buy the game just for this mode alone. Sadly with the main game within half of one level you're already fighiting waves of humans. What is this i'm playing? Call of Duty Alien Ops? Most of the core game has you fighting humans with some Aliens here and now thrown into the mix. There's literally no respect for the Aliens in this game they are mindless drones with bare bones AI. The tension is ruined by the fact you can carry 15 weapons stocked up with ammo. Seriously? In the movie all they had was a few pulse rifles a busted up Flame Thrower and a couple of Grenades. Here its easy mode though.

Don't buy this game for the online because its dead, no one plays this game anymore, which forces it into a singleplayer only game. Now then, unless you have buddies who are willing to pay for this game, Then the mode you should play is Bug Hunt.

Things the game does right is the Sound Design. The game Sounds awesome! And that's awesome. Also the Visuals are quite good. The game nails the look of the movies down to the bolts on the walls.

Everything else is trash. I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone, You'd better spend your money on AVP2010 or AVP Gold. More fun and enjoyable and both games are made by a developer who actually care about the francise.

reviewText:
This is not bad, but it's not good ethier. When a game takes this long to be made there should have been red flags up by now. Colonial marines is one of those games that people got really hyped for and well got their dreams crushed.

The story feels like a bad alien fan fic with characters that are so memorable i forgot who they were after I played the game. hell the story is almost as bad as alien 3.

The visuals are mediocre Some ok modelling and it does do the job well of recreating some elements of the movies, I can Admit I did like the designs of the new xenos which are more plausable than say well a winged xeno with fire breath or something. though the particle effects look so bad they even show jaggies and the pixels. sound fairs better, but not much the sound effects again do a faithful job recreating the feel of the movies.

As for the gameplay well it's a fairly decent fps. The shooting is competant and shooting xenos CAN be enjoyable just good luck finding that. I do appreciate the retro fps elements like the healthpacks,carrying all the weapons and some exploration by finding certain guns and audio logs. the enemy ai despite what people will tell you *cough* angry joe are not that stupid infact they do what they should do attack the player hell sometimes the enemy was a major threat in some cases in my playthrough. the ally AI it's bad but it isn't a major problem unless you heavily rely on them which you don't. The multiplayer has it's moments but it isn't acceptional.

Overall Colonial Marines is just an average fps. Was I dissapointed? yes Could it have been better? yes. I will say that gearbox flat out lying for this product was unforgivable. So yeah I think that people thought colonial marines was awful was because of the high expectations after all anything that goes in dev hell has to be awesome like too human.

5/10 it's not bad nor good just sort of average.

reviewText:
I think this game has been burdened by bad press so I wanted to try and up it's good name. At the time of its original release, the game was incomplete and many felt it had been falsley advertised graphically etc. I also feel sorry for the pre-order people who got somewhat cheated in that respect. That sucks - the lesson there though is, don't pre-order a pc game ever. However, having bought the game about 2 weeks ago for 5 pounds (inc DLC), I have yet to encounter any bugs or glitches -  Gearbox have gone back and done a huge amount of patching, around 10GB worth (much to their credit) - EXCEPT for the very strange one when you try to quit the game and for some reason steam keeps re-launching the game over and over....there are easy fixes for that problem though, so it's really not a big deal. Apart from that, the bugs all seem to be fixed and it runs fine for me.

I have really enjoyed this game so far and I expected to turn it off straight away based on what all the other reviews say. But you need to realise that those reviews have everything to do with feeling 'cheated' on initial release and nothing to do with the quality of the actual CURRENT game. The graphics are actually CURRENTLY really nice; not next gen but nearly there - definitely top quality with awesome lighting effects. The strength of this game comes from how they have replicated the atmosphere and feel of the films through use of graphics and animation style - it's really authentic and true to Aliens -  and that is how the graphics succeed. It's not about technicality. If you love Aliens (the second film) this is definitely for you, as you get to go to many of the sick locations from the film and they are accurately portrayed.

GOOD THINGS:
The gameplay is really fun. If you wanted to be the marine, this is your chance. In honesty it's not perfect, but it's nearly there; Aliens limbs fly off when you shoot; your bullets feel like they connect well; the acid blood is well done; the sound of the guns - infact all the game sounds - are taken directly from the film so its absolutely great and authentic. It feels awesome firing that pulse rifle with its signature noise. Great selection of guns  espcecially with the dlc. The music is the same as the film which makes the atmosphere and experience really strong. The level art, escpecially in Hadleys Hope is excellent. Baddies can be blown to bits - I shot a dudes head off with HIcks' shotgun and loved it - and they die really well at times. Also the game has alot of style to its scripted and non scripted events! Solid voice acting.

BAD THINGS:
Things that let the game down are really minor and depend on how picky you are. For example some surfaces don't recieve bullet holes, some do. Some glass breaks, some doesn't. Many objects are static when they should have havoc or physX - but some do move and are destructible. Some dead bodies are identical to the next. Aliens corpses disappearing shortly after death. Generally it can feel a little rushed in places - moments when you think 'oh, they coulda done that a bit better...'

FINAL WORD:
It's a shame because it's only just short of being a perfect Aliens experience and it's as if they ran out of time - demonstrated by the rushed feel of identical dead bodies, surfaces that don't take bullet holes etc. HOWEVER DON'T LET THAT OR THE MINOR THINGS DETER YOU! You get so engrossed in the frantic slaying of xenomorphs that all these minor bad points really do fall into the background: they are over powered by everything good about the game. I urge you to try it but don't pay more than a tenner I would say. NOTE: For best experience, always fire from the hip as the iron sights make the gun look/feel like a toy - once you upgrade to laser sight this becomes easy and the shooting feels great again.
This really is a strong game, with a few disappointing things to note, but it is by no means ♥♥♥♥: if it was ♥♥♥♥ I would say because I have high standards....SO DEFINITELY PLAY IT! Especially if you are an Aliens fan! But again just don't spend more than a tenner.

reviewText:
Aliens Colonial Marines Review


I have to admit Aliens: Colonial Marines on the PC is actually not bad graphically, saying that I am writing this review after a few years since it came out with all the patches and update's.

I have to say after playing the console version the PC version of Aliens:Colonial Marines is without a doubt the best version of the game what the game should of been like on release, I picked this game up for cheap in 75% discount sale, so I never felt like I was being cheated out something it was bargain buy.

Biggest problem over all with the game is that the story is not logical and sometimes seems a little dumb at parts you got impression there was no passion behind the story they were developing game guess that what happens when out sourced and passed  along to as many dev-teams like they did.

The game is fun to play: Campaign & CO-OP mode is excellent  which is the games strongest point where can jump in with a squad of friend and go on exenomorph killing spree.

I would say campaign is probably the game biggest weakness but online Multi-player is fantastic and amazing fun it really does shake up FPS when you have to think about ambushing marines and using stealth and use your wit's to get a kill instead of running and gunning like you would in a (Call of duty match).

Multiplayer - I highly recommend (Escape Mode) and playing as the (Lurker Alien) and also the (Spitter for Team Death Match) which has the ability to shoot acid blood into colonial marines face.


I found myself going back  to online Team Death match - who ever made online mode well done because it's great fun shame the game was handled as poorly as it was becuase level designs has allot love put into them really does feel like you are on the world of LV-426.

reviewText:
I bought it so what? I love this franchise and don't judge! Even if most everyone else thinks this game is a piece of crap. I was among the many that stayed away because of the reviews and how much people felt cheated and lied to. After the patch, it became something different which is why I even considered forking over the $5 for this game. I will also admit that this isn't the same thing that was shown at E3, maybe a financial thing came up and they had to reduce things to be able to finish the product. Also, keep in mind that it wasn't just Gearbox that worked on this game, there were a few other studios who had their hands in as well funds more than likely had to be distributed evenly among the developers.

I'm 27 years old and I was exposed to this franchise at a young age I remember being on the edge of my seat chewing on my nails because the movies were so intense.

Now for the review. At first glance this game doesn't seem like much and most people need to be hooked in the first five minutes otherwise it's a flop or you have those that have played it for hours and hours and still feel cheated. In my case, that's not the truth here even though it kind of had a slow take off I will admit that I did get spooked a little bit even though the graphics are not top notch, but I don't care as long as the game has some sort of mechanic to make up for it. This game combines just enough intense moments, gun action, and Aliens that aren't as dumb as most people think to make up for the mediocre visuals, the new AvP wasn't that pretty either, but again visuals are not my primary focus when it comes to a franchise that I love. I personally think that they nailed the atmoshphere of the 1986 movie, the Aliens look great maybe just a little bit muddy up close, they feel real and can catch you quick if you aren't paying attention. There are moments where their AI literally stops making them a part of a shooting gallery with stationary targets. But when the AI does work, watch out! You'll be surprised.

Now for the sound and music, just one word, WONDERFUL! Weapons, environmental ambience, screeches all sound legit, etc. Get a good sound system to really enjoy them.

Would I recommend this game to a friend? Well, simple answer if they can see through the crap people claim about this game, sure. Otherwise it's not for everyone. It's always going to be a love to hate relationship with any game plain and simple.

8 out of 10 for me, I'm pretty satisfied with it despite it's minor flaws. The truth is people, your beloved CoD, BF3/4, Halo, and anything else game related are not going to be 100% perfect and they won't always be what you want them to be. So, just play it and see for yourself.

reviewText:
Это крайне заурядный шутер: старомодный, некрасивый, неудобный и очень тоскливый. Нет интересных событий, нет зрелищ, нет постановки, нет умных тактических сражений, нет страха, нет атмосферы. Игра выглядит несовременно и неряшливо сделана, несмотря на детальную проработку. Физики оружия нет. Здесь можно увидеть, как вода подтекает из целой и невредимой трубы, ксеноморфы выползают из вентиляционных отверстий, за которыми зияет чернота, а персонажи иногда отказываются делать то, что велит им скрипт. Чужие не просто ведут себя глупо, они еще и нелогичны. Они выскакивают на свет, затем прыгают на стену, выползают на видное место и застревают там. Из врагов натурально падают ящички с гранатами, патроны и аптечки, по палубам «Сулако» разбросаны шлемы и бронежилеты.

В кампанию можно играть даже вчетвером, но сюжет для этого совсем не предназначен. В результате получается глупость: там, где по сюжету в одиночной игре должны были быть двое морпехов, оказываются сразу пятеро.

В игре четыре сетевых режима, из которых выделяется только «Спасение». Задача морпехов — пробежать из пункта А в пункт Б и выжить, задача чужих — помешать им и всех убить. Управлять чужими придется с видом от третьего лица, а анимация тут просто ужасна — нормально проползти через дверной проем уже составляет проблему, какие уж там скрытные атаки и молниеносные нападения. Карт для каждого режима только две. Моя оценка 6/10.

reviewText:
Overall: 8/10

Ok. I pre-ordered this game (for PS3), got the collectors edition, and bought the season pass day one. All told I spent $100 dollars on this game ($105 now that I have it on Steam as well), and I must say that I feel all of the negative reviews to be a little bogus. I have beaten the single player campaign twice via co-op and once by myself, and spent countless hours in multi-player. I have played this game alot.

It is a good game, but not a great game. Maybe I was just lucky, but I have never had any of the glitches people talk about with this game, so its important to stress that they are not going to happen 100% of the time. I was really confused by all the glitch talk when the game first came out, to be honest, because nothing like that happened to me or my co-op buddy and we played through beginning to end on day one after going to the midnight launch. I've seen video, so I know they exist, but you are not guaranteed to see them.

Second, game-play is very standard shooter fare. But then again, its a shooter. You shoot things. The Aliens come at you from all angles, and you shoot them. Alot like the movie. No idea what the complaint here is. The guns sound awesome, the aliens go down about how you would expect, and the blood even harms you. Seems pretty straight forward. I think alot of people expected a splash of blood to kill you outright like in the movies, but that would just be unfun, unless it was some higher difficulty setting or something. You are a highly trained bad-♥♥♥ and you feel like it. Definitely more of a Halo than a survival horror game, but its what I expected. Maybe if you expected horror, you would be disappointed, but I knew this was a shooter from the moment I pre-ordered it.

Third, the attention to detail in the lev
els was cool. It was awesome to walk through the movie interiors, and everything felt like it should. Of course, according to plot the whole place was nuked, but this game is fan-service and nothing else about the plot makes sense, so why should this? I would rather have the fan-service moment and just enjoy it than ♥♥♥♥♥ about plot for a series not really known for its nuanced plots to begin with.

To sum up, I think that this game was exactly what I expected, and delivered everything I felt I was promised. Of course I went in expecting an 8/10 and I got roughly an 8/10. Some people I feel were mislead by cinematic trailers (the bane of the industry) and the hype machine, but really, what else could a movie tie-in game go but mediocre. There have been less than a handful of good movie games, and this is definitely in that category. Go in with realistic expectations, and you will have fun and that's the whole purpose.

reviewText:
This game is a mixed bag after it's horrible release, all the way to the current status with lot's of patches and DLC:s + graphics adjustments available to PC. However after many patches this game actually is pretty okay. Albeit the characters are shallow, Aliens still look and act glitchy and like puppets, although the enemy AI is improved somewhat. I'm not gonna lie and say this is a great game, it's not, but it's not the most awful game I've played either now with the patches. In a way I'm tempted to say that this is only for most hardcore fans but then again, it's exactly those who this game is most likely to disappoint due to expectations not going to be met. Maybe I would recommend this for someone completely unaware to aliens and who does not care for plot or atmosphere but is rather looking for simple shooter mechanics. I personally like some of the DLC maps and with friends it can be even fun. You just need to adjust your mindset for acm and absolutely throw expectations out the window.

This game had a lot of potential and in a weird way it kind of shows through the ugly cracks.. You can see (at least with the mega patches) That there was somekind of genuine effort to save this game. There are so many nods to the franchise and touches here and there, which all would be AWESOME had the game not been halfassed in development. If this game had what Alien Isolation has this game would trump all over it. But it's the production values that let this puppy down. Everything feels unfinished or dated. The story feels rushed, unimaginative and hardly does justice to the films, even when it has the genuine characters and surroundings. Quite frankly, the story feels like it's written by someone who does not care for the movies or simply is untalented..

-ADDED after playing DLC-

Thankfully here is where the excellent Stasis Interrupted DLC comes in and saves this whole game for me. The story, the atmosphere, even the level design is on a whole new level when compared to the normal campaign! I couldn't believe what a difference! The dreadful story holes are explained so that the story of this ties way more smoothly to Aliens saga and ties it all into the ending of Alien 3 too. In a not too bad way I think, albeit still far from perfect. The AI too seems ways better or then it's the way the levels are designed that push the enemy to flank you and surprise you in new ways. At least in ultimate badass mode. The problem however is the shortness of the DLC in comparison to the already short campaign of the main game. However I must say that I find this DLC redeeming this game enough for me to change it's status from not recommended to a RECOMMENDED for fans! In the stasis you even get some of that character development that was dreadfully missing from the main game. You start to feel something for characters. It's basically a new game in the shell of the main game, however tying into it's mechanics and story arch. So the Stasis Interrupted DLC is GOOD in my books.. Obviously it's still limited by the technology of the original ACM so don't expect miracles, but there was effort to correct what could be done without rewriting the whole game. Sadly complete rewrite IS what would be needed for win.

-DLC bit ends-

Now back to the MAINGAME review:

The other thing in MAIN GAME is the nonexistant character develompent which is closer to someone's home movie in direction and in complexity of character. Lousy voice acting, bad writing.. The Characters alone make this game a failure. Even if it had super graphics, the characters would ♥♥♥♥ you off. Something that ties in here with the characters is the AI which is broken, even with the patches it feels no good. Your guys will help you getting killed but DO NOT HELP you in any other way. It's not uncommon for O'neal to stand in your way, blocking door acces without shooting any enemies, while you begging him to let you through to get to cover from onslaught of bullets flying your way. This is definitely a game where friendly fire would be a good thing. O'neil needs to be capped off on many occasions..
Or then he spouts embarassing commentary right out of a generic shooter while shooting at walls or crates even when the enemy is standing right in front of him. This game would be a better game if you'd be completely alone, rather than having your company ruin atmospehere and gameplay for you.

Obviously that's not how this game was designed to be, as you are a colonial marine. But that's the other thing. They had the idea of making you a part of a 'team' but then they don't even give you team. For the most part it's just you and some other marine, making your 'colonial marine squad' a band of 2 all the time with some short exceptions. You never feel like a marine in the single player.
The other 'marines' are puppets hanging in the background and having one animation or grunt. In one mission you had to search and rescue these other marines and they were completely lifeless and soulles like zombies when you rescue them. Not even eyes or mouths were moving when you save their LIFE, and then they disappear like the bodies do in the game so your'e left alone again. At least by modifying .ini values you can force the corpses to stay but in a way, why would you want that? It's better that they disappear from ruining your mood (irony)

Yet for some inane bizarre reason I've grown to like this game somewhat. Maybe it's like those b-scifi movies that are so bad it's kind of good.. Or I'm just crazy.On pc there are ways to make this game look better graphically and I would say WAY better in terms of atmosphere and lighting so you only end up disliking the rest in the end. I think since I've adjusted the graphics so that the locations look cool and atmospheric is the reason why I like this game now, with all it's gut wrenching flaws. Since the locations are the only thing they nailed in making this game (as far as old ut3 engine allows) It's now bringing back memories from the movie. Also MP levels have great design and nods to the movies, even nostromo is there although not part of the James Cameron version of the movie. Now that I've said a few positive comments, it's time again to burst the bubble on this game. The aliens suck bigtime. They are like puppets with dumb AI and only resemble by fraction the scary killing beast they were in the movies. They remind me of a zoo simulation where apes are running towards you and jumping up and down, getting stuck on walls and whatnot or just standing there with their butts towards you waiting for you to cap them off. Also there is no interaction with them whatsoever. They seem not even knowing you're unloading a clip at them, there's no reaction until the death animation kicks in. It makes them feel autobots rather than the scariest beast in the universe. Although this too changes in the Stasis Interrupted DLC where I suddenly felt anxious about an alien encounter. They should have focused wholly on aliens in the main game and spare the troopers of Weyland Yutani corp. to the DLC because here THEY FIT RIGHT IN to the story. In a not as terrible way! The story is told and moved along better. And it's great how the frantic fighting between them and aliens is made in, allowing you to be a rogue surprise for both aliens and humans.

Multiplayer is fun too, that's the good part I find with this game, the MP Escape missions for instance where your frantically trying to get to a rescue ship while battling hordes of enemies and your team tries to open heavy doors and stuff while combating their way and healing downed marines because there's safety in numbers is fun to me. These matches get hectic and with the original sounding soundtrack booming in the background your heartrate may actually start to rise out of something else than just frustration.This game is not fun straight out of the box but it can grow on you.

reviewText: There are a lot of negative reviews for this game and I can see why. But as a die hard fan of the series, with friends who play it, I think it's a lot of fun. You're a meathead soldier on a meathead quest. It was always going to be just a shooter. If you really love the franchise, it's worth the 15 bucks. Or wait for a sale. I find it a lot of fun.

reviewText:
Aliens Colonial Marines is a masterful experience, and here is why:

Perfection. That is the only word for it. Aliens colonial marines is a masterpiece in every sense of the word, from the art style, to the graphic fidelity.

Indescribable, that's how I would but the audio. Take the gauss rifle, or the voice acting, for example, all bring eargasm's galore.

Let's talk about the game play for one salty ♥♥♥♥ing second, it's amazing 10/10. The gun play is unrivalled, no other game could ever compare to this majestic ♥♥♥♥ing artwork.

Even though its god bad reviews, this is only because everyone is so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ jealous. The devils at Valve have hired many individuals to negatively degrade this smegma-filled joy ride.

Oh don't even get me ♥♥♥♥ing started on the level design. Take for example, the unforgettable spash-ship levels, that provide the authentic aliens experience every fan of the franchise longs for.

Forget about Halo, forget about gears of war, COD, TF2, Battlefield, all of 'em. They all pale in comparison to the epic ♥♥♥♥ train that is Aliens colonial marines. No-body could truly comprehend how amazing this game was, so they tossed aside it brilliant story and game play in favour of these inferior games.

Solid plot line, if not better. I think anyone can feel satisfactory for paying full price for this ludicrous display, and I doubt anyone can keep a straight face when trying to talk about the issues with the game.

However, the game does have dlc, which further raises the price if you want the full experience, but this isn't the developers fault, this is just to capitalise on this majestic ♥♥♥♥ing experience.

It's a true marvel, a wonder of the 21st century. I have never experienced such masterful perfection, never before have I adored such a game.

That's all I got to say about this hidden gem of a game, but if you want my true opinion on the game, just read the first letter of each paragraph"."

reviewText:
Aliens: Colonial Marines has gotten a bad rap, and justifiably so. But is it as horrible as people would have you believe? Not really. There are many worse games for sale. But fortunately, there are far more better games out there as well.

Much of the uproar about the game was about how its graphics failed to live up to the pre-release trailers; on launch, the game looked noticably poorer in comparison. But even in that sorry state, the game was hardly a disaster on the eyes; in many areas, it looked equivalent in quality to other multi-platform FPS games. In a select few areas, the game was actually quite nice looking, in fact. Since then, the developers have released a four gigabyte patch which rectifies many of the game's visual faults and - while it will never be competitive with games like Metro 2033 or Crysis 3 - can easily hold its own against the Call of Duty or similar games.

No, unfortunately, the problems with the game lay far deeper than the visual gloss. Almost every other area of the game was flawed, from the musical score, to the storyline, or the unimpressive AI and underpowered weaponry. Forget how the title looked; the game itself was simply not fun to play.

The AI is flat-out laughable. Pre-patch, it was possible to walk up to one of the eponymous monstrosities and punch them to death. Even after being patched, it was not uncommon to see the dreaded xenomorphs of the franchise ignore targets to chase their own tails. They inspired no fear whatsoever. The human enemies were far more of a threat, but only because they could attack from range and thus had a greater opportunity to actually hit you.  The primary change made to the AI by the patch is that their attacks inflicted more damage, but the actual AI routines remain predictible.

The story and setting are forgettable at best, and insulting at worst. It flat out contradicts the franchise's canon in a poor attempt at a surprise twist. The characters are uninteresting and the voice-acting was poor, despite the use of known actors such as Michael Biehn, who half-heartedly reprises his role as Cpl. Hicks from the movie Aliens. The soundtrack is utterly unnoticable, and failed to inspire any emotion or excitement whatsoever.

I could go on. The animations of the characters - aliens and humans alike - border on the pathetic. The weapons lack the power we expect from guns that carry names such as pulse rifles" or "smart guns"
date: and anyway ammunition is in such short supply that you'll rarely get to use them to full effect anyway. The level design is linear and crowded
recommended: and - except for the rare setpiece - rarely offers anything appealing to look at. There's not enough variety in weapons or enemies to keep things entertaining
hoursPlayed: and most objectives are little more complicated than "walk over there". There are a few highlights - one level has you stealthing through a sewer of sleeping aliens - but this is the rare exception.\n\nStill
voteText: the game is not entirely hopeless
helpfulPercent: especially for fans of the franchise. Revisiting the (virtual) sets of the second movie has great appeal
votesHelpful: and it was hard for me not to get excited when I crawled through the ruins of the Hadleys Hope colony
votesTotal: the ductwork of the Sulaco or visited the dead "Engineer" seen in both Alien and Prometheus. There were rare moments of terror and adrenaline rush when facing down a horde of xenomorphs. And I never get tired of hearing the scream of an alien or the chattering roar of the pulse rifle.\n\nStill
votesFunny: is that enough to save the game
commentsCount: much less recommend it? Sadly
column16: no
column17: on both counts. Aliens Colonial Marines has its moments but they are too far apart and too interspersed with ineffectual gameplay to make for a fun experience. It may not deserve the entirity of the wrath that has descended down upon it
column18:
but neither should it garner much praise.

reviewText: While this game has been getting bad reviews from certain people I do believe that they have missed the point completely. The game is, in fact, an in depth look into how silly modern FPS games really are. The terrible graphics, mediocre gameplay and non-existant boss fights only strengthen the game's message and that in regard there is only one score I can truely give this game, no the piece of art, a 10/10. In short it is game of the year and could very well be the greatest gaming experience of all time.

reviewText:
Although this game was highly anticipated, it did not hit the ground running. After a poor reception the game has been patched and now it's very enjoyable. If you're a fan of the Alien film series and would like to take a step back to Aliens, then this is the game for you. Set after the Aliens movie, it allows you to revisit film locations and brings back film characters (with their original voice actors) for another round against the xenomorphs. The levels are atmospheric, there are plenty of collectables and a choice as far as weapons and mods go. The story helps to fill in a few gaps and tie up some loose ends, but ultimately tells it's own standalone story. There is a multitude of easter eggs for film fans and gamers alike.

Pros:
•	Atmospheric visuals and a wonderful soundtrack.
•	Movie references everywhere!
•	Excellent xenomorph animation.
Cons:
•	Required extensive patching to be enjoyable.
•	Short story (although DLC is available).
•	Limited choice of weapons and upgrades.

Yes its not the game its hyped up to be but give it a chance and its a reasonable game in a fantastic aliens film like setting. Queen was far too easy to beat and the end and was a bit of an anti-climax.\nAgain play on hard and you will enjoy it.

reviewText:
I was hesitant to buy the game at first because of the bad reviews, but when the price dropped I gave it a try and boy am I loving this game. The game faithfully recreates the atmosphere from the movie Aliens and I really felt like I was experiencing the world of Aliens in the eyes of a Colonial Marine soldier, which was all i wanted. Although the story is kind of cliche, and the main character and companion NPCs do not get fleshed out enough in terms of character development. But asking for award winning story-telling in an fps action game seems a bit unrealistic. Perhaps when James Cameron makes an Aliens game we can have that :D

Where the game does shine is in the multitude of authentic weapon models  and their mods, for example you can attach scopes, stock, ammo types, magazine extension, grenade launcher and flamethrower on one of your many primary assault rifles like the iconic pulse rifle or secondary weapon like the pump-action shotgun that appeared in the film etc.. What is more, you also get the chance to use the iconic motion tracker and smartgun in intense climatic game sequences, just like it is in the film. All the weapons seem painstakingly modelled according to how it appeared in the movie Aliens. Graphics and FXs are generally well done and the variety of level designs are also pretty authentic that playing the game will give you frequent flashbacks of scenes from Aliens.

To be sure, the enemy AIs can be unresponsive at times. Aliens can get stuck between game objects and cease to move, but I have only encountered this less than a handful of times, one of which was when i was fighting in the iconic power loader. The monster got stuck on top of a crate and I think I was only able to killed it because of that bug :D  Some people say the voice work is bad, but maybe it is just the cheesy dialog, but then again the dialog in Aliens is pretty cheesy too. All in all,  I think the game got the feel of Aliens right. If you are a fan of the movie Aliens this is the game for you, just don't expect award winning story-telling, tho i wish :D

reviewText:
I am having a hard time about whether to recommend A:CM or not.

If you consider what the game could have been, and what it was shown to be before its publishing, then no, you absolutely must not buy or play this game. Go watch Aliens instead... you will have a pleasant 2 hours or so. If you choose the game, you will probably waste more time on a completely average game with some rare high points and mostly lows. The story is very generic, has too few aliens and too much CoD-type shoot-outs. The graphics is so-so, though in 2013, I would expect character models to be a billion times better (even with the patches). The gameplay quickly turns into Call of Duty - Some planet with Monsters edition, minus the new ideas that you sometimes got in CoD. Overall, whatever could be messed up in the creative department, Gearbox managed to mess up. Thanks Randy Pitchford for repeatedly saying, how much you care.

If you like shooters, and do not insist on having multiplayer (as nobody plays anymore, even though it was kinda decent in parts), this game may still be for you. It does not do shooting badly... only it does not do much else. If you like Aliens fan fiction, so much so that you do not mind not-so-good writing (a somewhat uninteresting story in the Aliens universe, if I wanna be generous to this game), this game might have some nice parts for you. Also, the expansion adds quite a bit. If you like sci-fis, and are bored out of your skull, and do not mind wasting some money to try this game, it is probably a better alternative than staring at your wall (depending on what is on your wall, of course).

I am a huge fanboy of Aliens and was thoroughly disappointed by this game, and quite honestly, started to really hate Gearbox for making it like this. (Check the internetz for the stories around development, if you like.) The game may not be as bad as it looks for people who liked Aliens - you might get a few good hours of play out of it if you did not.

In addition, the BugHunt multiplayer mode was quite decent, and for some time, it is fun to play the story in co-op as well. Unfortunately, these days nobody plays multiplayer so only consider this if you have friends who also have the game.

reviewText: It is patently obvious that Gearbox is no longer to be trusted. They evidently did not put the effort into this game that it deserved, and is a considerable disappointment. Do not believe any preview screenshots or trailers of this game, as they are not indicative of the final product whatsoever.\n\nThat said, if you do not go in with high hopes, they cannot be shattered, so you could be pleasantly surprised. The game has solid gunplay, acceptable aesthetics, and a generally inoffensive plot. Overall fun, but no triple-A game. A 6/10 at most.

reviewText:
Not as bad as it was when first released i have to be honest.  It certainly improved somewhat with the patches but this didnt fix alot of the bugs, graphics are very console'ish and look pretty average even on max settings.
If you're a die hard fan of the Aliens franchise and the second movie you will appreciate the little touches and scenery much more as i did, even the sound track sometimes feels very cinematic and helps with the atmosphere of the moment.
The Season pass with the DLC and extra Missions/storyline is interesting but be warned there is just one single sub story so its not really not worth the extra expense unless you get it on sale.

I'd give the game 65/100.  Its worth a play through but don't expect too much from it, its not a game you could play through twice.

reviewText:
5 out of 5 for all the right reasons.

I have never reviewed a game before, but I'm going out of my way for this one because it deserves to be defended.

The game is not mind blowingly spectacular. It's not a high end, maximum graphic type game.
HOWEVER, what the game does have is gameplay that keeps you highly entertained and that's what I paid for.

The COOP is perfect, arming 4 Marines in a war against Aliens and mercenaries. The weapons upgrade system is minimal but leaves you feeling satisfied when add new attachments and skins to your guns.

The A.I. isnt terrible and on the Ultimate Badass it's quite fun with 4 people waging war against the Aliens.

I do not have the DLC's however I am told they only make the game better than it already it is.

Long story short, people give this game a bad rap because they are expecting a major title type game. That just isnt the case here, but rest assured, it's a fantastic game and I'd pay for it again if I had a do-over. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a highly addictive and action packed COOP game.
Posted: December 28, 2013.

reviewText:
I had very high expectations when I played ACM for the first time.

Those expectations were sadly not met. Yet I took my time for a playthrough.

Here are my Observations:

The Game features awesome locations, good voice acting, quality storyline and some very good graphic effects.
You get to visit several locations known from The Prometheus/Alien-Lore, and you encounter several well known movie-characters. Weapons and Upgrades are a neat addition to the armament known from the movies. You get the chance to collect several rare" weapons from the characters involved in the Aliens-Movie. Sound FX are awesome as well!

The entire single player campaign can be played in Co-Op.

What I did like:
> Gameplay in most situations was fast paced
date: adrenaline pumping straight forward.\n> The Aliens looked very good; also the new (spoiler) Alien lifeforms fit perfectly into the lore.\n> The Maps/levels were as good as it gets for the limited terrain (A Colony on a Planet
recommended: and SpaceShips)\n> about 9hrs to complete the Campaign is enuf
hoursPlayed:
yet not too much.
> Awesome GFX & SFX
> Coop Campaign.

What I did not like:
> Sometimes
voteText:
the AI was pretty dumb. Counts for friendlys standing in your way as well.
> Repetitive gameplay

> Bossfights were borderline stupid


Overall I will recommend this game. Its been great fun!"

reviewText: Having bought this on pre order for PS3 and being utterly utterly disappointed/angry with it, im not entirely sure why I ended up buying it again for PC... oh hang on I know, it wasnt £40 anymore, it was £3. If you make the effort to read the community pages and mod this up (have a look in the .ini files, you'll find all kinds of gfx options that are locked out originally) you will probably find a bit of enjoyment here, particularly if you are an Aliens fanboi/fangrrrl. Multiplayer seems to still work decently as of Feb 2014 which is something I certainly couldnt say for the abysmal PS3 version. The last patch on PC also seems to have fixed a lot of the ludicrous AI issues that plagued it when it first came out, and if you apply all the mods correctly its not an awful looking game at all with Bloom / HDR etc enabled. It just makes you think what if they had actually got their act together in the first place?"\n\nA missed opportunity for sure but worth a punt in the sub-£5 category and if you can be bothered to download a couple of the small mods and do some .ini file tinkering."

reviewText: as we all know the game was advertised pre release as aving far better graphics than it came out with, id always wondered what what was up with that until i finally got this game today and saw it was on an old DX9 engine, no doubt a compromise we can thank the xbox360 and ps3 for -_- but if you can look past the lack of features that make todays game look so good you can see the textures, lighting and models are all as promised and show a real labour of love the game doesnt look all and out bad just lacks features people with lower grade PCs would turn off anyway. freindly AI howether is exactlty as bad as promised and expect little help from your NPC allies but of course the game IS meant for co-op. that being said the aliens behave exactly as they should and i say that as childhood alien obsessor. take it from someone who collected every comic, trading card, book and novel on the franchise! expect them to use hit and rrun tactics when alone where they will attempt to hide in the shadows and use the cealing and enviroment to close in on you or lie in wait for you and to be rushed by dozens at a time. as for the enviroment and sets everything is down to a T i found no fault at all! to some up the devs clearly did an incredible job building this game its just a shame they had to ship it out on such an outdated engine.

reviewText:
Aliens Colonial Marines.

Having gone through the campaign, and experienced the multiplayer for a few hours, I feel like I can give my review/opinion of this title.

Let's get one thing out of the way first. Everyone knows the amount of hate this game is having everywhere. Reviewers didn't like it, and players didn't like it either... Although i feel most of those players talking about how bad this game is, probably didn't even try it. The question everyone asks is this: Is A:CM really that bad? The answer my friends, is yes and no.

This is a very straight forward, linear shooter. Objectives are simple, aliens are dumb (terrible AI in the sense that they always run at you, with no strategy other than eat your bullets), humans are annoying to deal with and you are incredibly overpowered with all the weapons you can carry with you at all times. The only way this game will challenge you a bit is on the Ultimate Badass difficulty.

A lot has been said about the visuals, but having played this game maxed out my opinion is that the game looks good, if not great. There is the occasional low rez texture, but the PC version at least manages to look above average. The unreal engine is a well proven juggernaut in the games industry, so the engine is not the problem. The lazyness of the developers is, but only in some aspects of the game world. It could have looked a lot better (no out of the box Direct X 10 or 11 support... Gearbox what's wrong with you...), but as it stands this game looks ok, and in some parts it looks great.

I feel the gameplay is a lot like COD. Depending on who you ask, it may be a bad or a good thing. In my opinion the gameplay is fine, the game is fast and the shooting mechanics are simple to master. Most fans of shooters like Crysis, Far Cry or Battlefield will more than likely hate the gameplay of Colonial Marines.
It is a very simple game for today standards.

Having said that, if you are an Alien fan, you will most definately enjoy this game, and possibly even love it. The details and fan service from the alien franchise are top notch. There are tons of references and visual cues from that beloved franchise. But the game itself falls flat in it's ambitions, and it is certainly not the Aliens sequel we were promised. The story is wonky and doesn't make much sense, but it's ultimately serviceable. Multiplayer is fun, providing you play with players from your own rank. It can be incredibly unbalanced due to the level up system, but stick with it and you will have some fun.

In conclusion, i would only recommend this game as a must buy if you are a truly hardcore Aliens fan. The game is flawed, it lacks the tension from the Aliens franchise, and it won't scare you much, if at all. Some moments in the game do make you feel you are in the movie, but these are few and far between.

If you are undecided about this game, or if you are a shooter fan, chances are this game will be too linear for your taste, and it is not much of a challenge. If you can try the game somewhere before buying would be best. I know most people are hating on this game, but I am having a great time playing it. It is a very decent shooter, but we were all expecting a great one... And great Colonial Marines is not.

I would rate this game a 6.5 out of 10

The Good

-Environments true to the movies;
-Plenty of fan service;
-Some (few) aspects of the story
-Co-Op;

The Bad

-Wonky AI at times
-Unbalanced Multiplayer
-Low quality textures in unexpected places;
-Linear

reviewText: Being a huge Alien fan I was suckered into preordering this game for the xbox 360 back in the day. Everything you have probably heard about this game's quality is true. The graphics are nowhere near as stunning as they were portrayed to be in the early tech demo and the promotional screenshots (although the huge post launch patch did improve them vastly). The Alien and human AI (both your partners and enemies) gargles galactic balls, as either group often gets hung up in door ways or on props. The shooting feels very underwhelming, as most weapons lack an appopriate oomph, and aside from the pulse rifle they all are very underpowered damage wise. There is absolutely no atmosphere or tension in this game, save for one borderline genius level around a quarter of the way in. It's sad to see that a game that just came out a few years ago was unable to conjure up the same exhilaration and tension that AvP2 was able to over a decade ago. If you shop online frequently and love Aliens/tolerate or like Predator, then I highly recommend Aliens Vs. Predator 2, the game not the terrible movie. That game has a brilliant intertwining campaign told from 3 different perspectives, as well as genuine terror and tension, combined with sharp gunplay and mechanics. Very little fluff either, which Colonial Marines packs in en masse. I would avoid this game unless steeply discounted, and even then you probably will be disappointed unless you download the recent overhaul mod a dedicated fan released. Better quality work in a free mod than this corporate produced turd.

reviewText: Remember at the end of Shawshank Redemption when Andy makes his escape through the sewer pipe? How he crawls to freedom through 500 yards of ♥♥♥♥-smelling foulness and once he finally exits the pipe, he throws his arms up in the air and soaks in the rainfall? That scene pretty much sums up the Aliens: Colonial Marines experience. You spend about six hours trudging through a dull and repetitive FPS that's loaded with awful AI, unsatisfying gunplay, and poor writing. A truly tedious ride that lacks any real tension. But then you beat the final boss and reach the end credits. Happiness begins to pour over you. You realize that it's all finally over and celebrate by quickly deleting the game from your hard drive entirely. You feel like you crawled through a river of ♥♥♥♥ and came out clean on the other side.\n\nI'm just thankful that I was able to get A:CM for free after rebate, putting me out only the cost of a stamp. Now if only there was a way to get that six hours of my life back.

reviewText:
Aliens: Colonial Marines Review (PC)
Intro
Going into Aliens: Colonial Marines, I had huge expectations.  With a developer such as gearbox attached to the the project, hopes were high for this FPS release..  Fans of the Aliens series were promised a true sequel to the James Cameron classic, and gamers were promised a cinematic, intense survival experience.  Early gameplay looked very promising, but Colonial Marines disappoints on almost every front.
Presentation
The campaign places you in the shoes of Corporal Christopher Winter, a member of a search and rescue team sent in to investigate the U.S.S. Sulaco after the events of Aliens.  The setup is decent enough, but the story is nothing special, but no doubt veteran Aliens fans will want to see it through.  The opening cinematic is where the game's problems start.  It contains frighteningly low res texture and some awful lip syncing.  This set the tone for the rest of my experience.  Even running on max setting on a gaming PC, the textures look more like a last gen title rather than a beautiful HD current gen title.  Some of the levels do however have the creepy atmosphere you would expect from an Aliens title.  In regards to the lip syncing, it's mostly terrible.  While the voice acting is good enough, the dialogue just doesn't match the facial animations.
One of the only aspects of the presentation I really enjoyed was the sound effects.  The iconic dreadful beeping of the motion tracker and sounds of gunfire are accurate to the movie, and fans will appreciate that.
Gameplay
The campaign follows a simple linear level design, and it becomes repetitive very quickly.   After only an hour of gameplay, the game falls back on existing FPS conventions instead of doing anything interesting.  The game fails monumentally to create any survival horror tension by constantly loading the player with loads of ammo.  However, in the sewer level, this mechanic is taken out, and it works much better.  When your guns and immense firepower are taken away, Your really feel vulnerable.  There are a couple of good scares that couldn't have happened if you had access to all your weapons.  It's a shame the whole game doesn't feel like this.
Another gripe I had with the campaign is the A.I.  Rarely have I seen a game with artificial intelligence so bad.  Even when playing on the hardened mode, xenomorphs run directly at you and do not approach any situation intelligently.  When the game puts you up against the infamous Weyland Yutani corporation, the difficulty spikes.  Guns guns take you down much, much quicker than any alien in the game can.  It needs some serious balancing.
If there is one place where the game shines, its in its multiplayer.  While the standard team deathmatch mode is in place, modes such as escape and extermination provide exciting online experiences.  Escape is a 4v4 game mode with four xenomorphs hunting down four marines moving from point A to point B, while extermination pits four marines in a confined position to hold out as long as possible against four xenomorphs.  The game modes are mostly fun, but the xenomorphs feel terribly underpowered and once again the marines are given loads of ammunition, taking away much of the tension.
Conclusion
It's really a shame Aliens: Colonial Marines couldn't be better.  With a developer like Gearbox behind the title, many were given false hope that the Aliens License would finally be put to good use..  Long development times are responsible for many of the games problems.  With lackluster A.I., forgettable gameplay, and downright atrocious visuals, this title is a disappointment to fans of the Alien series and gamers alike.
Final Score: 3.75/10

reviewText: I actually had fun playing it. I've never regarded Cameron's 'Aliens' to be a horror film, its an action film to me. Since this game is based on 'Aliens' I expected an action game, which is what I got. However Colonial Marines has plenty of creepy moments, especially if played alone and with headphones. Regarding the over-arching storyline I don't really care whether every detail in the game matches the films or not, I liked the storyline as it relates to your main character and his team of marines, to me that was more meaningful than the rest.\n\nI also thought the voice-acting was good, although the facial animations were not. I like the weapons and the ways you can upgrade them, and how you are forced to choose between different attributes. I like that the game takes you through a wide range of scenarios and environments, the designs are done really well. The music was also good. My only significant complaint is that the aliens have been dumbed down" too much on the 'Recruit' level. On the harder difficulty settings they get smarter
date: or at least more aggressive. That is where the AI becomes good.\n\nI can understand why most people consider ACM a failure since it lacks the superior production quality of a Borderlands game. I can also understand that people who expected a horror game got disappointed since perhaps they view 'Aliens' as a horror film and not an action film. However for someone like me who expected an action game and who is not so picky with graphics and whether or not the storyline is a 100% fit with the films
recommended: this was not a failed game."

reviewText: Well now that I've been playing gearbox's attempt at the aliens franchise for a year, yes I would say give this a shot. Even after it's bad press and flaws. reviewText: Remember at the end of Shawshank Redemption when Andy makes his escape through the sewer pipe? How he crawls to freedom through 500 yards of ♥♥♥♥-smelling foulness and once he finally exits the pipe, he throws his arms up in the air and soaks in the rainfall? That scene pretty much sums up the Aliens: Colonial Marines experience. You spend about six hours trudging through a dull and repetitive FPS that's loaded with awful AI, unsatisfying gunplay, and poor writing. A truly tedious ride that lacks any real tension. But then you beat the final boss and reach the end credits. Happiness begins to pour over you. You realize that it's all finally over and celebrate by quickly deleting the game from your hard drive entirely. You feel like you crawled through a river of ♥♥♥♥ and came out clean on the other side.\n\nI'm just thankful that I was able to get A:CM for free after rebate, putting me out only the cost of a stamp. Now if only there was a way to get that six hours of my life back.

reviewText:
(full review at bleedingedgegaming.wordpress.com)

If you’re not an Aliens fan, steer your money away from this game.  If you have spent every day since the first time you saw Aliens wanting a REAL sequel, you have just found your favorite teddy bear in the attic.  This is sixty dollars you will never miss or wish you had back in your pocket.  Any one of the fanboy watercooler moments in the last half of this game is worth the sticker price to a fan.  Hell, if you have the PC version and the settings maxed, the guy who owns the original cast of the “space jockey” now has nothing you haven’t had.  He spent millions and you still got to climb on it anyway.  Since I fall in category number two, this once I am going to have to beat down every journalistic standard I normally adhere to.  This game does not deserve this score by science, but this is how my heart felt.

8/10

reviewText:
The aliens in this game are like zombies from Let 4 Dead, no intelligence, vast numbers, recklessly run at you from afar. So if you play this first, then watch the films, you won’t properly appreciate the fiction behind Alien. Saying that, the game portrays a great and fun survival horror. Campaign is fairly short but still fun, although you'll be sick of seeing aliens by the end. Some maps are pretty badly designed, I found a huge out of map glitch just by walking around some of the rocks that enclose the map, and slipped through a bit of the scenery to get right outside.

Biggest of the game's problems are the various immersion-breaking aspects. Your squad mates are invincible and have unlimited ammo, the former because half the time you can walk straight through them. It is a little distracting to be walking down a corridor and have a fellow marine run straight through you. However bad this may seem though, it is better than babysitting vulnerable AI teammates - nothing is worse than failing a mission because the CPU player got itself killed, or you died trying to bail the dumb CPU out of a tight spot. Enemy AI is a bit dodgy - but this is really no worse than most other first person shooters, so it is unfair to criticise this game for it. Aliens do have a tendency to run at you rather than use the walls/ceiling, but they do drop in behind you enough to create some panic-inducing moments.

However, top of the draw is the sound design. Lifting most of the effects and musical score straight from the film helps to create a real Aliens atmosphere. The motion tracker is great and it's only a shame that it doesn't pick up more false positives. The voice acting isn't horrendous plus Michael Biehn and Lance Henriksen are used as Hicks and Bishop. The story is just an excuse to keep a sense of urgency about the game and is perfectly fine with a satisfactory ending.

reviewText: You hear the sound of wet vomiting splashing against a window, punctuated by the umistakably harsh weeping of grown men.  Somewhere, a dog is howling at an empty vase.  A large tick crawls out of a salt shaker, glaring at you with contempt.  Giant ants stumble drunkenly into walls and seemingly forget their purpose, they being to question the rationale of their existence.  A sweaty woman shoots paper flowers out of an automatic rifle.   An aircraft with no bottom slowly ascends into the heavens, only to be ripped apart by unseen forces, and then slowly falls, piece by piece as the chunks slowly dissolve into glowing green squares.  Your wallet feels lighter.\n\nSomewhere, Randy Pitchford is laughing.

reviewText:
It's interesting, I watched the Angry Joe review when it first came out, and the game didn't look that impressive or anything, so I didn't feel like buying the game. However, I have now sense recently bought the game on PC on sale with DLC.

And my thoughts?

...


I think it's a really good game. Maybe it's the patches and DLC that really help the game. Because now we have the Bughunt gamemode, really great HD textures, and new maps to work with. Besides that, the music is great, the weapons are fantastic, the atmosphere is really good, and the campaign isn't that bad, hell, even Soldier difficulty now seems to be more difficult. The bughunt is great because now, you really don't know where an alien is coming. You pretty much HAVE to use the motion tracker and that really helped immerse me into the game's world more. Also, here's my biggest argument or praise is, please bare with me on this... the Alien AI. Again, maybe it was a patch, but the alien AI is fan-♥♥♥♥ing-tastic. They use the walls, climb on the ceilings like all the time, they hide into ducts and go under the floors, etc. They're AI is great. They really make use of their environment to their full advantage. So props to you Gearbox and SEGA for that.

Try this game out and judge it for yourself. That's what I did. I think it's a really fun game. Is it worth $60? Hell no. Is it worth like $20 or 30$? Yes yes yes.

reviewText: I recognise the build of this game, the murky graphics, DEMIURGE, the company that brought us Mass Effect 1's hand in this definitely shines through. Their influence can be seen in the graphics presentation of the game, I am sucking it up :-)\n\nALIEN ISOLATION is coming! Being not the biggest fan of FPS (first person shooters-I prefer 3rd person gaming), I endure most FPS for story sake! I have completed here the single player story and thoroughly enjoyed it, IN ANTICIPATION OF COURSE FOR THE UPCOMING IN THE SERIES!! I was not dissappointed, on the reverse side of the coin I think my FPS abilities have breathed and shown their room for improvement. It was also appreciated knowing this game (ALIENS: COLONIAL MARINES) is an official sequel to the known films (fact)! So I absorbed what I could enjoying as much detail as I could, and also playing it through THAT looking glass! Again I played many (not all) hours of this game on my wall through a projector, THE DETAIL is out of this world!!! Try it, I am so blessed with that!  I can't say it enough! There definitely have been many published comments about the quality of this game (even a lawsuit between Gearbox & Sega), but, I am so excited with the upcoming game I was satsified enough to let it wet my appetite for more. Even thinking of replaying my AVP through! Another game that reminded me of this genre or series (Aliens) was ALIEN RAGE, a lot like this game, a worthy quench for more of this sort of thing indeed! Ok, ok, this review is slanted on the single player mode (for which I personally endure FPS-mode-games), there is also a multiplayer mode with DLC and maps for that. If that's your thing you'LL find it in this game too! PEOPLE GET READY!!  :-)

reviewText:
So...aliens Colonial marines...due to the reviews and release horrors i put off on playing this game and rightfully so at the time.

Now that 99% if not 100% of the patches have been deployed i decided to pick the game up and give it an honest chance. Now mind you my review is based off of going in expecting the ABSOLUTE worst (as all other reviews portrayed the game AS)

i was...pleasently surprised...
(angry mob before you hunt me down hear me out)

Okay so this game is by no means what the hype led us to believe and from that point the game failed horrible however going in expecting the worse and keeping those reviews out of your head while playing, even you would be surprised. Ill just make my case in the pros and cons, and then finish in the wrap up

Pros:
-design : All areas are very nostalgic and are wonderful recreations of the movie itself. the lighting (albeit nowhere near as awesome as the tech demo/reveal) is well placed and still presents an eerie feeling, especially in the sewers.

-gun feel: the guns feel innacurate at times however you will quickly adjust and feel like a Bad @$$ gunning down the new and improved xenos with a smart gun, shotgun, or even the iconic pulse rifle. (ai has been sorta kinda fixed and the damage they do is...significant. a single xeno can get behind you and eff your armor and health up rather quickly and then jump away making it hard to deal with)

-Voice Acting: the random banter in the audio logs can be funny, even the random bits with the marines are well voiced and provide some fairly decent...i wanna say immersion but...im gonna go with provides a decent experience and conveys each situation fairly well.

-enemy design: The Xeno's are all very well designed including the new species. they look creepy as can be, even intimidating at times. The Raven mission has some of the BEST scares in the game and truly felt like what the entire game should have been. (aside from the bug during the boss fight when you reload the checkpoint)

Thats all i can think of for the pros at the moment, onto the cons!

Cons:

-Over hyped: The trailers and playable demos at the press events/ conventions got us way over hyped and every single company behind it should be held responsible. blame does not lay soley upon one party in this situation. the devs shouldnt have released it in a broken state, they shouldnt have taken the tech demo/presentation out of the game, and of course the publishers should have used a Quality Assurance team to test the freakin game BEFORE it was released. there was no reason it should have been let out the doors in that state.

-AI: both the marine, WaYu troops, and even the xenos  at times(although they seem to have been improved from launch) all have very horrible ai. at launch the xenos were a joke, thank god they fixed it (as far as i can tell, i see less of them standing around and more actually getting in my face tearing me a new one on Ultimate Badass (only difficulty woth playing) As for the Friendly Marine AI...ha...yeah just go in expecting to do everything one man army style.

-Characters: a few characters shouldnt have been introduced the way they were, we should have been able to build up a relationship before we knew they were doomed and a specific character shouldnt have even been in the freakin game, they died in the movie.

-gun feel?: as i said you will quickly adjust to the way the guns operate however only a few of the weapons are truly worth using at all. the pulse rifle is fantastic, both shotguns are great. smg, br, and even the ar are all rubbish so forget them. Also a personal gripe for me, i wanted to use the smart gun more often, the game wasnt complete easy mode with it (especially on UB difficulty) so i feel we should have been able to use it a little more often. some sections felt like it needed it more than others.

-final boss: tense but at the same time a joke...its too easy once you figure out how to trick the ai (gee another ai problem, imagine that)


Anyway, onto the wrap up!

Aliens colonial marines is a good buy, especially at $15, however to truly enjoy the game, you need the stasis interrupted and the bug-hunt dlc's Those truly improve the game HOWEVER you should ONLY buy them on SALE!

This game is hated on far too much, i have played way worse shooters in my life and the only reason people hate on this game so much is they gave into the hype, the company basically lied about what was in the game, and at release the entire game was a total joke. HOWEVER that has for the most part been fixed, atleast in my experience.

People will be surprised if they approach this game while ignoring the hype. as i stated before, i came in expecting the absolute worst but...the game really isnt. its by no means the best game ever, it does not truly do the franchise justice, but it is a decent enough addition to any alien fans libray.

This is an average game, a 5/10 on AJ's score system.

It is worth a buy ON SALE ONLY, do not pick this game up at full price, the multiplayer is very dead now, so i cannot include that in my review.

reviewText: Personally, I think this game is made worse by its critics than it really is. Sure it was garbage upon release but there have been major patches and the quality is acceptable if you buy it on sale. Besides that, Aliens (the 2nd movie) was obviously a spin-off of the first movie and is therefore much more action oriented. If you want some survival horror, go check out (the awesome) Alien Isolation. But that does not mean, that you can't enjoy the 6-7 hours of campaign in Aliens Colonial Marines. I understand that early buyers are frustrated, but buying it now on sale is absolutely worth it.\n\nI recommend it on sale.

reviewText:
They said this game would look best on the WiiU. I am guessing what they were trying to say is that the way the game looks on the WiiU is as best as it's going to get. They KNEW it was bad.

Before you decide to buy this game, I would advise you to take a careful look at the screenshots of this game on Steam or elsewhere. Looks good, right? Crisp, sharp, good lightening, decent textures. Well, that's not how the game looks. Either that, or they really did some good work on making the best possible screenshots to deceive the public.

The fire looks terrible and so does the smoke, the explosions and the water. The textures up close date back to 2004 at least. The broken glass windows break into several small pieces when shot and disappear in mid air. The dead aliens disappear too in their puddle of blood within 4 seconds. It also says the game uses PhysX but I don't see it. I found out that the game is supposed to be using next gen lightening, but I didn't see it either. Actually, I know that cannot be true since this game uses DX9 and the 2010 AVP used DX11. Talk about taking a step back. You can't see your legs but at least you cast a show [with legs].......Courtesy of the Unreal Engine 3 that frankly won't die and that is being kept on life support at this point.

There's no friendly fire, so when one of your buddies get surrounded by the xenos, then just spray left and right until the last xeno dies. There is no carefulness nor any meticulous shooting involved at all. The ammo is mostly plentiful but fear not! The melee button is there to save the day but more on that later.

Paradoxically speaking the 2010 AVP's graphics excel these my a huge margin. I understand it's the different developer but damn! Regardless, both of these games are a far cry from AVP 2 which is still the best game in the series" and possibly one of the best games ever made (retro-wise
