reviewText:
This game gets a lot of bad press, but it really isn't as bad as people make out. It can be a lot of fun in co-op campaign and the multiplayer is pretty good too with some interesting game modes and cool mechanics for the aliens to use.

The story of the campaign is a little underwhelming, although the Stasis Interrupted DLC has a decent story and also helps to explain how Hicks got back to LV426. The main campaign all comes down to a final boss battle which is pretty awful and could really do with some modifications, but it's not the worst thing in the world.

My least favourite thing about this game is the boss battle" half-way through the campaign. You have to try and defeat this "Raven" with a powerloader and the mechanics to do so are completely broken. It takes a good few tries to pass this short section and it can get incredibly frustrating even on easy difficulties - it's the closest I've ever been in a game to breaking my controller.

I've played through the game's campaign and multiplayer matches on PC and Xbox 360 and in my opinion the PC version is a lot better than the console release. This is most likely down to the big patch that released after the game's negative reception. The patch mainly worked on fixing graphical stuff
date: but I think it did do some tweaks to AI as well.\n\nThe best thing about this game is a new mod (hence my updated review) by the name of "TemplarGFX's ACM Overhaul". A modder took it upon himself to spend months working through the config files of the game to rebalance weapons
recommended: improve LOD settings and fix up the AI and textures. Playing with this mod enabled
hoursPlayed: even in the early stages of its development
voteText: is a massive improvement to the core game mechanics as well as the graphical side of things. Xenomorphs are actually smart
helpfulPercent: using the walls and sneaking around instead of just leaping at you to attack. The W-Y soldiers are now easier to kill and are all independent meaning that as soon as one spots you
votesHelpful: they don't all spot you. This makes gameplay much more fluid and can allow for you to actually approach sections with stealth making for some interesting alternative survival options. I'm very excited to see what else this mod will do (it's still in early access at the moment) and major thanks to the developer for improving the game significantly!\n\nTL;DR ... The game is good enough for co-op and can be a fun experience
votesTotal: but the best way to play is on PC with the new "TemplarGFX" mod which improves AI
votesFunny: textures and more. I'd still wait for a sale though."

reviewText:
*sigh* such potential thrown away

The games not as bad as people make out i have played far worse, some just like to whine about everything for no reason - dunno perhaps it makes them feel better about their own pathetic lives

but it's not as good as it was hyped to be either, not by a long shot - it was clearly rushed out (ironic being it was what? 3 years late?)
it goes from being really quite polished graphicaly to stunningly hideous in the blink of an eye - blood effects are rubbish, very cartoonish (think Borderlands blood splatters)

Single player - Decent enough story and once i got use to the GFX jumping from good to bad and the lense flare blinding me alot of the time (think thats my GFX card more than the game though) i did enjoy it
the main let down for the single player is the AI stupidity - AI team mates would stand and watch while you get set upon by multiple enemies (their guns also dont seem to do any meaningful damage)
the AI knows you are the player and so focuses almost entirely on you
the aliens walking past and ignoring your squad mates to get to you while you are trying to access a panel/console/door became annoying (stops the action when you are hit)
aliens actually sneaking up on you hitting you then for some reason running away only to stop, turn and attempt to sneak up on you again....while you are looking and shooting at them?

MultiPlayer VS - there isn't one, not really - the steam community keeps it alive sort of but joining games is a case of hunting through the community looking for a player ingame" then joining his/her game directly (with no idea what game mode they are actually playing)
the few MP games i have been in are very mediocre (almost CoDish) pretty bad hit location and a  team of half decent marine players will dominate making it frustrating for the other team (aliens take a bit of getting used to)

Multiplayer CO-OP - This is where the game really shines for me and all the problems dont seem so bad
date: be it Bug hunt or the Campaign
recommended:
CooP is good fun

I paid £15 total for the game + season pass and dont grudge paying that for it (glad i cancelled my preorder though)
if you can pick it up for £10 including the season pass it would be worth it - at the time of this review my local Game store are selling the disk for £3 (well worth that!)

6/10 from me - if they came back and polished the GFX and AI i would go up to 7 and if they sorted out the player search for MP possibly even an 8"

reviewText:
I don't want to waste too much time on this crappy game so I'll just give you a few pros and cons:

+ Decent voice acting and sounds
+ Atmosphere (most of the times)
+ Somewhat lengthy (but not enjoyable)

+- Mediocre graphics (I expected DNF graphics after reading so many (user) reviews, so I was a bit surprised when I started playing myself. While they're not THAT bad, they're not sharp or pretty either but get the job done)

- Terrible gameplay (it's a generic shooter all the way), shooting feels unsatisfying
- Glitches, clipping issues, uneven checkpoints, terrible AI, difficulty spikes (i.e. unpolished)
- Repetitive environments (I had a few sections that were exact duplicates of some of the earlier sections. If it wasn't for the objectives I probably would've quit the game and level select my way to the correct one. Confusing ♥♥♥♥.).
- It tries to be scary, but there are so many aliens and soldiers walking around that it simply isn't any scary... Wasted potential.

All I can say is; strike two Gearbox... Strike two...

[Rating: 55/100]

reviewText:
Not sure why my hours were reset from the hundreds or so I had to 11. weird.   Suffice it to say, I played this a LOT.


So after all the Hype, class action lawsuits, and patches that were larger than the size of the original game... We are left with what is actually (Finally perhaps?) a VERY decent game.   Quite fun in the end.  Too bad it took so long to get there. :(     Pick it up on sale for a GREAT deal.

Pros:
-lots of game to play through. Plenty of missions for your enjoyment.  Later add-ons even add non-combat sneaking missions
-graphics look good.
-controls are tight.  Took a couple patches but they rock since late 2014.
-Co-op is awesome. full stop.
-can be had for $2-3us.  AWESOME deal.
-still some online players for matches and co-op even in 2016! community is small but active.
-missions are generally fun. a couple are overkill or difficult on harder settings.

Cons:
-early weapons are weak. Need to be careful until you have more stopping power.
-bugs are tough. takes a little practise to clean house properly. early on especially.
-people whine too GD much about the original problem where the game WAS released broken as hell, however it WAS patched, and the is fun.  Too bad it took 6+ months.
-bug! bug! bug!

reviewText:
Everyone has already said everything about this stinker so I will keep it short.

This game is a insult to gamers and to fans of the aliens movies.

The visuals are dated. The AI is borderline retared. The game is riddled with bugs.

Stay away from it....!

reviewText:
The latest game in a long line of Gearbox titles it's cool to hate, for some reason.

Last year it was Duke Nukem Forever, even though nobody in their right mind had any excuse to expect that game to be good after a 15 year development window; played it with a friend and had a drunken blast. (I still contend that most of the negative reviews were pre-written before release.) Now everyone is butthurt over ACM, going so far as filing lawsuits for false advertising. There are Aliens. There are Colonial Marines. You got what you were promised in the title. Stop whining. It wasn't overhyped, except by gamers themselves. Does the story break the canon? Absolutely. So what? It's FICTION. Not like Gearbox denied the Holocaust or something. You know what else broke the canon of its predecessor? THE MOVIE ALIENS. Stop acting so entitled and get over it.

Not a bad game by any means, just mediocre, which wasn't a crime last time I checked. It has bugs (not just of the Xeno variety) but so do all games. It also has a long compaign, tons of action, and a full multiplayer suite. All completely wasted because gamers couldn't bother to be objective.

Final score: 10/10

(more like 7 out of 10 but I'm teaching you a lesson in not giving so much credence to arbitrary numbers)

reviewText: I got into all of the hype for this game and then all of the negative reviews after launch for its state of completion and polish, or lack of. But it's 2016 and I decided to give it a chance and I must say, it's really not that bad. Im sure they patched the crap out of it since launch but I don't care, the first act is FANTASTIC, the second act is ok, and the end if a little lack luster. This was a solid game with a better story than most FPS.\n\nThe enemy AI is a little weak, that and some of the voice acting are my only complaints… but if those things kill a game for you then you can NEVER enjoy most games that get made now days. I know its popular to blast the game for its launch conditions but honestly this game is fine now and worth a buy at current normal price.

reviewText:
Aliens.......1986
Review of Aliens: Colonial Marines for PC.
Some games you either love or hate. Aliens: Colonial Marines is that kind of game.
Made by Gearbox Software Corporation
Released in 2013 (EU: February 2013)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spoilers ahead.

Aliens: Colonial Marines is a direct sequel to James Cameron film Aliens (1986) and takes you back to LV-426 where the Colonial Marines in Aliens were sent. You take the roll of a Marine, Corporal Christopher Winter, and you will discover what happened on the marine ship USS Sulaco and on the surface of LV-426.

LV-426, 'fool moon of Acheron', the planetoid of Alien (1979) where the crew of the USS Nostromo discovered the remnants of a derelict spaceship and a fossilized crewpilot called the 'Space Jockey'. You will discover that 'The Company' ('Wey-Yu' or 'Weyland Yutani'), already mentioned in the film 'Alien' (1979), play a big role in the game.

The game received a lot of bad reviews. Mainly because of its story, dated graphics and bugs and glitches. Many bad reviews were based on the view that the game didn't create 'the feeling' of being in the Alien Universe. This review will focus on four different parts: story and gameplay, graphics, sound and replayability. The conclusion will give a short summary.

(tip: before you play this game, you should have seen the Alien films and/or played other Alien related games)

Story
The story of Aliens: Colonial Marines takes place after the film Aliens (1986) and before Alien 3 (1992). You are Winter, a Colonial Marine. ‘OOORAH!’ You receive orders from Captain Cruz: find out what happened on the USS Sulaco. A few weeks ago, contact with the Marines on LV-426 was lost. They were sent on the USS Sulaco. Together with a female, Leutenant Ripley, they were sent to investigate the colony 'Hadleys Hope' on LV-426. Build by Weyland-Yutani/Wey-Yu. Things go terribly wrong.

The game starts with a message from Corporal Hicks, a Colonial Marine who survived the Alien attack on LV-426. Only a female called Ripley, a kid named 'Newt' and a synthetic named 'Bishop' survived. The rest of the Marines are K.I.A. Together with a private called 'O-Neal', you discover that the Company/Wey-Yu has its ties in many sectors.

In the game you make use of many iconic weapons: Pulse Rifle, Smartgun etc. All from the Alien franchise. The game is a FPS ('First Person Shooter') in the Alien Universe. Due to its connection with the Alien franchise, you recognize many locations (and some characters) from the film Aliens. In the game private Peter O-Neal and (later) private Bella work with you together.

The singleplayer campaign is about six to eight hours long: it depends on the difficulty. Unlike most other FPS titles, you can play with up to four players in singleplayer. This is a cool feature. Both singleplayer and multiplayer can be played with friends. In the campaign, you can unlock challenges to unlock cool skins and other features for your (online) characters.

Artifical Intelligence
The A.I. of the game is not that good. Enemies will sometimes stop in front of you or dont move at all. Your company Marines will not always fire on enemy targets. The best thing you can do is fully concentrate on your own character: dont depend on the firepower from your team. Enemies will rush and try to flank you. The complain that the enemy A.I. is 'bad' is just a lie: the difficulty of the game is responsible for the enemy A.I. Try the game on the highest difficulty setting (UB) and you will be surprised. The story of the game is good, its canon and fits into the Alien Universe. You can play the downloadable content to understand the whole story.

Multiplayer
If you play multiplayer, you can play a lot of modes. This gives it a high level of (re)playability. The unique feature is to play as the Alien creatures. Rare aliens like the 'Boiler' and the 'Crusher' can be 'unlocked' to play on the different maps. In the different multiplayer modes, you can try and unlock different skins for your alien and for your marine character.

In-game bugs and screen tearing in singleplayer and multiplayer.
Yes, this is present in the game. Many reviews complained about the bugs and the screen tearing. Its a minus, but not a very big one.

Graphics
Many reviewers said the graphics are 'crap' or at least 'very bad'. Indeed, they are not as good as 'Crysis 3' or other high-end PC games. Compared to 'AVP' from 2010, they are different, perhaps not as good on maximum, but 'good enough', 'unique' in my opinion.

But why play 'Aliens' games to enjoy high end graphics? Its a game (and a movie) about a dark setting, with a focus on atmosphere and raw action. Not all gamers are born in 2013: they didnt know about high end graphics on their SNES but enjoyed and loved games how they are.

Remember 'Aliens' came out in 1986. This is the second film, not the first one. This game represents that 1986 setting. When you come across LV-426 and the Derelict Spacecraft, you see the graphics are not that bad. They are just different with a unique touch. Its raining on LV-426 all the day and you see the water on your screen, the light effects are very nicely done in this game. You look up into the sky on LV-426 and you see vulcanic activity and smoke.

The character models look not that good, but good enough. Better then average. Yes, you can go right through them, but is that 'crap'? The only thing that is a minus are the facial expressions: they are 'robotic' with no emotions at all.

The Xenomorphs look good. They crawl and jump right toward your screen and bleed green acid. They have a 'better then average' level of detail. The enviroments look very good, from Hadleys Hope to the dark basement of the colony. Weapons look graphically 'good enough' and represent the different weapons in the movie franchise.

Sound
The sound of this game is very good: its straight from the films. The sound of a firing Pulse Rifle, Smartgun, or Pump Shotgun represent the sound of the weapons in the movie franchise. The sound of the characters is good. The voice of Lance Henriksen is present in the game and other actors from the film 'Aliens' were responsible for the in-game voice sounds.

The sound in environments is good. It gives you a sense of a dark place far from the earth. Desolated and abandoned. The sound in the colony is realistic: it gives the game a ‘dark feeling’. The Alien creatures scream just like in the movie.

Replayability
Replayability of the game is high because of the many offline and online options. You can customize your weapons, create your own marine and create your online Alien creature. The game has many online modes to offer: TD, Escape, Survival, etc. Other downloadable content is available.

Conclusion
Aliens: Colonial Marines is a game that is loyal to the Alien franchise. A FPS title, related to the film 'Aliens' from 1986 with 'action-horror' elements. Due to the multiplayer online feature, the chance to play the Alien creatures and the co-op feature in singleplayer, this game is fresh and innovative. Its just different then the most FPS titles like Call of Duty or Battlefield. If you are a FPS player with no interest in the Alien franchise, this game is 'average' to 'good' (6/10 or 7/10). If you like the Alien franchise, or played a lot of 'Alien related games', you know this game is not a bad game. If you are a big fan, just like me, you will love this game.

If you haven't seen the Alien movies, go watch them first.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The good
* Sound;
* Atmosphere;
* Co - op. Campaign can be played with friends.
* Multiplayer modes.
* Canon story.

The bad
* A.I. is not always consistent;
* Some screen tearing and in-game bugs.

VERDICT: 7 out of 10

reviewText:
5 out of 5 for all the right reasons.

I have never reviewed a game before, but I'm going out of my way for this one because it deserves to be defended.

The game is not mind blowingly spectacular. It's not a high end, maximum graphic type game.
HOWEVER, what the game does have is gameplay that keeps you highly entertained and that's what I paid for.

The COOP is perfect, arming 4 Marines in a war against Aliens and mercenaries. The weapons upgrade system is minimal but leaves you feeling satisfied when add new attachments and skins to your guns.

The A.I. isnt terrible and on the Ultimate Badass it's quite fun with 4 people waging war against the Aliens.

I do not have the DLC's however I am told they only make the game better than it already it is.

Long story short, people give this game a bad rap because they are expecting a major title type game. That just isnt the case here, but rest assured, it's a fantastic game and I'd pay for it again if I had a do-over. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a highly addictive and action packed COOP game.

reviewText:
The game is not perfect, it's got some pretty weird bugs (and funny ones) and the A.I. is like a 3 year old.

Graphics are fairly nice, but you can tell they simplified it so people on consoles could play it.

But... what makes up for it is the 4 player Campaign co-op, the variety of weapons, weapon customization, and the multiplayer online game modes which are Team Deathmatch, Extermination(5v5 destroy objectives), Escape (4v4 Marines fight from point A while xenomorph players try to kill you to point B), and Survivor (4v4 defend against xeno players)

The game also has a static weaponry, so if you've beaten the game, or unlocked fancy things in multiplayer, you can use those weapons in the campaign.

I believe the games worth $30, not $50

So unless you really want to play the game, I would wait until it goes on sale in the future.

reviewText: My verdict, it's a surprisingly good game. Gameplay-wise it was surprisingly fun, the mechanics are a little unpolished and the graphics might not be the best, but it's still a very fun game. Personally, the only real issue with the game is what it could of been. The addition of the motion sensor gives the game a very horror feel that it just doesn't really have. The parts where you have to fight against human enemies seem to really turn it into just another shooter. As just an FPS compared to today's FPS's it really falls flat on it's feet. But, if you take into effect the attempt at adding in horror it makes it a somewhat enjoyable experience. Personally, I feel that they should have pushed the horror all the way through. Where instead of having to deal with multiple aliens that die relatively easily I should deal with less aliens that die much harder and have better AI. Instead of running towards me like a demented alien clown trying to hug me to death they should hide like the first encounter, only coming out of the shadows to swipe at you or jumping at you and melting back into the shadows. Then, as a you play you have to constantly, have your motion detector out as you tensely look for aliens. The way it is now is simply depressing. But, despite all of that it's still a pretty enjoyable game and work the 5 bucks that I spend on it.\n\ntldr: Buy aliens:colonial marines, at 5 bucks its still a pretty fun fps and worth the money.

reviewText: Been playing Aliens FPS games since the 90s right.  Remember that PC Doom 2 mod?  Alien TC (Stood for Total Conversion as they called mods that virtually replaced all game content with something new)  I believe this was the first 'Aliens' style FPS experience back in the 90s, then the Atari Jaguar had a good Aliens Vs. Predator game, but it was kind of hokey and not so atmospheric as the previous mentioned.  Buncha sprites bouncin around and weird view angles.  Basically what I'm trying to say is since I was 12 I've been enraptured by the idea of meshing the FPS experience with the Aliens universe.  I've played em all, and lots of multiplayer for each.  Sure this game had a few bugs, but the reviews it got were simply unjust and mostly from players that never really gave it a chance.  This is actually a hidden gem and the most complete and modern, well designed Aliens first person shooter experience you're gonna get. Playing the Coop with a friend, we actually felt like marines, one guy with a smart gun, one guy holding the motion detector, sharing quietly what the radar blips are saying.  All in the dark recesses of ships trying not to wake the bugs, or facehuggers.  Which you better shoot off your friends face quickly when it laches.  Anyhow it just works.  It was a solid game, the Aliens are terrifying for once as well.  Never had any horrible game bugs ruin my experience as they say.  The film grain issue was indeed bs though.  But its a beautiful game, ran well on my older PC even.

reviewText: Despite the game’s best intentions to immerse you in the Aliens universe, the result is a bloody massacre. Relying on dated storytelling techniques and technology, and stretching way too far to provide a plausible link between the second and third films, Aliens: Colonial Marines isn’t able to connect its action to any real sense of drama or terror, completely missing the aspect of psychological horror that gave the film its edge. However, the game still holds form as an alright FPS.

reviewText:
Never bought this game until I saw it for ~£2-3 a few weeks ago as i knew it was supposed to have gotten the worst reviews ever.

However i'm probably half way through the game just now and I honestly dont know where all the harsh negativity comes from, yes the aliens dont have the best ai ever and the story is a little drole (the locations are nice though) but that aside its a competant shooter.

The sound is perfect, from the blasts of the pulse rifles to the groans of dilapidated doors trying to open, the graphics are not bad for 360/ps3 era gen and are very much the same as alien vs predator (sega not rebellion) although the gun models are much better here.

All in all its not perfect but really does not deserve all the negativity... oh and being negative about a game because it has dlc is lame, its a thing and its here to stay, it dosnt mean you have to buy it to enjoy the game, most dlc i know of is mostly useless anyway and dosnt add much to the game, its just a crass money making scheme, either buy it or ignore it... like i mostly do :P

reviewText:
A game that deserves a lot more than it got. I absolutely loved the game and everything about. I pre-ordered the game, the only game I have pre-ordered or even spent more than $20 on steam and it was absolutely worth it! If you enjoy the Alien franchise and fun first person shooters this is the game for you.

True the game is flawed and not perfect, and the multiplayer match finder is incredibly bad. However there is no greater thrill being one of four colonial marines with your friends in an abandoned starship watching your motion sensor beep at the oncoming aliens. Setting up sentry turrents, running out of ammo, losing squadmates along the way, welding doors. It's all a blast!

My particularily favorite game modes are Escape, Survival and Bug Hunt. However due to the smaller player base now and the terrible match finder the first two game modes mentioned (escape survival) are almost impossible to set up.

I do believe this game was rushed and I also do believe it could have been significantly better; however when I look at my steam library there are far and few games that jump out and scream play me on LAN night. Aliens Colonial Marines is an exceptional gem in the Aliens Universe and perfect for any avid fan.

reviewText:
I bought this game with my expectations very low as I was aware of the quality of this game before I purchased it. With that said, this game wasn't as bad as reviews would make you originally think, but it is definitely medicore - no doubt about it.

Positives:
-Sound effects are great, such as the pulse rifle.
-Lighting effects and positions in the levels can create a moody atmosphere.
-Alien models look good.
-Movie locations recreated in-game look faithful.
-Characters are okay, not great... but okay. Bella is annoying though. Gearbox tried to make O'Neal the player's companion but unfortunately they didn't give him enough dialogue to make him memorable.
-Legendary weapons are a cool idea, and the game does have a few collectibles if that is your thing.
-Some of the levels are fun and unique, such as the sewer level.

Negatives:
-The player fights more human enemies than aliens, which is stupid as hell.
-AI is terrible! Aliens will take forever to react to you and even then they just mindlessly charge towards you without even taking alternate routes (such as walls or roofs). Sometimes aliens will just stand still while you blow their acidic brains out.
-The gunplay is so boringly mediocore in this game, you literally just spray your weapons at enemies hiding behind cover hoping some of your bullets randomly hit.
-Game is way too easy even on the hardest difficulty.
-Level design is way too linear, you pretty much run at a straight line hip firing towards cardboard humans with no intelligence and repeat every level.
-Fighting the big alien with the exosuit is a terrible experience. The aliens will run under your exosuit which causes the player to spin around at random that will kill you, over... and over... and over again.
-Last boss fight is incredibly easy and is a bit of a joke.
-Voice acting for the aliens character is laughable.
-So many plot holes.
-Team mates are completely useless, they shoot peas instead of bullets. They don't help at all.

Overall, this game is incredibly mediocore. I would avoid playing this game unless you're a huge alien fan. Pretty much every other game featuring an xenomorph is better than this. I recommend Aliens vs Predator 1 and 2, Alien Trilogy, Aliens vs Predator Extinction and Alien Isolation. The gameplay is boring, the characters are boring for the most part and the story has more holes than O'Neal's brain.

4/10

reviewText: I am a fan of the Aliens series and found this game as-is is not a bad game at all.  However, the story is severely lacking in development.  The AI is meh to say the least, and the Reward Systems leave MUCH to be desired.  It really would have been nice if the publisher had updated the Rewards system upon releasing additional content for the game.  The reason being, it would make tracking progress much easier.  The DLC Bug Hunt and Stasis Interupted pretty much MAKE this game.  As much as I would enjoy seeing more content for this game, I'm afraid that is unlikely at this point.\n\nMy suggestion would be to wait for a Steam Sale to purchase this game and any of the DLC.

reviewText:
Honestly I don't think this game deserves half the hate it gets. It's no masterpiece, but it has it's merits. Some of the levels are just fun, particularly 'The Raven' which had a good pacing for the suspence and was entirely focused on xenomorphs instead of the wey-yu. Gameplay is about what you'd expect out of a shooter, though I wouldn't be putting to much stock into your AI companions, to put it frankly they can't shoot worth a damn and when they do manage to hit something it's probably not the target you're wanting them to hit.

The story is meh. Honestly they could have gone in other directions with it, and seeing as the DLC page spoils it for you anyhow  the fact that it's Hicks and not one of the other marines that may have not actually died on the planet makes me roll my eyes. That being said if you are looking for some mindless xeno blasting then the game will certainly feed that need. I'd recomend playing with friends at hardened or ultimate badass otherwise the enemy AI is only marginally better then your companions.

I'll be honest I've not tried to much of the online component, but there aren't to many people playing so you're not likely to find a team unless you have friends.

reviewText:
A game that deserves a lot more than it got. I absolutely loved the game and everything about. I pre-ordered the game, the only game I have pre-ordered or even spent more than $20 on steam and it was absolutely worth it! If you enjoy the Alien franchise and fun first person shooters this is the game for you.

True the game is flawed and not perfect, and the multiplayer match finder is incredibly bad. However there is no greater thrill being one of four colonial marines with your friends in an abandoned starship watching your motion sensor beep at the oncoming aliens. Setting up sentry turrents, running out of ammo, losing squadmates along the way, welding doors. It's all a blast!

My particularily favorite game modes are Escape, Survival and Bug Hunt. However due to the smaller player base now and the terrible match finder the first two game modes mentioned (escape survival) are almost impossible to set up.

I do believe this game was rushed and I also do believe it could have been significantly better; however when I look at my steam library there are far and few games that jump out and scream play me on LAN night. Aliens Colonial Marines is an exceptional gem in the Aliens Universe and perfect for any avid fan.

reviewText:
To be fair, I am a RABID Aliens fan. My review will be slanted from the start. I collect books, movies, replicas and movie props from this film - though I love the whole series/universe, Aliens is by far the superior film. Is it a FANTASTIC game ? No, it isn't. Is it even a good game ? Not terribly. It isn't however; a awful as most of the reviews say.

You are a USCM Marine, you get to use every single iconic weapon in the movie. Though a MAJOR complaint for me was the HORRIBLE INACCURACY of nearly every weapon except the pump shotgun, the Service 9mm and of course the M56 Smartgun. (Hard to miss with IR tracking) The graphics are above average especially since the upgrade patch, and the game IS very atmospheric. Hadley's Hope and The Sulaco are recognizible right down to the name plates on the lockers. Lighting is low and creepy, never knowing where a xeno may pop up.

Bringing me to the story, THIS is why people I think are so upset. Many of the games flaws would have been forgiven... (Poor AI, Unfinished textures and serious issues with the NPC's) It feels thin, unimaginative and the ending is extremely ABRUPT and unsatisfying ! Many will be... WTF just happened ? Hick's inclusion while welcome to me I loved the character, but how they did it is just plain RIDICULOUS. They should have collaborated with Jim Cameron since this is considered cannon to the movies.

The Stasis Interrupted" DLC is a HUGE improvement over the original game
date: absolutely terrifyingly atmospheric in places - I greatly appreciated that offering. All-in-all I consider Aliens: Colonial Marines absolutely crucial to my collection
recommended: however; with the source material available this game could have been a LANDMARK in gaming.\n\nOverall The game was rushed
hoursPlayed: and mundane FPS shooter with wonderful graphics but a thin
voteText: non-existent story. The ending is abrupt and left wide-open to a sequel which I'm sure was the intention. The Marines look great
helpfulPercent:
the iconic weapons are there... (Even if the you can't hit the broadside of a barn with the pulse rifle) The levels are dark and highly detailed with familiar places and feel to the movies. It's empty though put out to make a buck.

If you are a Die-Hard like me ? The game is a must-have for your collection. BUY-IT !

If you're looking for a state of the art FPS with top-notch mechanics and story not caring about the Aliens movie or franchise? Let this title float right under your motion-tracker...

It's not as terrible as most of the reviews say it is...
"

reviewText:
Can´t undersstand all the hating....

I bought this game with season pass and in short: Its great!!!

The details:

Grafics: Unreal Engine. Enviroment is nice, Charaters a bit ugly but fully ok. I read a review that the ships internals are all look the same: Man
date:
why should a spaceship look different from room to room???"

Sound: Good

Handling: Characters handle well.

Difficulty: "Veteran" could be a bit hard. Starting with "soldier" in a single player campaign is hard enough for most players. If you play Coop Campaign you should raise the difficulty.

Localization: German loc. has some funny points like "waldmannsheil" and the "ooorah" sounds a bit bored but it is ok. A few funny moments if u accept the "marines" style.

Story: Good and fun to play. When i finished one of the ten (i think) chapters i was always willing to play the next. There are dozens of allusions to the movies (mainly Alien2) and lots of the story plays in the moviesetting. !Spoiler!: The appearens of "Hicks" is completly explained if u listen to the text at chapter seven.

MultPlayer: CoopCampaign and a few versus games. In MP you could fully customizes your Marine or Xeno Character. Really nice...

Overall: Great game (by now). A lot of fun to play for Alien Friends and highly replayable if you have friends that play the game with you."

reviewText:
Never bought this game until I saw it for ~£2-3 a few weeks ago as i knew it was supposed to have gotten the worst reviews ever.

However i'm probably half way through the game just now and I honestly dont know where all the harsh negativity comes from, yes the aliens dont have the best ai ever and the story is a little drole (the locations are nice though) but that aside its a competant shooter.

The sound is perfect, from the blasts of the pulse rifles to the groans of dilapidated doors trying to open, the graphics are not bad for 360/ps3 era gen and are very much the same as alien vs predator (sega not rebellion) although the gun models are much better here.

All in all its not perfect but really does not deserve all the negativity... oh and being negative about a game because it has dlc is lame, its a thing and its here to stay, it dosnt mean you have to buy it to enjoy the game, most dlc i know of is mostly useless anyway and dosnt add much to the game, its just a crass money making scheme, either buy it or ignore it... like i mostly do :P

reviewText: Well, i took the plunge and bought this game..more for a laugh really. Turned out much better than i thought. Not perfect though. Baring in mind This is after the big patch and only single player campaign. (plus got it for £2) I thought it was entertaining enough...plenty to keep you occupied. Visiting the old Movie sites like Hadleys hope, Sulaca and many more. Lots of weapons to use and upgrade. The story is so so, not that i really cared. Its all been done before but was playing this as a huge Aliens fan. To me the game DOES make you feel like your in the Aliens universe. Amazing sounds from weapons and aliens. The motion tracker is awesome but just having it on and listening ..you'll think your watching Aliens....although a pain when you have to switch back to gun before being eaten.  All in All i would recommend this game...even for those who arent major Aliens fans the games worth the steam price (even though i didnt pay it) and id go as far as saying better than a lot of other FPS games at the same price.

reviewText:
Rating: 7/10

The day one release of the game was horrifyingly bad. The AI was wonky and the game itself was a mess. However, after the fixes, this game is actually much better. I mean, the enemies still charge at you while others just sit around doing nothing about 30 metres away but it's actually an enjoyable experience if you overlook the rather shallow story and the superficial AI competencies.

If this game is on sale for under 5 dollars and you love blowing Aliens to bits, I strongly recommend this game to you.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: A lot of the complaints I have heard about Aliens: Colonial Marines were justified on release. Since then most of the issues that I am aware of have been patched. The Alien AI is better and very lethal. They like to run on the ceiling when you are destracted by their buddies and drop down behind you. I have died many times to this before I adapted. There are a few remaining issues but those are mainly minor irritants. The AI will still get stuck and get left behind at times, but when you reach the objective or checkpoint they teliport to you and carry on as normal. The price right now is $2.99 (80% off steam sale) and during this time it is more then worth the price.\n\nIf you do decide to pick up the game I highly recommend buying Stasis Interupted. The DLC adds several more missions and gives explanation to what happened aboard the Suloco after it left LV-426 at the end of Aliens.

reviewText:
After read many thumb down review, I .... hmm We decided to give it a try. (Again)

FIrst lunch no problem at all,  The graphic look decent, HD texture and nice shader. Large world, Long play before loading new map. The sound effect is greats, classic from the movie. Team work is required but not much as L4D. Nice first person animation. Weapons to use is quite enough (As a Marine). We quite disapointed at first look on some weapons. Recommended you to find all legendary weapons, You will love the dev a little bit more (Straight from the movie). The AI is smart enough to kill us all 4 of us. (Ultimate Badass Difficulty). They can dodge, jump away, leaping toward you, surpirse you from behind and  more. We encounter no bug at all except friendly NPC stuck near elevator for about 30 second but only once. AI can lose thier limb too. Story line is fun and can be scary. Turret can be deploy in realistic way. And can you control the classic yellow loader robot like ribly does? Find out your self.

This game worth 9 bux for us. 7/10   (still hoping for AVP3)

We think Gearbox might run out of budget or some sort. This game can go even further.
Well, if you like shooting alien with friend, support the dev and play it with your friend now.

reviewText:
Great game (after patching - apparently it's full of bugs before that, and not just the acid-for-blood type).
Really feels like the Aliens movie and has an excellent story that fits into the movie stories perfectly. I found the graphics outstanding, especially in their authenticity of the Aliens locations, armour, weapons, tech, etc. Action is terrific and the creatures' motion and attacks are, again, dead-on for the movie.
Working my way through the DLC now, which is very worthwhile and long compared to the DLC's of other games (I estimate I've played for over 6 hours so far, though I do like to explore everywhere and see everything... and I get killed fairly regularly).

Sad that the original release of a very unpolished version of the game made A:CM a flop. There's obviously a lot of work and love gone into the game, all presumably ruined because some jerk somewhere decided to release the game too early.

reviewText:
Alright, let's be honest...

Put aside all preconceived notions due to the ever-growing hate reviews spurring from its release. This game had a HUGE following during its 7 year production and with tech demos and screenshots slowly spoon-feeding its fans and speculative fans, people grew antsy with anticipated glee. However, when they discovered the game was nothing short of mediocre, they deem it as atrocious trash.

Plain and simple: People overhyped the ♥♥♥♥ out of this game into lower reviews than it deserved. This game is actually a lot of fun to play with others, and is MUCH better than all other Aliens games (besides that one from the 90s. That ♥♥♥♥ rocked).

If you're a huge fan of the franchise, memorized the ♥♥♥♥ out of Aliens as I did where you recall Hudson, Hicks, Gorman, Vasquez, Newt, and all the glorious other characters, you'll have a ball in this game. This game certainly knows to include a ton of easter eggs to enjoy and a lot of familiar sounds to hone in on your nostalgia.

Conclusion: JUST as a video game to play I'd say a 5.5/10 due to major glitches, and bad script writing. But personally, I am, and still am having fun with this. I'd say 7/10 for me.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
The critics hate this game. They have their reasons but personally, I have had a ton of fun with this game and 15 hours in doesn't look like it will be stopping.

The game is canon in the Alien universe, being a direct dequel to James Cameron's Aliens. Some parts of the film where retconned/altered, with the prime example being Hadley's Hope not being destroyed by a nuclear explosion at the end of Aliens. Some hazy explanations are decent enough and you play as Winter, one of the Colonial Marines sent to LV426 to investigate Hick's distress call.

The game is very linear. The campaign is around 8-12 hours long depending on the difficulty and your tendancy to rush through the vistas of the game. Throughout the campaign you will visit locales in Aliens, whilst blasting through numerous Aliens and Wey-Yu mercs whilst following your NPC companions. You'll be shoehorned in from one set piece to another in the vein of COD. Not necessarily a bad thing as it allows the action to flow and story to be conveyed as the writers intended, but it becomes painstakingly obvious half way through the campaign when the lack of variety is noticeable.

The graphics are average. There are beautiful vistas and overall the presentation is neat but the texture work is shoddy. However, being spoilt by the DX11 AvP 2010, the graphics leave a lot to be desired. This is incredibly evident in the multiplayer, where the graphics are scaled back akin to the COD4 days. Why on earth they thought this was necessary is beyond me. The ingame options is extensive enough, with bonus points for an ingame FOV slider! The game runs solidly on 60.

Whilst the graphics are good, the animation and AI is lackluster. The Alien itself is a massive culprit of this, with jerky animations of the AvP2 days. What happened to the smooth sneaky killer of AvP2010?

The multiplayer, whilst shows promise. has some glaring problems which may kill the community for the game. There are no dedicated servers for the game and it uses a COD4 style lobby matchmaking system. I haven't had any problems finding games or issues with lag but it is something to keep in mind. There are 4 game modes and honestly, they are a lot of fun. TDM, Co-op campaign and Survival  are self explanatory. Escape is L4D done with Aliens and is incredibly good fun. Extermination is an objective mode where Marines aim to 'capture' spots on the maps to destroy Alien eggs and Aliens have to stop them. The modes arefun but there is an issue with a lack of maps.

If you have read this far then you'd think this is a painfully average game and you are right. HOWEVER, the use of the license itself is done very well. There are plenty of fanservice with familar locales and references through the whole game for fans. The game, whilst average, somewhat captures the 20 minutes in Aliens where the Colonial Marines was badass and lives off that. The license saves this game from being meh to decent. If you really liked the Alien franchise, this is a no brainer. You'd appreciate it for what it is. If you didn't like the film, you'll find an average sci-fi corridor shooter.

reviewText: I am a fan of the Aliens series and found this game as-is is not a bad game at all.  However, the story is severely lacking in development.  The AI is meh to say the least, and the Reward Systems leave MUCH to be desired.  It really would have been nice if the publisher had updated the Rewards system upon releasing additional content for the game.  The reason being, it would make tracking progress much easier.  The DLC Bug Hunt and Stasis Interupted pretty much MAKE this game.  As much as I would enjoy seeing more content for this game, I'm afraid that is unlikely at this point.\n\nMy suggestion would be to wait for a Steam Sale to purchase this game and any of the DLC.

reviewText:
Honestly I don't think this game deserves half the hate it gets. It's no masterpiece, but it has it's merits. Some of the levels are just fun, particularly 'The Raven' which had a good pacing for the suspence and was entirely focused on xenomorphs instead of the wey-yu. Gameplay is about what you'd expect out of a shooter, though I wouldn't be putting to much stock into your AI companions, to put it frankly they can't shoot worth a damn and when they do manage to hit something it's probably not the target you're wanting them to hit.

The story is meh. Honestly they could have gone in other directions with it, and seeing as the DLC page spoils it for you anyhow  the fact that it's Hicks and not one of the other marines that may have not actually died on the planet makes me roll my eyes. That being said if you are looking for some mindless xeno blasting then the game will certainly feed that need. I'd recomend playing with friends at hardened or ultimate badass otherwise the enemy AI is only marginally better then your companions.

I'll be honest I've not tried to much of the online component, but there aren't to many people playing so you're not likely to find a team unless you have friends.

reviewText: Been playing Aliens FPS games since the 90s right.  Remember that PC Doom 2 mod?  Alien TC (Stood for Total Conversion as they called mods that virtually replaced all game content with something new)  I believe this was the first 'Aliens' style FPS experience back in the 90s, then the Atari Jaguar had a good Aliens Vs. Predator game, but it was kind of hokey and not so atmospheric as the previous mentioned.  Buncha sprites bouncin around and weird view angles.  Basically what I'm trying to say is since I was 12 I've been enraptured by the idea of meshing the FPS experience with the Aliens universe.  I've played em all, and lots of multiplayer for each.  Sure this game had a few bugs, but the reviews it got were simply unjust and mostly from players that never really gave it a chance.  This is actually a hidden gem and the most complete and modern, well designed Aliens first person shooter experience you're gonna get. Playing the Coop with a friend, we actually felt like marines, one guy with a smart gun, one guy holding the motion detector, sharing quietly what the radar blips are saying.  All in the dark recesses of ships trying not to wake the bugs, or facehuggers.  Which you better shoot off your friends face quickly when it laches.  Anyhow it just works.  It was a solid game, the Aliens are terrifying for once as well.  Never had any horrible game bugs ruin my experience as they say.  The film grain issue was indeed bs though.  But its a beautiful game, ran well on my older PC even.

reviewText:
Okay you people have obviously seen a few reviews already and have probably been turned away. I'm only saying this once ♥♥♥♥ the reviewers and their biased uneducated ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. This game was made SPECIFICALLY to give you the feel of being in the 1980's sci-fi action film. That's EXACTLY WHAT IT DOES. From the iconic sound of the pulse rifle to the dark enclosed corridors of Hadley's Hope you get it all hell you even get to use the weapons of Hicks, Hudson, and Velasquez to kill as many Xeno's as you wish. If your big on the alien franchise like I am you will enjoy the game for the continuation of the story. The AI is a little clunky and could have used a little more tuning and the facial animations could have been a tad better but that doesn't ruin the fact that a fan of the series gets to experience LV-426 post film.

Final Thoughts:
You will enjoy the game if your a fan of the series and you know exactly what your getting into if you are unfamiliar with it go watch the movies THEN play the game.

Overall 8.5/10
+The Aesthetics were spot on and what to expect from a true to context adaption of Aliens.
+The USCM are still the most badass ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s in the galaxy
+You get a few suprises in the story
+4 player co-op
=Theres a nice veriety of weapons but there could have been more
-Enemy AI's aim is way to spot on and they are a tad dumb
-Facial animations are a pretty sketchy
-There are some minor clipping issues like Aliens walking through the floor on rare occassion mainly during the last fight

reviewText:
Let me start the review by stating this up-front: Aliens: Colonial Marines (A:CM) is not nearly as bad as most of the reviews I've read have indicated.

We'll probably never know for certain why the final game's visuals do not match the now-infamous E3 Demo, and it's absolutely true that the gameplay is derivative (it's Left4Dead in the Aliens universe, but without L4Ds charm), but if you're a fan of either Left4Dead _or_ Aliens, I can recommend this game to you for its frenetic action and occasionally intense atmosphere, for its Aliens fan-service, and for its great fun coop and versus multiplayer.

It's fair to say I enjoyed this game despite its flaws, and it IS flawed, but I can also say I have had -- and continue to have -- a lot more fun with A:CM than I've had with many of the much better received recent games. I've definitely paid more for less with other games.

If you're looking for a good, balanced review, I can recommend Good Game's from Australia's ABC TV (http://www.abc.net.au/tv/goodgame/stories/s3688766.htm) is one of the very few balanced reviews I've seen. They called its flaws, but also recognised the positives in its offering. You can watch or read a transcript of the review via the link above.

My take is this: The game is a good fun FPS in the vein of Left4Dead, and like that game is a lot more fun when played with friends. The visuals are decidedly 2-years-ago in quality, and that's disappointing, but not unforgivable. I have not seen any of the AI bugs mentioned in reviews I've read, which either means I'm blind, incredibly lucky or they've already been patched. The level design is pretty good, and some of the levels are genuinely scary if played on Ultimate Badass (Hope in Hadleys, for example).

Personally, I think anyone who scored A:CM less than a 6 out of 10 is suffering from a really terrible case of Disappoint that he or she just cannot see past -- or else he or she has seen other influential reviews (e.g. Kotaku, RPS) and jumped on that bandwagon to avoid stigma (many of the reviews reek of the latter, if I'm being honest; as an aside, as an older gamer, I see a tribalism" in games commentary today that I don't remember existing pre-Internet...a very bad thing
date:
but that's a subject for another time and a whole other rant).


Subjective Assessment: 6/10"

reviewText:
To be fair, I am a RABID Aliens fan. My review will be slanted from the start. I collect books, movies, replicas and movie props from this film - though I love the whole series/universe, Aliens is by far the superior film. Is it a FANTASTIC game ? No, it isn't. Is it even a good game ? Not terribly. It isn't however; a awful as most of the reviews say.

You are a USCM Marine, you get to use every single iconic weapon in the movie. Though a MAJOR complaint for me was the HORRIBLE INACCURACY of nearly every weapon except the pump shotgun, the Service 9mm and of course the M56 Smartgun. (Hard to miss with IR tracking) The graphics are above average especially since the upgrade patch, and the game IS very atmospheric. Hadley's Hope and The Sulaco are recognizible right down to the name plates on the lockers. Lighting is low and creepy, never knowing where a xeno may pop up.

Bringing me to the story, THIS is why people I think are so upset. Many of the games flaws would have been forgiven... (Poor AI, Unfinished textures and serious issues with the NPC's) It feels thin, unimaginative and the ending is extremely ABRUPT and unsatisfying ! Many will be... WTF just happened ? Hick's inclusion while welcome to me I loved the character, but how they did it is just plain RIDICULOUS. They should have collaborated with Jim Cameron since this is considered cannon to the movies.

The Stasis Interrupted" DLC is a HUGE improvement over the original game
date: absolutely terrifyingly atmospheric in places - I greatly appreciated that offering. All-in-all I consider Aliens: Colonial Marines absolutely crucial to my collection
recommended: however; with the source material available this game could have been a LANDMARK in gaming.\n\nOverall The game was rushed
hoursPlayed: and mundane FPS shooter with wonderful graphics but a thin
voteText: non-existent story. The ending is abrupt and left wide-open to a sequel which I'm sure was the intention. The Marines look great
helpfulPercent:
the iconic weapons are there... (Even if the you can't hit the broadside of a barn with the pulse rifle) The levels are dark and highly detailed with familiar places and feel to the movies. It's empty though put out to make a buck.

If you are a Die-Hard like me ? The game is a must-have for your collection. BUY-IT !

If you're looking for a state of the art FPS with top-notch mechanics and story not caring about the Aliens movie or franchise? Let this title float right under your motion-tracker...

It's not as terrible as most of the reviews say it is...
"

reviewText: If you like the Alien franchise this one should fit right in.  While it's got a lot of problems it's also fun.  Killing Aliens with the pulse rifle never gets boring.  Familiar voices from Hicks and Bishop come back in this sequel to Aliens 3.. at least that's the time line they give us.  Tackling the main game and its DLC will take about 11  hours to beat. Nothing really game breaking, but it does suck up ammo.  Fun game.  Grab it on sale though.

reviewText: Ok so there are alot of people out there wondering if this game is really as bad as people say it is and im here to tell you its not. First of all this is not a generic first person shooter and it actualy goes away from many things modern fps' do. Like in the game your health doesnt regenerate, you have a limited amount of ammo, and there is a level up and gun upgrading system which is availble for multiplayer AND singleplayer so you can load out your arsonal with however you like and use it on your journy trough the campaign, not just multiplayer. Alot of people complain about the graphics which seemes to be the deciding factor for many games wether its good or not (for some strange reason). Yes the graphics arn't these state of the art realistic looking ones but does that make the game unplayable, NO! So people should look at this game (and all games in general) not for what it doesnt have but for what it does have. I am a HUGE fan of the alien franchise and Ive always dreamed of blowing the head of a xenomorph off with a shotgun anf i was satisfied with this game and what it had to offer for a fan of the series like me. Sure it gets some parts wrong in the story but that doesnt matter all that matters is that you have fun playing it.

reviewText:
Mediocre at its best. It was definitely hyped up to some next level amazing experience but its really as good as early current gen FPS (ie: legendary, jericho, turok, wolfenstein, games before halo 3 and Bioshock)

Gameplay is basic. Run, shot, open door,  hold X on console, shot, leave room, repeat.
Enemy AI just rushes you, nothing like they showed in that one demo but then again, hardly anything there showed up in the real game.

Story is weak and feels like an afterthought. cutscenes have expressionless characters and bad writing. characters are archtypal (generic white male lead, talkive sidekick, ethnic chick with attitude, etc. etc.) Feels very museumy in that it makes up reasons just to go in area to show that they recreated a room from the movies.

The sound is authentic to the series but few people value sound is more important than the gameplay and story.

If you see it for dirt cheap, have extra time, and are a fan, then try it out (I wouldn't have got if it wasn't $2.00)

reviewText: Now i'm a huge fan of the Alien movies and game like AVP. I bought this game despite hearing all the bad reviews for it, and i have to say I don't understand what everyone is complaining about. The game took a twist off from the movie which left me dumb founded (i won't spoil it for you), but everyone was complaining how the aliens moved, and so on. If you've played an AVP game the aliens pretty much move the same. I never had an issue with the game glitching or so. An to be honest I think people are just complaining at the fact it's an Unreal Engine used, and wasn't made to it's full potential. Which I do have to agree the game could have been made better using that powerful engine, but it's still not a bad game. If you like Alien Movie, and AVP games, and in your face what a twist" moments. I'd recommend this game for you."

reviewText:
TS;DR
Overall, it's not the best, but not the worst. If more people played then people will like it again.

Things that are bad in the game:
No multiplayer (Unless you got friends or set it to offline/friends only manually.) (Also no bots.)
A few glitches here and there that are normally hillarious.
Trying to grind acheivements for accessories (which you will find yourself doing) can be boring.
DLC is pricey for a game in it's current position.

Things that are good in the game:
You get accessories and perks (In multiplayer).
Because the aliens run out infront of you, that really makes the difficulty tweak. (If you are like me, it's current difficulty in recruit would be dark souls edition.)
It should still probably be on sale in the summer/winter sales. (Got mine for 90% off.)

reviewText:
Purchased this game when it first came out and had mix opinions about the game. First off, the Demo looks WAY BETTER then the finished product, but that is being fixed by Fans with their fancy Mod Skills (THANK YOU). The Story did catch my eye and I did enjoy the story, which picks up and kind of explains stuff after Aliens (2). Don't get me wrong, Aliens 3 does explain what happens but this game puts a twist between Aliens and Alien 3.
Game mechanics are ok in my opinion but the developer could have done more to intensify the game. I felt like I was using old school controls instead of the games that we play today but the game does have cool gadgets that kind of spice up the game, making you kind of on your toes.
Multiplayer was AWESOME when it first came out but it has died down quickly and it could not save the entire game. Leveling up your character or alien is fun but with limited matches due to very few people playing it just kills the game and is mostly used for Co-op campaign missions or just singleplayer.
I would recommend this game for those of your who are interested in the Alien Franchise as it sure was fun for me. Just don't get your hopes up thinking you will constantly be playing this game over and over and over again as the replay value is low.

Rate: 5/10

reviewText:
This game isn't the best game in the world; it has flaws, several of them in fact. The AI is pretty laughable; the graphics in game/cutscenes are early last gen. But what makes this game so bad is that the developers Gearbox (they made the Borderlands games, Half Life 1 expansions and Duke Nukem Forever) lied and over hyped the game to ridiculous lengths that the previewed game is nothing like the finished product (See E3 videos), the game much like Duke Nukem Forever (also done by Gearbox...) was in development hell for most of the last decade and became vapourware and a bad internet joke. However the finished product here does have a few redeeming qualities to it, it is enjoyable in co-op with friends, the campaign is pretty OK (nothing spectacular to write about), the multiplayer is great (the Aliens have a good control scheme) and the best part is that there is a Left 4 Dead esque co-op/verses multiplayer campaign that is great but is basic. The DLC is OK and is worth a look at (when the Season Pass is cheap).

Pros:
- Good gameplay (OK shooter).
- Full controller support.
- Good multiplayer and co-op game modes.
- Easy Achievements.

Cons:
- Poor game package overall (since this is an AAA game).
- Graphical not good, considering the E3 trailers on older builds looked better.
- Crap AI.
- Multiplayer scene is almost dead, despite it being a redeeming feature of the game.

5/10

TL:DR: Buy this game in a Steam Sale along with the Season Pass along with a few buddies and play through the Campaign/Multiplayer and have a few laughs.

reviewText: So...... Aliens: Colonial Marines. There were huge expectations for the game (God knows I've been waiting for it since it was first announced back in what... 2001? 2002?) and at release the game did not exactly fulfil them. Word is it was quite awful ( I picked it up a year after release, so I did not experience the terrible), which was a disappointment to me. However, since then quite a few patches were released that apparently fixed most of the problems. Which is good. Of course it is unacceptable to release a broken mess of a game in the first place, but hell, at least they fixed it. Now what are my impressions of the game? All things considered I really enjoyed the time I spent playing A: CM. The campaign lacked the specific 'Oompf' I like to see in games, but otherwise the game is OK. The AI might not be stellar, but it's on par with what we can see in other Alien-universe games. The Xenomorphs are fairly deadly, and the guns are quite satisfying to use.\nAs for the accusations of the certain plotholes... it's not as bad as people make it to be. Sure the explanation COULD be better, but otherwise it works for me.

reviewText:
Not the best first person shooter in terms of development and is a step-down from Aliens vs Predator.
That being said, I remember being in elementary school and seeing this games original release date in my monthly Game Informer...
I'm married now and...not in elementary school anymore.
So it had a long life on the shelf and it wasn't expected to be dusted off any time soon.
So all in all I am glad it got made. It just isn't phenomenal by any means.

Aliens Colonial Marines is a simplistic run and gun first-person shooter.
Enemies include a variety of Aliens and Human Soldiers.
You get a decent selection of weaponry to choose from and customize.

Not much replay value, but fun if you enjoy the Aliens world.
This is a spiritual counterpart to James Cameron's Aliens, not by any means Ridley Scott's Alien.

5.5/10

reviewText:
Enjoyed this game. I bought this game for cheap when it was on offer as I'd heard it had a lot of bad reviews and I wasn't prepared to spend a fortune on it but hey, £3 for a game that's single player, versus and 4 player co-op seemed like a good deal to me and it was. I enjoyed playing it with my mates co-op and within a few days of buying it we completed it but not because it was rubbish, because we played it with an open mind, made our own decisions about it and it was, for us, a good game. It has loads of aliens, of different types to blast into tiny pieces, some cool weapons and of course, the motion tracker from the films (which is very useful) and the graphics are pretty nice too.
The co-op mode is just the single player story mode but with the addition of 3 friends playing along with you and the game was good fun, in parts a little challenging and can even make you jump when the aliens catch you off guard and appear from out of thin air, hiding in walls right in front of your face!
I can only pick fault with one aspect of it from what I've played and that is simply the teleport system. When playing co-op if you wandered too far ahead from your team mates the game teleports them to you. Well, in theory thats what it's supposed to do but we discovered it would teleport you at random times! Sometimes if you were only a few feet from your team mates and there was no reason to, quite often it would do this whilst in a fire fight which was most annoying, yet at other points you could get almost half a level in front and it wouldn't teleport anyone anywhere.
That was and so far is my only my pet hate about this game and once I've played it through some more I will update this review. This is a good game to play with friends from what I have played aside from the teleport system and I would recommend it to others.

The co-op mode is just the single player story mode but with the addition of 3 friends playing along with you and the game was good fun, in parts a little challenging and can even make you jump when the aliens catch you off guard and appear from out of thin air, hiding in walls right in front of your face!
I can only pick fault with one aspect of it from what I've played and that is simply the teleport system. When playing co-op if you wandered too far ahead from your team mates the game teleports them to you. Well, in theory thats what it's supposed to do but we discovered it would teleport you at random times! Sometimes if you were only a few feet from your team mates and there was no reason to, quite often it would do this whilst in a fire fight which was most annoying, yet at other points you could get almost half a level in front and it wouldn't teleport anyone anywhere.
That was and so far is my only my pet hate about this game and once I've played it through some more I will update this review. This is a good game to play with friends from what I have played aside from the teleport system and I would recommend it to others.

reviewText:
This game is an old school first person shooter. Based on the Alien franchise. If you enjoy the films then you will enjoy this game.

Aliens: Colonial Marines takes place after the second film, Aliens. You return to planet LV-426 after the thermo nuclear explosion and your job is to investigate what happened.
The story is a roller coaster of a ride from start to finish. The game keeps true to its original ideas from the films. There are many places and object you will come across from film, Aliens.

The graphics are excellent however there is a frame rate issue. Looking at other reviews I personally believe the issue is over exaggerated. However if you are a hardcore first person shooter then I can understand why this would be an issue.
For me the only times it became an issue is when you move your angle of direction too quickly i.e. spin around. When moving from a position the game looked smooth most of the time. There were odd occasions when it will freeze for half a second to load up more of the game. Overall it is playable and does not effect the game play in a big way.

The sound is great and constantly keeps you on edge. All of the music and sound effects are taken from the film like the guns and the alien motion scanner. Also as an added bonus there is cameo voice acting from Michael Biehn who played Cpl. Dwayne Hicks .

Apart from the frame rate issue the game play is good fun, specially if you are an Alien film fan. It is a basic old school shooter with no cover mechanics apart from crouching. There are plenty of guns to choose from and upgrade. You can replay campaigns to gain more experience points for your profile character which makes a good replay mechanic.
The multiplayer section of the game looks good however it is dead at the time of this review.

I recommend this game for Alien fans and old school shooter fans. However I would not recommend it for hardcore first person shooter fans. Only because of the frame rate issue.

reviewText: Honestly, I think people who say this game is the worst game of 2013
date: the biggest disappointment of the last decade
recommended: or some other bulls**t are just pretentious hipsters, who haven't even tried playing the game seriously. I've played every single game in Aliens franchise, and I have finished every campaign on every game. However, I'm not an Alien fanboy, I just love the theme as it makes for a great scary atmosphere. Believe me when I say this, this game is by far the best game in the Aliens series since the all-time classic Aliens versus Predator. It's much better than the previous Aliens vs. Predator, in which every campaign took only 5 hours at max, and none of the campaigns had any meaningful story at all. This game has intense and awesome action sequences, a superb atmosphere that fills you with dreadful anticipation, and accompanies them with a really successful (not on Bioshock Infinite-level, of course) story and pleasing graphics.\nNow, you may ask why people are giving this game such a hard time. They used to be right. When the game came out. It hads LOTS of horrible bugs, so far as to make the game unplayable. The AI was so terrible it made you rage-quit. The aliens were unable to see you when you were bunny-hopping in front of them. Quests were broken because your idiot companions couldn't be arsed to open a godd*mn door for you. ALL OF THIS ARE IN THE PAST NOW, GUYS! THEY FIXED THE FRIGGIN GAME! Stop hating and try playing it again.\nThere are still some minor bugs, they are far, really far from making this game deserve such bad scores. Hell, think of Skyrim, Diablo III, every game in Battlefield series, and countless other modern games which were full of stupid bugs when they first came out. This game got 10 times the amount of hate those bug-ridden games got. It is so unfair. Just look at Rome Total War II and Battlefield 4. They were totally unplayable for many weeks after they were put on the market. Yet you don't see anyone calling them a complete failure" or "the worst game in recent years." Such bigotry

reviewText:
For £2.49 in a -75% sale this is an alright game

Pros
-The graphics can be good but can also look like grey potato
-The lip syncing is funny to watch
-Game is hilarious with friends
-Multiplayer has a very small active community
-Cheap as chips
-Xeno models are pretty cool
-Gun models are perfect
-Marine and Xeno customisation for multiplayer is amazing
-Game is worth £2.49
-Friendlies can kill enemies
-Has butt-quenching moments
-Has a neat progressive challenge system
-The Crusher and Boiler are both very fun to play as in multiplayer
-Multiplayer's community is okay, you won't get idiots shooting teammates or swearing obscenities down their mics
-The DLC doesn't add anything desirable
-They were creative with making the Spitter, Crusher and Boiler as well as all the heads for the Xenos and their skin colours
-Walking around so that a boiler chases your friend is hilarious
-Lighting is often excellent
-I joined a match on multiplayer and dominated
-There's a nice mod in the community forums to stop the game restarting upon exiting

Cons
-The game is pretty easy regardless of difficulty once you get used to it
-Multiplayer can have connectivity issues with other players, the ping can be high
-Can take a while to find a match (5mins of searching usually)
-DLC
-Game is not worth £9.99
-Story is crap
-Campaign forced too many references to the Aliens movie
-Friendlies deal very little damage and often get in the way of explosive fire
-The challenges can be very stupid and difficult if you don't have a friend with the game to cheese them
-Multiplayer can be very unbalanced
-WINTER
date:
MOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE" x50
-Some weapons use repeat sounds that cut out when firing (firing at times with no noise)
-Aliens with human skull faces look dumb as all hell
-Animations are recycled and don't fit in some areas
-Being able to throw facehuggers off of yourself with one hand is wrong in every sense of the word
-Lip syncing is atrocious
-The red dot on the sights is off from where the bullets are going to hit

-Characters are annoying
recommended:
obnoxious and ugly

-No one can have the "Friends of Gearbox" emblem for multiplayer unless they got it years ago
-Game reopens after closing like it doesn't want you to leave or something
-The only viable gametype in multiplayer is TDM
-The campaign is literally impossible on the hardest difficulty unless you have friends for the "Raven" fight
-Human characters have no facial expressions other than the "poker face"

Overall the game is actually worth the price of £2.49 and is enjoyable

reviewText:
Aliens Colonial Marines. Much like Duke Nukem Forever, its impossible for hardcore gamers to not instantly recognize the name.  Much like DNF, Colonial Marines has been in development for a very long time, since 2001 to be exact. Time would witness the game's stunted, postponed, and delayed development over the course of many years. Fans of both Aliens and Shooters would hold out an incredible amount of hope and patience for the release of a game that was sure to please everyone considering its long development cycle.

That was a mistake we are all guilty for.

After many screenshots, trailers, magazine articles, and interviews the game finally landed into our hands, was it worth the wait? Was it anything we expected it to be? Not exactly. From the beginning it was already evident that Colonial Marines suffered through a painful development process, with plenty of outsourcing, rewriting, and clashes between multiple developers working on it. The final result is a game that misses nearly every mark it should have struck perfectly, and leaves fans of the franchise and avid gamers with a feeling of utter disappointment. Every single thing about the game failed to please. This game is no doubt bound for the $2 bargain bin steam sale, and even then, is not worth the price of admission.

THE GOOD:
> Multiplayer is suprisingly decent (despite nobody playing it)
> Enviroments are somewhat interesting

THE BAD
- Horrific writing
- Terrible Voice Acting
- Lifeless and unlikable characters
- Atrocious AI that charges you blindly
- Shockingly bad ending
- Dated Graphics
- IS SUPPOSED TO BE OFFICIAL CANON
- Boring Cutscenes/Setpieces
- Aliens arent scary or threatening in the slightest
- Everything Else

THE UGLY
This is what we were promised. The game dosent look/sound/play anything like this. AT ALL.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xulEWbAyv3k


BOTTOM LINE:
Even if you are a hardcore fan of both the franchise and shooters, this game will disappoint in every way. You might be thinking to yourself Its gotta be good for a few laughs
date: right?" No. You'd be better off spending that money on a pack of gum. But if you decide to go ahead and get it anyway
recommended:
be prepared to recite the famous lines of the film its based on:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dsx2vdn7gpY

1/10 Abysmal."

reviewText:
Note before review:

I have only played the fully patched version and only on utlimate badass difficulty.

Review:

This is a good game, dont let the exaggerated reviews influence you, those were before the patches and mostly on consoles, its a fun game that recreates a lot of the Cameron`s film ambient, gamers looking for an experience similar to Alien should look for the upcoming Isolation title.

The props are well modeled, locations too, the aliens are correct size for the second movie.

I really think some people should watch the movie again, memory plays tricks.

Its of course not without flaws, theres some a.i. mistakes, not unlike many other titles, including AAA ones.

On multiplayer there are a few, for example there are blackouts and teleporting even when you are close to your teammates, i am assuming due to checkpoints, so its not that often in a campaign episode but its there.

Graphics are ok, to me (and im biased because i like the franchise a lot) they are not on par with the effects from the latest AAA  titles, but good enough and they do give the feeling of the movie (except for the missed opportunity with dyniamic lightning), its important to note that the framerate is smooth (on an i5 3500k and GTX 670)

The regular pulse rifle is not exactly like the one in the movie, though the differences make it look a little more functional, if you look at the movie again, they will look a little bland, not like you remembered,  but you will soon unlock hudsons pulse rifle, and that one is just like the movie ones.

Its an enjoyable game specially for fans of the franchise, and you should ONLY play it on ultimate badass difficulty, without a hud and no screen sights, it makes the moments in the game a little tighter.

The AI isnt exceptional but the lurker aliens are enjoyable.

I think a lot of reviewers should update their reviews for the PC version, the Aliens franchise (i mean the 2nd movie) is great for a thrilling FPS, they should keep doing and improving them.

And please do something about the story in future games, thats a point were i coincide with the reviews, its extremely bland and shouldnt be canon, it barely serves to frame the game's episodes, a good story would have helped a lot.

I would have loved to play inside the Sulaco when it came down. with all the aliens butchering everyone and going against the clock to evac it.

another note:

Gearbox should fix everything they told they would fix, at least to make up for the misguiding videos.

one last thing:

PLAY IT

Dont be like everyone else repeating a lousy review and it has a very low price from time to time (got it for $5 iirc), a lot of people are just repeating bad comments like a bad meme, and its certainly not true, its a good, enjoyable game that needed patching and Gearbox did misguide gamers with their videos, but its still an enjoyable game.
