reviewText:
I like the Alien movies... well at least two of them, I also like first-person shooters, and I also like the idea of being stuck in space with some unknown aliens trying to kill you... and despite how much I like those things, this game manages to fail on just about every level so hard that it is almost impressive.

In Colonial Marines you play as a marine (Obviously) named Winter, as a team is sent to investigate the Sulaco that is hovering somewhere above the planet LV-426, this game is set after the events of Aliens but before Alien 3, and the marines are looking for Ripley, Hicks, and the other missing marines, along the way they find Aliens (Shocking I know) and Weyland-Yutani mercenaries aboard the ship. As for the plot it actually has promise, given that this game was worked on by writers from Battlestar Galactica and is considered canonical in the Alien series would give one hope, sadly however as you play the game the way the story unfolds and the events that take place are subpar at best, without spoiling anything here I will say that by the end you will be shaking your head asking what exactly went wrong, from the disjointed emotions conveyed with below average voice acting even from the bigger names in the Alien franchise history that come back, to the sloppy and plot hole filled writing that in many ways make it seem more like Alien fan fiction then anything else.

But enough about the story lets talk about the gameplay! ...It blows, the shooting feels clunky, none of the guns seem at all accurate and while I know that might be due to the guns in Aliens lore being kind of bad in the first place, when I attach a red dot sight to a gun and aim down it, I expect my bullet to go where the dot is, not below it, or to have the sight swimming back and forward enough that you actually are more accurate when you fire from the hip, and in the end none of that really matters because the enemy AI feels like it took the short bus to work, the Xenomorphs act more like giant bugs and rush you, though you can counter this by backpedaling as they are not really faster then you are, and will not try tactics like attacking from your sides except for the rare times when they throw hunters at you and even then they are easily bested.

You will see Aliens running into the walls, failing about, blowing up, and otherwise acting more comedical then scary or threatening, but that is only part of the game, because luckily you get to fight human mercenaries as well, in an Aliens game... lets let that soak in for a moment.

Overall this game just... bad, the multiplayer is not counted in all this due to no one in their right mind playing it, the game is littered with bad DLC, and the core gameplay and plot fails as both a regular game and a piece of fan service and I recommend staying as far away from this one as you can.

Game Over, Man.

reviewText:
I like the Alien movies... well at least two of them, I also like first-person shooters, and I also like the idea of being stuck in space with some unknown aliens trying to kill you... and despite how much I like those things, this game manages to fail on just about every level so hard that it is almost impressive.

In Colonial Marines you play as a marine (Obviously) named Winter, as a team is sent to investigate the Sulaco that is hovering somewhere above the planet LV-426, this game is set after the events of Aliens but before Alien 3, and the marines are looking for Ripley, Hicks, and the other missing marines, along the way they find Aliens (Shocking I know) and Weyland-Yutani mercenaries aboard the ship. As for the plot it actually has promise, given that this game was worked on by writers from Battlestar Galactica and is considered canonical in the Alien series would give one hope, sadly however as you play the game the way the story unfolds and the events that take place are subpar at best, without spoiling anything here I will say that by the end you will be shaking your head asking what exactly went wrong, from the disjointed emotions conveyed with below average voice acting even from the bigger names in the Alien franchise history that come back, to the sloppy and plot hole filled writing that in many ways make it seem more like Alien fan fiction then anything else.

But enough about the story lets talk about the gameplay! ...It blows, the shooting feels clunky, none of the guns seem at all accurate and while I know that might be due to the guns in Aliens lore being kind of bad in the first place, when I attach a red dot sight to a gun and aim down it, I expect my bullet to go where the dot is, not below it, or to have the sight swimming back and forward enough that you actually are more accurate when you fire from the hip, and in the end none of that really matters because the enemy AI feels like it took the short bus to work, the Xenomorphs act more like giant bugs and rush you, though you can counter this by backpedaling as they are not really faster then you are, and will not try tactics like attacking from your sides except for the rare times when they throw hunters at you and even then they are easily bested.

You will see Aliens running into the walls, failing about, blowing up, and otherwise acting more comedical then scary or threatening, but that is only part of the game, because luckily you get to fight human mercenaries as well, in an Aliens game... lets let that soak in for a moment.

Overall this game just... bad, the multiplayer is not counted in all this due to no one in their right mind playing it, the game is littered with bad DLC, and the core gameplay and plot fails as both a regular game and a piece of fan service and I recommend staying as far away from this one as you can.

Game Over, Man.

reviewText: Not as bad as everyone says. Sure, this game did have a lot of expectation to live up to, but in the end, it does pay tribute to the Alien franchise. You get to explore LV-426 and the U.S.S. Sulaco, you get to wield the U.S.C.M. arsenal, and not to mention, you get to mow down a bunch of aliens. Not to mention the multiplayer (If there are any people on the servers though) is FREAKING INSANE AND AWESOME. The DLC for this game great; there's a movie map pack containing multiplayer maps from the Alien movies themselves, such as the Nostromo or Fury 161. Then there's Bug Hunt, an awesome gamemode similar to that of Nazi Zombies from CoD. There's also a seperate campaign you can download that really pays tribute to Aliens.  Sure, the alien A.I. may not be as good as it should be, but it's improved a lot since the initial release of the game. My only complaint though is the levels you have to fight the Weyland-Yutani mercs. It's annoying, but it isn't bad enough to ruin the overall game experience. Overall, I give this game a 7/10.\n\n

reviewText:
Download size: 10 gb
Playtime: 8 hours for campaign

I bought a physical copy of Aliens Colonial Marines (ACM) about a year ago when it was free after rebate despite the poor ratings that just about every reviewer gave the game. The game was at least a few months old already, so it’s possible that a lot of the things people were complaining about had already been patched out. Definitely the game has its problems, but it does not deserve its 45 Metacritic score. A couple of weird things I noticed right off were that after taking about 30 minutes to install from the DVD, Steam still needed to download an additional 6 gb to finish installation. There must have been a bunch of replaced core files, because I don’t own any DLCs for this game. Also, lately I’ve been experiencing a bug where immediately after exiting the game, the game immediately launches again. I know I’m not the only one with this problem because I did a quick search online for a fix. Apparently one solution is to make the game run in administrator mode (so it asks you for a password on startup) which would allow you to cancel the game launch. EDIT: It didn’t work, making the game run in admin mode keeps it from starting at all. I just stick with quickly cancelling the game launch.

Aliens: CM takes place a few months after the second Alien movie (probably the best movie). If you recall the ending of Aliens, Hicks (the marine), Ripley (the survivor), and Newt (little girl) escaped planet LV-426 in the marine ship Sulaco. Well in the game, their space ship was somehow called back to the planet after they ejected their life pods onto another planet (beginning of Alien 3). You play a marine named Winters who is part of a large expedition sent to investigate the Sulaco’s reappearance at LV-426 and the vanishing of the Hadley’s Hope colony on the planet. The story follows your attempts at surviving both the alien onslaught and a large force of Weyland Yutani private military forces who are up to no good.

ACM is a fairly standard first person shooter but has a weapon inventory system where you only carry 3 weapons at once (primary, secondary, pistol) that you can switch between. However at any time during the game you can press your weapon inventory button and swap between any weapons that you own. This means that you are essentially carrying every weapon at once (like the old Doom games) but you need to go into your inventory to swap which weapon is in which weapon slot (like Dead Island or Borderlands except you never ‘drop’ weapons, every weapon is unique). This is clearly a way to make weapon switching easier for console gamers. Speaking of weapons, there are quite a few that you can choose from (and customize). In addition to the various guns you acquire through story progression, you can also find “legendary” guns, which are weapons belonging to characters from the movie Aliens. For example “Hudson’s Pulse Rifle” or “Hicks’ Shotgun” are powerful versions of the normal weapons but cannot be customized (like the special weapons in Far Cry 3). The weapon customization system is pretty well done, so you’ll probably end up using your customized guns rather than the legendary versions. Again, you don’t have gun inventory limitations, so you can carry both versions if you want.

Like a lot of modern “squad based” shooters, you will spend a great deal of time with at least one other computer controlled “team mate.” The team mate gives a little fire support, but you’ll have to do most of the killing. If anything, the computer controlled team mates can be an annoyance when you’re trying to complete game challenges (small game achievements that give bonus exp) because they keep shooting enemies that you’re setting up for specific kills. For example there’s a challenge for killing 10 enemies with melee, and the team mate will steal the kill as you move in to finish off the enemy. By the way, melee in this game is very weak, and it takes a bunch of hits to kill anything. It’s mostly to shove aliens away when they’re grappling you.

Pros:
+Decent story line (which is considered canon to the Aliens franchise). This isn’t some game maker’s fan fiction.
+Some levels are creepily atmospheric, especially the ones where you’re alone in the dark.
+The game has multiplayer coop for the main campaign! Unfortunately I don’t have any friends who own the game, so I haven’t been able to try it.

Cons:
-The game has its share of bugs, the most annoying of which is the re-launch bug I mentioned earlier. Earlier versions of the game had poor enemy AI, but it must have been patched since I didn’t really notice it. Early reviewers of the game said that the xenos often would not even attack the player which I kind of understand because in the movies the xenos prioritize threats (like actual predators). So I guess you could say the game maker wanted the enemies to behave realistically, unfortunately an action shooter game isn’t very fun if the enemies wait for you to attack first. There’s also this weird thing where human enemies will try to shoot at you THROUGH the cover they’re hiding behind. This means you’ll hear gunfire and see sparks showing exactly where the enemy is hiding.
-Even on Recruit mode (easy mode) the game can be difficult (you have very low health). I think they expect everyone to be playing in coop or something because when I went online for tips, people are saying how easy it is if you can get a partner to play with.
-The game has a rank progression system where you get exp for finishing levels and playing multiplayer, but progression is very slow for someone like me who can really only play single player. There isn’t much activity going on in multiplayer. The marine progression and xeno progression are separate, and xeno can only be leveled up in multiplayer. The later ranks don’t actually make you stronger (higher life/damage) they mostly unlock customizations and cosmetics.

Apparently a while ago there was a class action lawsuit against the makers of Aliens Colonial Marines because of unmet expectations. This is hilarious to me since I’ve never heard of game makes being sued for making a bad game. Part of the controversy was that the company Gearbox was paid by Sega to develop the game, but spent a lot of the money on their own game Borderlands 2 (which I loved).
From what I hear, the early trailers and gameplay footage showed to potential customers was actually far superior to the actual game. I’m not sure how that happened, but I do agree that the graphics aren’t especially good for a modern game. I turned off the “film grain” option and it’s obvious that not too much effort was spent on the game’s textures.

If you can manage your expectations Aliens Colonial Marines is a decent cheap game experience. Sega seems to have abandoned the idea of trying to make a lot of money on it, so you can probably get it for $5 during a sale. If nothing else, you can set the game to recruit mode and just run past most of the xenos to experience the story. They kind of jump around a lot, and may even stop chasing you if you run far enough. Don’t try this with the Weyland Yutani mercs though, they’ll blow you away.

reviewText:
I bought this game to be happy
as the title was too catchy.
Its developer was famous and dependable
but their product soon became expendable.
I was not a hater, did not start a petition
but simply purchased the collector's edition.
The game started up, I began my journey
I soon found the story a big baloney.
I hate you Gearbox, you let me down
I wanted a game you could not get me, why?

Poem aside, Colonial Marines is mediocre at best. Below bulletpoints are my findings which are based on the completed campaign (with almost all the achievements attained there save for the ones of the campaign DLC) and I must also mention no multiplayer session was found when trying to look for parties online for a possible coop campaign or team deathmatch.

+++ The game looks and feels good. Yeah I know there are videos comparing the gameplay trailer and the actual gameplay footage and there was the lawsuit filed against the publisher or developer. In fact, they also blamed each other for this and Kotaku has an article of all this mess but it's just best to forget about it. Development took quite many years - this is one of those games that went through a development hell and as a result of this critics ripped the game apart.

+++ I do believe the atmosphere is right there where it should be. The sound effects are all great and there are many areas borrowed directly from Aliens. You can traverse through Hadley's Hope, for instance, and if you are an Aliens fan you'll recognise some of the rooms, vehicles and even Bishop turns up as a vital member of your team.

- - - Aaaaaaaaaaand pretty much that's it. Everything else is bad. The game gives you an awful lot of chance to fight the soldiers of Weyland-Yutani. I did not like where they went with the story. Fighting the xenomorphs is good but sometimes it seems awkward (i.e. glitchy) - especially the 2 boss fights with bigger aliens. And then you have the encounter with the queen which is a complete letdown. And all this in the name of a story that is meant to be canon... to bridge Aliens with Alien 3.

- - - Again, we have a 6-7 hour long campaign which is not much. If they highlighted the greatness of story during advertising why couldn't they give us a longer adventure? You team up with some marines and go together which obviously is an indication of a coop campaign. It is not necessarily bad but the AI controlling our fellow soldiers is not that good. Sometimes they are a pain and they can spawn at certain points quickly once you have advanced the story. An upside is that they cannot be downed so you do not spend any time with reviving them. In any case, playing in coop mode is probably much better than alone.

Colonial Marines was a letdown. The game has an excellent design and brings back a lot of memorable places / events from Aliens (not to mention the dog tags you are looking for or the so-called legendary weapons you can find e.g. Hicks' shotgun) but playing a tribute is not enough to create a decent game.

It is a good homage but a mediocre game that should have been properly finished.

reviewText:
Now, I'm going to start by stating my credentials so that people know I'm not blowing crap out my ears.

I have 45 hours on this game. I have gone through the hassle, yes, hassle, not challenge, of unlocking the State of the Badass Art" Achievement on this game for defeating it on the hardest difficulty level. I've even managed to play some multiplayer before it became an abandoned wasteland. I was one of the fools who preordered it and I continued playing it after the update to the graphics that finally came.

That taken care of it's time for the actual review.

Don't waste your money on this steaming pile of horse manure. Even if it's on sale.

What we were promised as a community was bloody brilliant. It was graphical
recommended: and it looked beautiful. Constant motion
hoursPlayed: brilliant graphical design
voteText:
and made by companies that were well-known for good games. What we got I would've excused if it wasn't so falsely advertised and if it was made by an indie developer. Not after all the beautiful "In-game" footage and the screenshots and hype-building.

When I first got the game I was carried by the hype and I even defended the game based off of my belief that most people disliked it purely because the motion-tracker was something you had to pick up and not something sitting in the HUD like in AVP2010.

I own up to that and apologize to everyone for that. Which is more than I can say for the people responsible for the lie that is A:CM. If I could I'd refund this game and use the money on a different one but I can't.

The AI is buggy and slow and unresponsive and that's just the Marines.

Aliens sit out in the open practically begging to be shot.

There's enough ammo and such laying about that it makes challenge a thing of the past and the fact that your sidearm has infinite ammo redundant. Not to mention you can ALWAYS switch weapons with anything you've unlocked so if you do manage to spray-and-pray your way through your Pulse Rifle then you can just open a menu and trade it for the SMG.

Difficulty level is a joke. The AI doesn't get harder you just get a bit weaker and in the case of the "Ultimate Badass" difficulty it just means you don't have a HUD. Boss fights are hysterical and only ever difficult because of spam not actual challenge.

The graphics level
helpfulPercent: compared to what we were promised
votesHelpful: is something I'd expect from an Indie Dev
votesTotal: but they don't falsely advertise. The graphics are buggy and low-detail. It's almost funny in a sad way how easy it is to tell the difference between an alien and alien hive wall goop
votesFunny: where they should be blending perfectly. And this is all the static graphics not the motion graphics. Explosions are crap and nothing I can believe in. The characters at least don't clip into their parts like they did before the update. The ragdoll physics are.... sickening.\n\nOh
commentsCount: lest I forget
column16: you spend more time in Call of Duty style shootouts with Wey-Yu personnel than you do actually having a horror experience fighting or running from Aliens. Well done Game Devs you made another run-and-gun Shooter.\n\nI'm going to stop now and finish. Don't waste your money. Buy a good game like Isolation seems to be. Or AVP2010."

reviewText:
Now, I'm going to start by stating my credentials so that people know I'm not blowing crap out my ears.

I have 45 hours on this game. I have gone through the hassle, yes, hassle, not challenge, of unlocking the State of the Badass Art" Achievement on this game for defeating it on the hardest difficulty level. I've even managed to play some multiplayer before it became an abandoned wasteland. I was one of the fools who preordered it and I continued playing it after the update to the graphics that finally came.

That taken care of it's time for the actual review.

Don't waste your money on this steaming pile of horse manure. Even if it's on sale.

What we were promised as a community was bloody brilliant. It was graphical
recommended: and it looked beautiful. Constant motion
hoursPlayed: brilliant graphical design
voteText:
and made by companies that were well-known for good games. What we got I would've excused if it wasn't so falsely advertised and if it was made by an indie developer. Not after all the beautiful "In-game" footage and the screenshots and hype-building.

When I first got the game I was carried by the hype and I even defended the game based off of my belief that most people disliked it purely because the motion-tracker was something you had to pick up and not something sitting in the HUD like in AVP2010.

I own up to that and apologize to everyone for that. Which is more than I can say for the people responsible for the lie that is A:CM. If I could I'd refund this game and use the money on a different one but I can't.

The AI is buggy and slow and unresponsive and that's just the Marines.

Aliens sit out in the open practically begging to be shot.

There's enough ammo and such laying about that it makes challenge a thing of the past and the fact that your sidearm has infinite ammo redundant. Not to mention you can ALWAYS switch weapons with anything you've unlocked so if you do manage to spray-and-pray your way through your Pulse Rifle then you can just open a menu and trade it for the SMG.

Difficulty level is a joke. The AI doesn't get harder you just get a bit weaker and in the case of the "Ultimate Badass" difficulty it just means you don't have a HUD. Boss fights are hysterical and only ever difficult because of spam not actual challenge.

The graphics level
helpfulPercent: compared to what we were promised
votesHelpful: is something I'd expect from an Indie Dev
votesTotal: but they don't falsely advertise. The graphics are buggy and low-detail. It's almost funny in a sad way how easy it is to tell the difference between an alien and alien hive wall goop
votesFunny: where they should be blending perfectly. And this is all the static graphics not the motion graphics. Explosions are crap and nothing I can believe in. The characters at least don't clip into their parts like they did before the update. The ragdoll physics are.... sickening.\n\nOh
commentsCount: lest I forget
column16: you spend more time in Call of Duty style shootouts with Wey-Yu personnel than you do actually having a horror experience fighting or running from Aliens. Well done Game Devs you made another run-and-gun Shooter.\n\nI'm going to stop now and finish. Don't waste your money. Buy a good game like Isolation seems to be. Or AVP2010."

reviewText:
Why the hate? Just why?

Maybe you hate this game because of alien spawn camping back in the day, or maybe you hated it because now you can't find a match, or maybe you just like to give negative reviews. Whatever it may be, I don't understand it. Here is why, first off there is no alien spawn camping anymore, you can find games easily, and finally there is nothing in my opinion to ♥♥♥♥♥ about, lol

This game was boring as hell when I played it alone but after my friends started buying it and my brother did too, omg, never have I had this much fun in a long ♥♥♥ time. I was laughing, fighting, and just having a great time with my friends and brother, it was a blast killing my friends as they charged at me, or them killing me when I charged at them.

Aliens: Colonial Marines was done right for me too be happy, it is fun, the custamization is great and the alien killing moves are fun to do! Upgrades, killing, multiplayer campaign. I don't see whats with the bad reviews, I have only seen one or two that actually made sense but too me, buy this game if you wanna have fun and a great time with your friends

Thank You

reviewText:
-dont play this on consoles, their hardware cant take the graphic enhance patches that have come out. pcs are upgradable, load faster & have superior graphics over consoles everyone knows this. the screen tearing, texture pop in & mass amount of low res textures everywhere is only on the consoles, xbox360 being the worst of the 2 for obvious reasons, if you insist on a console for this game at least use a ps3.

-the dlcs for acm are good & worth getting with the season pass, its still overpriced from valve so get the season pass elsewhere for much cheaper. multiplayer is mostly dead if not completely dead now cause humans are dumb bandwagon sheep, for the slight multiplayer thats still alive if found, is enjoyable for the most part. the only advantage to consoles for this game is that their multiplayer has or had a little more than pc.

-the minimum specs are wrong for the gpu, it needs to be higher than those at least geforce 9600/amd 3800 series, there is no graphic settings in game to reduce for weaker gpus, draw distance, sbao etc dont do anything, all you have to reduce load on older gpus is resolution itself. my desktop does fine maxed fps all the time, my laptop with a gt 555m native res is 1366x768 & can at best do 1600x900 on this game, 1080p is just too slow ~21 fps. cpu requirements are mostly accurate, any hyperthreaded dual core like mobile i3/i5 are fine, it just needs the threads. the i5 2410m in my laptop has power to spare in acm & most other games thats 2 cores 4 threads.

-single player is good there was lots of fixes to difficulty, ai, graphics..the latest single player dlc stasis interrupted is one of the best dlc the game has. i have a play through of said dlc i did on its launch day -> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kbln9ixJsJs

its worth the buy especially for pc even if you dont know the aliens franchise but still like these types of games

reviewText:
You know something strange is going on when serious reviewers on mainstream media sites sound like they're channeling Yahtzee when reviewing a game.  It's a strange case of expectation vs reality.  When a game fails to meet expectations, it gets ripped to shreds for the tiniest flaws that people would find amusing in other games and ends up with a much worse rating than a game that was expected to be bad and is an entirely worse game.

By now everyone's heard the rumors about the turbulent development of this game.  It's obviously a tale of project management gone seriously wrong with the game being put on hold for years and later passed onto another studio.  The most amazing thing I've heard however is that just 9 months before release, Gearbox got the game back from Timegate, threw most of it out, and started over.  That's pretty amazing if you ask me and I doubt any other studio could pull it off.

To the game itself:  The campaign is a reasonable length, pretty standard these days.  Served with a heavy dose of fan service, some people may like it more than others.  The story's more of a stretch than Alien 3, wedging itself in there in the realm of cinematic impossibility.  Voice acting's a mixed bag but the writing is terrible and there's plenty of cringe-worthy lines.  The campaign is fully coopable as well, but the coop feels a bit tacked on with a couple of noname marines tagging along with the main character, and the game teleporting people to the leader when someone walks 5 feet ahead of the group.

That said, the gameplay is pretty good at least.  It's fun shooting xenos and even the Wayland-Yutani goons who come after you to cover up their horrifying experiments.  The xeno animations may be a bit wonky so they don't quite move or act like aliens should, but they'll still rip you to shreds if you aren't paying attention.  Your AI partners are pretty useless, mostly firing blanks and getting in the way (not that that's anything unusual) though some people have more trouble with this than others.

Multiplayer on the other hand is a bit of a mess.  It's wildly unbalanced, with marines having a huge advantage at lower levels and being able to level up through single player and co-op.  The marines even get a fully automatic shotgun that can kill most xenos in one shot.  After the aliens level up and get certain upgrades, suddenly they can take 8 shots from the same gun without dying and dominate the marines.  The game uses peer-to-peer matchmaking so lag is always a problem and the third person control of the aliens is beyond awful.  Wallclimbing barely works and is pretty much useless except for climbing up onto high points to spit at the marines with the spitter.  Some of the modes are somewhat fun at least.

I think the best way to sum up this game is to say it's disappointing.  After watching the E3 demo from a couple years ago and then playing the first level in the real game yourself, it's hard not to be mad about what the game could have been.  The graphics went from top of the line to couple-years-ago-average to work on consoles and took all the atmosphere along with it.  It makes me wonder if things might've been different if the game had come out next year targeted for the next generation of consoles.

Bottom line: Disappointing but still better than Call of Duty.

reviewText:
It's honestly not that bad BUT there is a fair share of problems:
-Low resolution textures from 2006 with a crappy grainy filter
-Non existent special effects (e.g. explosions)
-Awkward animations
-Budget voice actors
-Incoherent plot
-Questionable AI. Impressed me at times by hiding or running away. Other times they froze up and stood still.
-There's no balance in difficulty. On normal, some of the human enemies can kill you in 2-3 hits in half a second.
-Gearbox dropped support for this game immediately (SHAME ON YOU). This includes multiplayer support and SHIFT codes.

(As of October 4, 2014 - the latest patch has yet to fix any of problems.)

If you think this won't bother you, then I recommend it. There is decent core gameplay and they also managed to tap into some of the nostalgia from the movie. Otherwise try the 2010 remake of Alien vs Predator or Alien: Isolation and forget this game ever existed.

I personally would be lying if I said I didn't enjoy a few segments. They did put a smile on my face. Unfortunately the game had unparallel hype and failed to live up to any of it. I went in expecting nothing and came out neutral. As of right now, I'd give it a 6/10  - an average game with technical difficulties but set in an incredible universe. A mod could easily fix most of the problems and alter the score to an 8/10 but that's hoping for too much. That being said, it's not the worst thing ever so don't be fooled by the negative reviews - I've played a bunch of crappy games in my day but this isn't one of them. Strictly generic with technical problems.

reviewText:
Overall, the worst game to come from the Alien franchize.
The single-player campaign unfolds exactly like one could expect from an unfinished, obvious cash-grab from an incompetent design team. Textures resemble something you would expect from the Doom 3 era, except, somehow worse, featuring both a dull and jagged visual experience. The sounds, although familar to those who enjoyed the film series, lack a certain punch, this coupled with an uninspired, dredfully acted voice acting ensemble. The story arc is also sure in infuriate those true movie fans who respect the authenticity of the Alien Universe. In fact, voice actor Micheal Bein sounds as if he is forced at gunpoint to deliver this hot mess.
On a postive note, fun can be had in small doses during online co-op mode, where two can experience the almost comic like deliver of awful, nearly on rails gameplay and insane visual bugs.
The first chapter of the DLC Stasis Interupted"

reviewerDisplayName: 𝕭 𝖗 𝖆 𝖙 𝖙 𝖞
reviewText:
Hard Game To Review
6 Hours. I just want to repeat that, because I want you to take this journey with me: 6 hours. A friend and I played through the entire campaign. The cost of admission to get the game? 80% off. If this game had been released in 2003 for the normally asked price, it might be a good value. Did I enjoy it? Immensely, but not for the reasons that one normally enjoys a game.

So, it's a good game, then? It depends on your definition of good. If you like things to be so horribly broken out of the box that it's hilarious, then yes, this game is fan-freakin'-tastic. If you set out to play a game where all of the characters have the same facial expression all the time like Vin Diesel in a Fast and Furious movie, a ridiculous soundtrack that does not fit the Alien franchise whatsoever (It would fit in a Star Wars game, though!), sound effects that make no sense whatsoever, and better yet, voice acting that also makes no sense whatsoever...then this game gets an A+ rating. All of these things are available in huge buckets. It's a veritable cavalcade of frivolity and laziness. I wonder how many hours the unpaid design and programming interns at Gearbox put in to making this awesome, unintentionally hilarious game. I say unpaid, because I imagine this was also used as their capstone project to graduate with their associate's degree.

How about some specifics? Sure! The animations of the Xenomorphs look absolutely ridiculous. Cute, almost. The sounds for the Xenomorphs are, quite literally, stock sounds of cats manipulated a very small amount. None of it is terrifying, and ruins the terrifying concept of the franchise. The game is claustrophobic, in a bad way - half of the game is running backward to do something. Invisible walls are there, and then they disappear (which is a situationally ironic statement to make) after doing some entirely arbitrary action.

Bad AI? There is no AI, everything moves on a track. It is patterned. Either that, or the AI is so poorly programmed that it seems this way. I spent 15 minutes laughing at the queen not being able to reach me in a corner, but breathing heavily and whipping her tail, a lot like my dog does before knocking something off of the coffee table in my living room!

Unintentionally hilarious, that's the best I can come up with. Did I enjoy it? Yes. It was so ridiculously bad that I couldn't help but enjoy it. Whether this was Gearbox's or Sega's fault is beyond the point, all they would have to do is change all of the marketing to call it a parody and they would do grand. It's definitely a parody of the Aliens franchise!

I've seen a lot of reviews that say they would only recommend it for hardcore fans of the franchise. Nuh-uh. No, because I'm a hardcore fan of the franchise, and have been from a very young age, and I exclaim that this is the worst thing to happen to Aliens since the AVP movie came out in 2004 - and I loved that movie for the same reasons I love this game.

6 hours. Including half hour breaks while still in game, including bathroom breaks while still in game, including meals, cigarettes, and taking my dog outside.... while still in game. You're looking at a good, solid 4 hours of game here wrapped up in a budget title with AAA packaging. If you're all about some achievements - go for it, you get one for starting the game, and then you get one for starting a campaign! Then you get one for firing your first bullet, for getting facehugged, and for laughing out loud at how ridiculous it is.

But it's not all hilariously bad. No. What the game gets right, it gets really right. I actually liked the feel of the weapons and the actions of them. As long as I ignored the completely arbitrary upgrades that make absolutely no difference, I thought they were great! I also thought that the inconsistent use of punctuation, capitalization, and plot helped add to the experience and, overall, made my 80% off purchase well worth it.

I wish I knew whether or not H.R. Giger would feel avenged or offended, since he was horribly ripped off after the first Alien movie, continually. Avenged because of the fact that this game makes everyone involved in its production ridiculous, other than him, or offended, that they would take his concepts and do everything they can to make them seem as ridiculous as possible.

6 hours.

5/10 overall. Not recommended unless you REALLY like unintentional parodies and hilarity. If you've been playing too many great games lately, pick it up! if you've been playing a lot of bad games lately, I would suggest skipping it. If you're a fan of the franchise, I would suggest that you refuse to connect this with it in any way.

Replay value: ...Actually kind of high. I want to see if at any point ANYTHING makes any sense. Actually, no, I take that back, I want my 10 gigabytes of hard drive space back.

Also, Vin Diesel rules. I don't want it to seem like that comparison was made in an attempt to insult Vin Diesel, but his facial expression never friggin' changes. Also, i'm going to go ahead and say I recommend this game. I know I said I didn't...but, still, I kinda do.

reviewText:
I have spent a lot of time playing this game through different difficulties both online and offline.
This is a really crappy first person shooter with varying degrees of quality and entertainment throughout the rather boring campaign. It does not play very fast paced, but it's faster than Doom 3 for example. It's nothing like Quake 3, it's simply a generic moderate paced FPS.
This game just seems to be a mess, it has an incosistency about it in regards to map design and quality.
This game has rather annoying NPCs with bad A.I., ugly graphics with occasional performance issues, bad music and lackluster sound effects. It has an overall lack of quality compared to other first person shooters currently available and at the time of the games release.
The game had a pretty wild past in development but the end result is a game that is simply not worth your time or money.

Pros:
-A good length Campaign which can be played both Online and Offline.
-Some familiar characters, weapons, monsters, and enviroments from the movies. If your a fan you might enjoy it more.
-Some Nice graphics and sound effects. Some nice DLC that includes maps and weapons to extend your playing experience.

Cons:
-NPC A.I. is noticebly stupid and useless, and they can actually prevent game progress.
-Graphics seems blurry and ugly, map design is boring and generic, weapon inpacts are lacking.
-No Cards, very high price tag.

There are many more entertaining First Person Shooters available today, and if you really want a fun Alien series FPS, play Alien versus Predator Classic, or Alien versus Predator instead.

reviewText:
Whilst the game could've been better it is in no way a 'terrible' game, sure it's bad (from what it started as) but it's not the worst. I actually find it fun and entertaining.

Alright, so I have this game on ps3; beat it with my twin a while back (a year or something ago) and I remember that the game had issues: bad AI, low frame rates and delayed controls from what it seemed.

So I saw this on sale for PC and I was like 'hey, why not, $1.99 isn't that bad' and I also heard that the PC version was patched quite alot.

I booted up the game played through the campaign and I must say I am impressed, the frame rate was descent, the game looks better (slightly) and the AI descent.

If your an Aliens fan, give it a chance, especially when it's on sale.


Co-op is pretty fun too.

reviewText:
This game doesn't deserve all the negativity it gets. I played it originally on console when it first came out so I've seen this game in it's worst form.

Then when I eventually got it again on Steam I looked up some tweaking to improve A.I. and it made all the difference. On console the xenos would just run towards you with open arms, accepting their fate, but on pc they were on the walls, sneaking behind, lunging from all over.

Pros:
- You get to play as a Colonial Marine. (M41-A Pulse Rifle...need I say more?)
- You get to visit the Sulaco.
- You get to visit LV-426 and view areas in the movie where our characters took their last stand. (Even the floor was damaged where Hudson was pulled under)
- Legendary weapons for fanboys to get excited over.
- Everything from the atmosphere, music, and sound effects are spot on.

Cons:
- It was not the Alien game we were all hoping for.
- A.I. by default isn't the best (nor the worst) but that can be fixed with mods/patches.
- Ending felt rushed.

Being  a fan of the series I would say this game is worth a try. It goes on sale quite often and if you can pick it up with a friend it's a good co-op play session.

As a game (co-op): 7 / 10

As for the nostalgia: 10 / 10

reviewText:
Another example of the Alien franchise going in the wrong direction, as the once survival horror franchise takes another step closer to being a modern military shooter. There is little this game has to offer besides generic linear shooting, short campaign and gives off all the signs of a rushed incomplete product. While there are few moments that give off the Alien horror feel and tension, they are short lived and you  soon find yourself fighting against and alongside awful AI again.

The single player campaign simply emphasizes the numerous issues within the game. As well as soon questioning which product you bought. After the first level of killing aliens you will soon find yourself fighting mercenaries for at least fifty percent of the game or more. The game offers no originality or twists to combat while still finding it almost impossible to match up to even some of the most basic shooters on the market. There is a scene in which the game takes a stealthy horror approach however this very short experience is soon over before you find yourself back in the same combat situations you have been for the past two to three hours. Many aspects of the game offer the accuracy of detail for the Alien franchise such as accurate pulse rifle sounds and map design that respects the original designs from the Alien films. Other areas simply express the laziness of the development team as the iconic smartgun simply has the identical sound of the pulse rifle, which as many Alien fans will know do not sound the same.

The voice acting and storyline are both very poor, with voices just sounding unconvincing and out of place , while laughable dialog just makes cut scenes a painful chore to watch. Many times during the dialog the characters lips will become completely out of synchronization with the voice over. Characters will also often seem very stiff and lack animations, and at some points they will simply skip an animation which has just clearly just not being put into the game. One boss simple does not even have any attack animations, it simply walks around in circles and if it touches you, you find yourself on the floor for no reason missing a health bar.

The poor voice acting and animations make it difficult to take characters seriously or develop any bond to them, this is made even worse by the awful artificial intelligence of your team. You will often find your team shooting the walls, standing still or walking around in circles very confused during combat, it would have been much better if they simply removed the teammates from the game completely. If you were left alone instead of frequently listening to O’niels bad dialogue, it would greatly improve the experience. The enemy AI does little to inspire as well, as many aliens will simply slowly walk up you in the open and never use speed or wall running to help them, while bosses simply spend more time struggling to navigate the terrain.

If you are playing this, I would suggest co-op instead of single player, this by far improves the gameplay when you bring friends along. As more players join the game, the number of aliens and health of enemies increases to try to balance the game, however some areas especially against enemy infantry or not scaled. This often leaves situations such as four players walking through narrow corridors and killing two or three poorly armed scientists in each room and many players having nothing to do for around half an hour. There is no class system in co-op but simply an increased number of players, an area that the game could have looked at to improve the co-op teamwork involved.

Multiplayer seems to have the most work put into it, with many customization upgrades for not only the marines but also for the aliens. It also offers more variety then the older Alien games with multiplayer, with new classes for the aliens to use in more effective ways such as a spitter or crusher aliens. It can be frustrating at times, as the aliens seem to have such little health issues with lag and controls means you may often die and be confused of what happened and why. Playing as the marines adds much more tension then the single player campaign has to offer. The motion sensor has use and often fuels the paranoia for the marine team trying to stay alive. These tense and exciting moments can soon be lost however, when you find aliens lagging then suddenly you are on the floor dead and the poor and sometimes none existent animations make this even more confusing. The multiplayer will unlikely have a long life, with many upgrades available within one or two days of playing multiplayer will soon lose interest to the majority of players with the lack of content.

With a season pass DLC already available on the steam store for 30$, for future DLC, I question how they feel its appropriate to charge for more content for this game while its clearly unfinished and lacking content in the main game. With many people disappointed with the DLC released for borderlands 2 made by Gearbox, I have little hope that we will be impressed and find our moneys worth within future DLC content. Personally I feel that the future DLC should be free, considering how much content that was promised before release simple is not there, but that isn’t how business works.

Pro:

Most areas live up to the lore of Aliens
Four player drop in/out co-op
Multiplayer that can sometimes provide the paranoia fueling Alien experience
Small customization features and upgrades
Cons:

Poor dialogue and voice acting
Poor animations, sometimes none existent
Poor visuals
No real boss fights
Dreadful enemy and team AI
Generic combat that struggles to meet up to even the most basic shooters
Lack of class system for co-op
No re-playability for the campaign
Multiplayer can be fun, but has little to offer in the long term

My verdict is that you should avoid this game under all circumstances. There is little to be gained to playing this poorly executed shooter, while it may appeal to some of the Alien fans, and those into modern military shooters, it still is poor in every single aspect. Simply put, everything this game tries to do, other games do better as it just feels terribly outdated and unfinished. If you really want to purchase this product still, I would advise waiting a few months for a sale or the price to drop, I can’t imagine it will retain full price for very long.

reviewText: Aliens: Colonial Marines was conceived with access to some of the film’s original creators and even designated to be official canon by the corporate stewards of the franchise. It has “legit” written all over it, but while there’s ample gore, acid blood, and the persistent modulating whine of marine pulse rifles, film’s nerve-wracking tension just isn’t there. For all the attention paid to the source material, it just doesn’t feel like Aliens.The best way to describe the gameplay is merely “standard.” The shooting is what you would come to expect from Call of Duty: aiming down the sights of a gun, shooting enemies and throwing grenades. It’s all there and never really feels different from any other shooter. Players will be pitted against both Xenomorphs and human mercenaries. The story falls short throughout the campaign. The voice acting consists of poorly written dialog and uninspired performances. The final payoff to the entire game is underwhelming, and questions are never really answered. It got to a point where I just tuned the story bits out.The lighting effects and visuals do look good in some areas. The animations, on the other hand, are very clunky. The enemy AI is just plain bad in many cases. Of course, that doesn’t stop them from being deadly. The multiplayer has different modes that put two teams against each other.Most players would think it would be more enjoyable to play the Aliens, but the Xenos are a clunky mess. Aliens: Colonial Marines is a mixed bag.It seems to have the right set up for a decent Aliens game with the presentation and look, but due to the boring story and clunky enemy AI, there is no tension or exciting action. The co-op is probably the best way to play, but players need to choose a higher difficulty if they want any kind of a challenge. The competitive multiplayer feels unbalanced.Aliens: Colonial Marines is so riddled with problems and boring stretches that it can be painful at times.I would only recommend this game to hardcore Alien fans.Overall 5/10.

reviewText:
Honest review.

Storyline. Very short, makes you wish that there was more but  there really isn't.

Graphics. 2005 called it wants its graphics back!

Controls. Basic FPS controls, remembering how to change them might get tricky at first. (with controller support)

Sound. My opinion, best part about the game.

Servers. Once again as deserted as Andy ♥♥♥♥'s fanbase.

I give this game a 5 out 10 because although I did not like that this was a sequel to Aliens, I did get a few good laughs at how buggy the A.I was and that of all things kept me pretty entertained!

reviewText:
This game was horrible. Buggy AI, nerfed guns, and absolutely nothing like the trailers you may have seen three or four years ago. Co-op is even worse than single player, with glitchy pathing and net code. Multiplayer is pretty much dead. Steer clear of it, even if it goes on sale.

Having been Mplayers King Of the Kill for three years in AVP Gold in the 90's, this entire game was such an immense let down for me, that I struggled to find any redeeming quality to it.

I found none.

reviewText:
4.5/10

Pros:
- Decent weapon selection
- Fun flashlight
- EXPLOSIONS

Cons:
- Uncanny valley errywhere
- The story is relevant somewhat, but there were multiple times where it was lacking A LOT (end game)
- Pulse rifle can be annoying to listen to after a long time
- Animations are dumb sometimes
- Melee system isn't as broken as other games but still had it's frustrating as ♥♥♥♥ times

Overall can't recommend getting this game unless you get it for free from a friend. In that particular case, your friend went full ♥♥♥♥♥♥. The beginning was pretty intense and actually fun as ♥♥♥♥, however about halfway through it just got boring and felt like it was rushed.

In total it took me and a mate to beat it in ~5 hours on normal difficulty.

reviewText:
Feb 13 2013
Aliens: Colonial Marine. First impressions when launching - there is hope for something smooth and cold about the screen that first launches before you press to play the game. The intro begins and the facial animation seems a generation behind. I work my way into the ship and computer consoles aren't even readable - Duke Nukem era! Graphically this may have been toned down to provide smooth play even on lower end machines. I hope for a graphics overhaul in an upcoming patch or that the GIGS of data somehow includes it. My little handheld motion detector has proven mostly useless so far .... [this was 20 minutes of play, SP campaign]

Continued: Saw a few glitches with terrain during the next bit of single player. The audio seems ok enough, but having a hard time with the level of detail that's really needed to immerse yourself in the SP experience. The scripted AI for some of your fellows seems a bit weak and most of the time aliens ignore your AI side and come for you. The co-op with friends and multiplayer must be the saving grace of this title. As is, so far, 5/10 for average but certainly not stellar.

reviewText:
I removed my recommendation for this game.  All in all, I'm not filled with rage over this release the way some people are.  I like the graphics, I've had fun with the gameplay co-op with my fearless forever adventure buddy.  I'm glad I got it, I'm glad we're playing it.

But this game could have been a LOT better, and should have been.  For such a long wait, they owed us a far better story with much more attention to detail.  The shortcuts taken in this game are unforgivable for such a major title.  Aliens: Colonial Marines should not be applauded, nor the studio rewarded for their effort.  I actually wish I'd pirated this game instead of paying for it.

I pre-ordered this game after seeing E3 in-game footage" that later turned out to be a complete fabrication
date: and nothing like the finished product.  This represents dishonesty on the part of the publisher
recommended: and many of the publishers involved here have earned a black mark in their reputation from me.\n\nI will NOT be buying Borderlands 2
hoursPlayed: because credible scuttlebutt indicates that Aliens got shortchanged in development due to focus on BL2.  I vote with my dollars
voteText: and I will be quite wary of future offerings from Gearbox - if I buy any at all."

reviewText:
Rating: 4/10
There is too much to be said about this game. If you haven't heard already, Aliens: Colonial Marines maybe one of the biggest failures this year. While the graphics aren't so terrible, and the environments are beautiful, the gameplay of this work resembles what would be an Aliens game made by Infinity Ward and Activision. Yes, this is the Call of Duty of the Aliens franchise. The player is put in the role of Cpl. Christopher T. Winter, a grunt in the USCM. The entire game is an investigation mission that is full of plot holes and paradoxes that conflict with the story from the films that are even acknowledged within the dialogue, but pushed aside by unjustified reasons. If you are not a super fanatic like some, or if you have not seen the movies, the plot in this game may not be so big of a deal.

In the single player gameplay, you'll find that Call of Duty feeling being revealed in that first, your enemies aren't really xenomorphs at all, they are just lemmings in Halloween costumes. They don't behave anything like a xenomorph really does or how they did in the demo (which is entirely absent from the actual game), being that they hardly use the walls or ceilings as strategic surfaces, and they just run at you not trying their gift of natural stealth at all. This calls for some strange thoughts later on when you realize that you've just mowed down over two hundred of these things that killed a squad of twelve marines without losing many numbers other than to automated turrets. It's also due to the stupidity of these enemies that even a new player could go through the whole campaign on Ultimate Badass mode without being very challenged.

Second, only three levels of the ten are spent fighting aliens, in the game of the Aliens title. Why is this? Because the other six are focused on fighting Weyland Yutani mercenaries. It really breaks down to being three levels of xenomorphs, three levels of mercenaries, three that are a mix of the two, and the rather disappointing boss battle" level at the end. The replayability is nearly pointless
date: as there is no choices or different outcomes to be experienced
recommended: and so the only benefit is going back is for achievements (much like Call of Duty)
hoursPlayed: and to complete single player challenges to unlock marine customization pieces.\n\nI can really only award points to the competitive multiplayer game modes. The weapon and character customization of the player's multiplayer marine and three aliens gives some fans one of there virtual fantasies in being able to do so
voteText: and on top of that the aliens are acutally difficult as they should be when controlled by other players. The maps are well constructed and the game modes are entertaining
helpfulPercent: so it deserves good points there
votesHelpful: but the multiplayer just cannot make up for the rest of the game. I would reccomend buying this game on a sale if you have the patience."

reviewText: The co-op might be considered fun, if you're in an extremely generous mood.  Unfortunately, you'll still be left with the feeling that you were cheated out of your money as it's clear that this game was very poorly planned and executed by all parties involved with its development.  The further you advance through the game, the easier it is to see that they progressively cared less about delivering a quality product and more about simply meeting their deadline.  It's not unlike a 10-page essay written by an extreme (but slightly charming and able) procrastinator who uses double-spacing and 16 pt. font to make it look like a 10-page essay, and then proceeds to forget to check the spelling and grammar.\n\nIt's likely that this game will leave you feeling quite bitter, since you can catch glimpses of all the potential that this game had which is, in the end, all completely wasted.

reviewText: Overall 3/5\n\nDated textures. Jerky animations. Clipping models. Convoluted storyline. Bugged cutscenes. Terrible lighting. Horrible hit detection, especially in multiplayer. Bugged enemies, and animations. Multiplayer is a little more polished, with a wide range of appearance customization (my favourite,) for both Marines and Aliens. All Marine weapons are customizable, in skins, accessories, and secondary fire mechanics…But many of the options are repetitive between different guns, leaving the decent sized weapon roster feeling small and bland. Entire fight scenes, missions, and scenarios in trailers and screenshots are missing, or unfinished…One level worth playing, variation of Alien strains, and the fact that I’ve been a fan of the series since I was itty bitty are the only reasons I enjoyed the game at all.

reviewText:
I should have known better than to fall for the hype of a licensed game, even if the intellectual property was invented years ago.  Colonial Marines didn’t have to be perfect, it just had to be ok, the prospect of 4 player co-op story is always enough to keep a game afloat if it is at least half way decent.  Aliens is boring with awful A.I and uninspired gameplay, inspired by the wonderful films from the 90s.  The biggest shame of all is how many times I tried to play it for the sake of completion and couldn’t find anyone online to play with.

In short, the community is a totally dead and the game is sub-par at best.

Should you buy this?

Not even in a steam sale unless you have 3 other friends willing to help you lower the bar.

reviewText: I purchased this game for the Xbox 360 on launch, Premium edition. I dare say that this game is the bane of gaming existence. Since its release the game has been a laughing stock on such sites as reddit, ♥♥♥♥♥, Gamefaqs, Tumblr, and even 4square. Enemies go through walls, Instructions are unclear, and sometime objectives don't spawn, which in turn makes you replay entire levels. The Acid blood is glitch as hell and the story is so sad it could be filed under fanfic. Gearbox isnt a bad company,they just keep getting dealt bad cards. Duke Nukem forever could never live up to its name and was set up to be horrible, and Aliens colonial marines was rushed so hard by SEGA it was made a new game type in Generic war shooter 2014" (Not to be confused with the more popular rehashed "generic shooter of terrorists 2014"). Over all I think this game should be purged from the face of the earth and only see use as coasters for your bevs.\n\nMy opinion means nothing though

reviewText:
Do not buy this game.

This feels like it could have been so much more than what it is. It could have explored the Colonial Marines and their lives and struggles in contrast to what we see in the films.

Another case of putting little into a brand name to make some cheap cash. So sad.

reviewText:
//The following is multiple excerpts from a journal recorded by a lost Marine on the VLV Steam spacecraft, only recently discovered on a backlog cleaning. Viewer discretion is advised.\


AUG 30th, 2013: Wow! Colonial Marines is 75% off! I know how much hate it's received, but.. I gotta see this for myself.

AUG 31st, 2013: The multiplayer is decent. Not anything special, but it's fun. Different alien classes, different weapons and tactics for the marines.. frequent level-ups and weapon attachments to unlock. Not that bad at all, and I've only touched team deathmatch.

OCTOBER 5th, 2013: I finally... I finally jumped into the single player. I don't know the time. How could I? After playing this game, it's amazing that I still have my sanity intact. Only 30 minutes played, but that was... that was a challenge I wasn't expecting.

It all started fine, man! Sure, the graphics weren't great, but it was a cool start. Just walking down that space hallway, then it happened. I found that guy, wrapped up in some weird organic mush on the walls. I started to pry him off.. and an alien jumped me! It freaked me out.

But that wasn't the problem. It.. it ran away. My motion tracker told me it was around the corner, but I couldn't see anything! I reloaded my gun and carefully tip-toed down the hall.. AND THERE IT WAS MAN! JUST SITTING THERE FACING THE OPPOSITE WALL! I screamed and threw my controller down, running out of the room in a panic-- if the very first alien had AI as awful as this, what did that mean for the rest of the game!?


OCTOBER 6th: I tried again. I killed the beast and continued playing. We got to the hangar and that was a pretty cool scene. Marines yelling and having to defend the doo--oh.. that.. alien... oh, oh God. The animation on it locked up! IT SLID RIGHT AT ME THROUGH THE OBSTACLES IN THE MAP! OH GOD, OH GOD NO HELP ME JESU-- //transmission lost//


NOVEMBER 1ST: ABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORT
ABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORT
ABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORT
ABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORT

reviewText:
This game is janky as hell. I was so hyped up and such a fan. Seeing the end result of this really makes me wish they just gave the project to someone else or canned development of Borderlands 2 to focus on this. (And I enjoyed my time with Borderlands 2, but I'm a way bigger fan of Aliens)

Like, holy ♥♥♥♥ what happened Gearbox? The single player campaign is sort of a mess. ♥♥♥♥♥♥ AI and awful textures. Everything feels so rushed. (it probably was) Also an unanswered plot hole introduced by the game. What in the world? This game really could have been so much more...

Multiplayer is slightly buggy but for the most part quite fun to play and probably it's only redeeming quality. You can customize your loadouts and appearances, although loadout customization for Marines isn't anything special outside of changing your gun's alt-fire. I just like being a Colonial Marine. Give this a month or so and I predict multiplayer to be mostly dead unfortunately. Time will tell.

There is a lot of other stuff that people give this game ♥♥♥♥ for like.... new alien breeds, weapon modifications like reflex sights and voice acting, which you know, to each their own, but didn't bother me. In fact I think it's really just people nitpicking, but whatever. Either way this game is still... not good as a whole product. It's not like the worst thing ever, but it's probably around a 4-5/10 score overall.

Everyone is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ on this game and in a way, rightfully so (This game got hyped up like crazy by Gearbox) but as an Aliens superfan, I still enjoyed my time with this game. It's a shame that this game is in such shambles because I fear this might mark the end of Aliens video games (not counting Aliens vs Predator, but ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ I don't care about Predators and would rather they drop that franchise)

If you are a Alien superfan (particularly if you ever had any interest in extended universe stuff), consider getting this at a very cheap sale price, otherwise you may want to pass.

reviewText: To start off about what was good about the game, the single player campagin was quite fun and a bit challenging even at moderate difficulty. There were times where the suspense was really high and I got startled several times by things creeping around in dark corners. There was the level system that worked perfectly into unlocking weapons and made one want to kill aliens and accomplish achievements to get the experience points to unlock new guns a modifications. And finally, being a fan of the Alien franchise, my inner fanboy squeeled with delight for being able to walk around places I knew from Cameron's Aliens movie.\n\nAnd now for the bad. I'm pretty sure I got the game at a point where all the patches were already pre-installed into the game but it did not make a lot of things better. The graphics were buggy and I adjusted the brightness several times throughout my playthrough. If it wasn't the graphics, certain aspects of the game were still buggy. Sometimes, things would get caught in the walls and I had one crash of the game happen to me. Also, whenever I exited the game, it would just start itself back up again no matter how many times I had to close it. But I think the worse part was that I wasn't able to do multiplayer. Not because it didn't work, but because of bad design and hardly any player base. There is no server list; you are able to select a mode of play and a map and then the game searches for other players who want to play the same mode and map. Problem is there was no one playing and the game required a complete roster of players for the game mode before it started. This was all very frustrating as the multiplayer features had been the primary reason I had purchased the game. I found some groups on steam who organized themselves for multiplayer play on the game. I suppose one could have been able to play multiplayer through that. But I was just frustrated I couldn't play it under normal circumstances so I discontinued playing it and probably won't ever pick it up again.

reviewText:
I got this since it has come down heavily in price since it first came out and while I was harsh on it when it first came out I can see it in a new light. It's not a bad game by any means but it is rather bland and adds nothing new. If anything it's a cookie cutter FPS game.

The story line is all over the place and laced with plot holes. If anything the DLC even adds more rather than fixing some. Also these shooty shooty bang bang type dudebro marine type games really miss the whole point of the alien series at heart.

However the game has been patched since it's problematic release in 2013 which fixes a lot of issues and with the help of mods you can really polish things up and bring it a little closer to the demo. I'd recommend the cilitbng pack, ENB/Sweet FX mods and Aliens Survival Experience. There's also some great add ons and multiplayer mods that really overhall the experence for online play with more in the pipes.

I do think gearbox should have put out an SDK or modding tools to win back some of the playerbase as well as trust but thats wishful thinking anyway.

If you are a diehard fan of the alien series you may get some enjoyment out of this, patched up and with some mods it can be fun and it's not badly priced as well.

positives
*Fairly decent FPS game.
*Multiplayer can be fun.
*With some mods it can be polished up a bit.
*Good price.
*It does capture some elements of the second movie.

Negatives
*Textures are really meh at times.
*Storyline is a mess and full of plot holes.
*Can be bland at times and really drags out.

reviewText:
so after spending almost 3 hours
my first impressions is this,

-1st.. what's up with winter's stamina?? he's a trained marines and he can only sprint for like what, 5 to 7 seconds???... i'm fat, and even i can run longer than that

-2nd ....thanks to the patches, it's now worth to play....with your friends on co-op at least
why? the enemy AI is always aiming at you no matter what you do.. yes.. even when you're hiding behind cover and you have 2 of you allied AI beside ypu.... they'll keep shooting at you until wits end, so you need at least 1 more human friend to help you, luckily this game can do 4 players co-op if i'm not mistaken

-3rd......you can still solo this game, but you have to be one of the most patience person in the world as 1 engagement on solo play, could last about 10 or so minutes, just wiping 3 to 5 enemies

final thoughts : this game has gone through lots of fixes, and i think it works. but is it worth for the asking price? i say barely you can grab it anytime, but, if you're still unsure grab it when it's on sale

overall i'll score this 8/10

reviewText:
First off I'm giving this game a thumbs up but not because it's good, it's not that good, considering that the game only got released last year it looks about 4-5 years out of date (which apparently it is cause it took so long to make), the storyline is not that great and the voice acting (especially from Hicks) is pretty terrible. The reason I am giving it a thumbs up is purely because of how much the game has improved since it was released. The Alien AI is now pretty good bar a few times where they seem to stop a few metres in front of you for a few seconds before they attack again, also they seem to at least attempt to get behind you or climb walls and ceilings to avoid your fire. Unfortunately the only time they jump into vents and stuff seem to be all scripted events. There were even a few moments when the Alien's genuinely scared the crap outta me and the sewer mission where you had no weapons to defend yourself was pretty terrifying, I just wish they had used that a little more.
The sound design is also very good, the weapons all sound like they should and so do the aliens. The level design is decent as well, moving from spaceship to planet to colony to alien ship and back again kept the experience quite fresh and interesting and kept the story moving forward at a decent pace.

So for me the major flaw here is the graphics quality, it does look very old for a 2013 game and I wouldn't consider spending more than a tenner on it but if your like me and wanted to play it just to see if it was as bad as everyone has been saying then I think you will be plesantly surprised.

I would rate this as a 6.5/10 but would have been much higher if the francise had been given the love it deserved.

reviewText:
This review is for single player and coop. [Steam, or whoever, please stop ruining games by making Russian language only for certain regions. Just because some Russians live in my country does not mean we do not speak English and will tolerate piece-of-sh***t translations and dubbing; Spent lots of hours searching on forums on changing this game's language - no option in settings].

This game is actually much better than its scores and completely worth the $2/$3 that it cost during the sales. It has been fixed and having finished the stasis interrupted dlc and first three chapters, I did not encounter any bugs mentioned in reviews (such as the funny one on rock paper shotgun), so they must have fixed a lot of things. Even if I see an alien stuck into the ceiling, I will assume that is realistic too because if one is coming out of walls and ceilings, there is a chance they could get stuck (especially with a full stomach).

Graphics: Maps are well-designed, cut scenes are okay and aliens are not bad (not that different from Dead Space 3 when you come to think abou it). It helps to remove the film grain, turn down brightness and crank up all the settings to max (with sync frame on). The flashlight is a bit weak. 7/10

Controls: at first they are a bit clunky and it is hard to learn how to switch between weapons but after some getting used to, they are okay. The tracker is very very useful to track the aliens in the dark. Checkpoints really suck, in some places you have to run through things until the next checkpoint. 8/10

Sounds: Voice acting is okay and not terrible in fact; can't expect marines to sound like TV presenters; they should have normal voices; environment sounds are alright too; everything works well in my 5.1 surround sound set-up. Aliens sound better than Halo CE grunts. 8/10

Story: story is average but enough to keep the game going; helps to play statis interrupted dlc first. 6/10

3D: I am playing this game in 3d using tridef's AVP profile; there are some slight fluid lines when you aim down the sights but with the laser sights on it does not matter much. 8/10

COOP: Tried it in coop campaign with a friend and the story and cut-scenes are well integrated into gameplay. It does not feel like empty maps (as some co-op games feel nowadays). 8/10

reviewText:
They're coming out of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ walls!


Colonial Marines was a game I followed the development of after the first announcement. Hell, I think half the gaming community in the world were patiently awaiting Colonial Marines for three long years with bated breath. Would Colonial Marines be THE Aliens game?

Could we finally relive those tense silver screen moments many of us saw well before we were truly old enough to watch something like Aliens? In short, yes but Colonial Marines defiently falls short of what was promised and what was hyped over those three years.

I wanted to like Colonial Marines.

I really did. And in a sense it has been enjoyable. I've been playing it on co-op with mates and it's been good. The biggest gripe I guess from all of us has been the story itself.

The story starts well enough. You're a Colonial Marine that is woken from cyro, the last of your regiment. Everyone else has been enjoying the corpse party aboard the Sulaco and came face to face with the Alien menace. Many a Marine has been lost and used to increase the enemy ranks.

But this is just another day in the Corps. You strap up your armour, tie on your boots and throw on that brain dome of a helmet and slap a magazine into your rifle. We've got ourselves a bug hunt.

The opening is enjoyable and exploring the Sulaco is a feast for the eyes of the avid Aliens fan. And the first mission is what you  expect, kill the Aliens, save your friends and try not to get hugged...

Then the game introduces our friends from Weyland Corps, building us a better future by all of a sudden amassing an army of PMCs. I wanted Colonial Marines to be like the movie, low on ammunition, low on allies but with an abundance of enemies. I just wanted to walk those corridors with my motion track glued to my face waiting for that dreadful contact tone...

Overall Colonial Marines is a game worth playing as an Aliens fan alone and is an enjoyable game when played with mates. However, as a shooter Aliens doesn't bring anything new to the table but it doesn't have any real short falls in terms of a basic shooter.

reviewText:
I'm a bit confused why everyone hates this game so much?  Maybe because I got it way after its release so all the patches and what not have fixed whatever problems there were.  The game itself is a fanboy's absolute wet dream, having watched Aliens about a milion and 2 times I love all the references.  The gameplay is a bit twitchy but to be honest I've always hated the UT3 engine with a passion.  Its a crap engine, especially for FPS games.  The weapons are perfectly modeled and the sound effects are straight ripped from the film.  I actually find the Aliens themselves way better than previous AVP games as the don't move like ants and when you shoot them they don't just shatter into pieces.

All in all an awesome movie licence with great atmosphere and tons of upgrades and silly addons for your weaponry.  The biggest downside is : UT3 Engine, so twitchy and overall never works properly.  And Gearbox. I HATE borderlands, even bought the retail game of the year edition and hated it so much I wanted to use it as a drink coaster, so I'm actually GLAD that other companies took over and finished the game.

Its like playing the movie.  All I need is Bill Paxton saying Game over man
